reviews.review_body: Laptop came with correct hardware. This was a sealed box shipped from an Acer address. I was worried about some of the recent negative reviews. After receiving and starting up the unit, everything is working fine. Doing syncs and transfers now. Came with all listed specs. 2021 model. 4 star because this simply isn’t a 5 star laptop. I didn’t want to pay $1000+ for one of those though. If you’re looking for a good value and a decent computer with plenty of storage, look no further.
Every day use.

I'm totally pleased with this laptop. It wasn't packed with bloatware. Setup was quick and easy. Performance is great. At this price level one learns to not expect too much, but this laptop is surprisingly fast and the monitor is crisp and the color nicely balanced. I'd recommend this laptop to anyone.

Two years from the date of purchase, this laptop made a grinding noise and the blue screen of death appeared. Had it looked at by an expert and it's toast.  Light use for two years and it's worthless now means I'm not buying an Acer product again.

Now why you ask is this a "great buy"? Simply put space, space and more space. You see when I was shopping for a computer at first the main thing, I was looking for was a glossy screen (this computer doesn't have one) and I really wanted that until I saw 1TB SSD then that Glossy want went right out the window. I wanted something nice with space 953GB (I think) that I could afford at the time without breaking the bank and I found it in this. PS. And the screen still shows a great picture without the GLOSS....HA!

So I bought this because I was looking for a reasonably priced computer with a big hard drive but wanted a solid state drive instead of the old type. This has 1TB of space which is a good start for me ?? It’s light weight but has a metal shell, so I don’t have to worry as much about another screen cracking mysteriously (I had 2 laptops that became unusable because the screens mysteriously broke on both of them within a 2 month period). The computer is super fast and even though it says it’s only 1080p I swear it looks as good as my 4K TV.

Now for the cons:
The track pad is positioned on this to where I am constantly clicking it and getting the right click pop up menu, which is annoying but I’m sure if I make adjustments it will be fine. It doesn’t have a DVR for reasons unknown but it seems that a lot of newer computers don’t come with one which can be annoying at times since I have a million and one DVRs laying around, everything  from movies to custom music “mixtapes” I’ve made through the years but it’s not a deal breaker or anything. For the price with the 1 TB SSD and the other things I was specifically looking for, it was a pretty good deal. The days of $300 laptops with everything you could want are over as precious minerals needed to make them become more scarce. Hopefully this will last me at least as long as my last one did which was around 8 years until my screen broke ??
Great laptop. This replaced one I bought in 2009. Will always buy Acer. Performance and longevity are the best. Highly recommend.

reviews.review_body:
I don't see what the big deal is with ThinkPads, just a bit expensive for what you get, IMO. Everything seems to be okay. I purchased this for a customer of mine who really wanted a ThinkPad.

My only concern is the Kioxia brand SSD it has. Apparently Kioxia is an offshoot of Toshiba. Toshiba products, IMO, are junk low cost brands that don't last long. I've had numerous hard drives of theirs die throughout the years, and recently got a dead M.2 SSD of theirs too.

For how much you pay for this laptop, they could have at leave included a Samsung Pro SSD or something a little more mid to upper class. So far it runs Windows 11 very well.

I bought it for college. It is not touchscreen, looks way older than a 2022 one. I left it to charge all night and day yet when I came back from work it was still at 1% battery. After the second time turning it on it never again connected to my house wifi.

We purchased this computer for my 9yo birthday. I didn’t want to get a chrome book because I preferred the option of him being able to work offline doing word processing and voice recording. Unfortunately we could not even figure out how to require a password for him to access the internet. However, I finally figured out how to set up kids mode for web browsing and got all his favorite websites easily accessible and more easily control the content he can see online. Unfortunately he couldn’t even watch simple videos without the computer freezing or spontaneously shutting down. It is PAINFULLY slow. Not the internet but the computer itself. Simply opening up a file takes forever. This is not worth the Money at all. Thankfully we are within the return window so we can hopefully find a better option.

Difficult getting it to stop glitching/freezing up/rebooting, not due to anything I installed because I had hardly gotten started on the thing (and I used to work in IT so I have some troubleshooting skills/knowledge.) Shouldn't have to deal with this many issues right out of the box. Returned it and chose something else.

Well this is the second Asus laptop outboard it's better but I still find that it freezes at time and it should not be doing that and it's only 3 weeks old I want to return it but that means I have to take all my programs off and redo it all over again That's the part that I hate having to take the time to reprogram these things

Very good computer. Definitely a good upgrade from my previous laptop. Perfect for basic home/school/business use.

I was pleasantly surprised by how much I am loving my new Asus! I read a few mixed reviews but I don’t get the negativity. I think the screen quality is much better than they claimed when watching videos or movies. While most of my computer time consists of using Microsoft Office programs, I have put it through the paces. I’d also like to add what a relief it was using Amazon. I had tried purchasing a computer through NewEgg because some of my more tech-obsessed friends insisted I should. What a nightmare!!! Next time I will trust my gut and stick with Amazon! They’ve never let me down!!!
Slow motion. Picture is not good enough.

I've been loyal to Asus- I don't know why but I have. I bought a nice ROG laptop in 2014, a Zenbook in 2019, and this VivoBook in 2021. I didn't even game on the ROG, just browser tabs, excel, spotify, etc. running and the thing has just always been slow and  nonresponsive. None of these computers perform, and I'm just doing simple tasks on them. I built my own PC back in college in like 2006 that booted up faster than these things, and there is an issue with the CPU being maxed out often at odd times. I'm an old techy so I've gone through all the updates, settings, etc. and I'm just not happy at all- I can't believe these products are performing this poorly in 2022. I'm going back to a desktop.
review_topics: Asus- I don't know why but I have

reviews.review_body: Love the speed and large screen.  For gaming its great.

The laptop included the upgrade to 20GB Ram and 512GB + 1TB ssd's. The computer is new so it's fast. The keyboard layout was easy to adapt to. There is bloatware but it hasn't gotten in my way yet and with the system resources the thing has it may be a while until I notice it.

The two downsides that I have seen at this point is the battery life. I run it on the high performance setting because, well, that's what I bought it for. It gets about 3.5 hours of battery before a warning with a fast shutdown.

The most surprising issue with this laptop is the identification of the keys. They aren't lighted and the color used for the letters and symbols is indistinguishable from the key in all but the most limited lighting situations. If you know your way around a keyboard without having to look for keys this isn't such a big deal but it is annoying.

Battery life however is short at about 3.5 hours if not using the lower performance settings.
I like the laptop but the keys are all but invisible.

It is exactly what I needed.  The larger screen makes it much easier to use a split-screen view when working in multiple documents/spreadsheets. I stream video through my laptop as well, and the graphics and sound are excellent. The laptop even has better connection speeds with my home wifi (why that would be, I do not know, but it's true).

*I am reviewing this item for a 90-day warranty extension from Asus*

First... 17.3 Screen with IPS... Great color, clarity and size... I changed the resolution to 1600x900, works better for my eyes. With two cores and 4 threads I was not expecting much... but It's faster than my Intel I3 Desktop with 4 cores and 4 threads. A nice surprise... I'm thinking the 12GB of ram, 256 SSD (1-TB HDD) with the Ryzen 3 3250U chip made the difference. Photoshop Elements works like a charm and web-pages just snap into place. I don't do games, so can't speak to that. And last, this is my first ASUS computer, I'm impressed with the quality, fit and finish and the price was right. Happy with purchase.

Update 4.14.21... Business and home users should be happy... Everything about the computer is good, and the screen is great. A good everyday computer, that gets the job done. / I found some keyboard stickers on Amazon for $5. Makes the keyboard easy to see.

reviews.review_body:
NOTE: This review concerns the product I received and not the entire laptop model itself.

I think I received a lemon. The laptop came in but the second we turned it on, it began overheating like crazy. It was so hot that I had to place something over my lap because I couldn't bear the heat. Later, when I plugged in the charger, the laptop screen tinted yellow. We immediately went to the Microsoft store and got a replacement.

Our replacement is really nice. Despite the mishap, I'm really happy about this laptop. It's super light, incredibly fast, and really stylish.
I have had this laptop only a few days. I bought this mostly for work as I use Microsoft office quite often.  I absolutely LOVE it. My old one was an Asus Chromebook. I'll never go back!

It's a truly awesome laptop both in design and in performance. I love using it. Highly recommend this over its closest rival XPS 13. If only the screen could flip over so that Surface Pen could be used to full potential, the usability would have magnified. Nonetheless, I recommend it to everyone who want quality and performance.

Have had this for 7 months and have already had to replace the charger (just stopped working gradually after about 5 months), and the screen often blinks for no reason. To add insult to injury re: battery issues, the battery life is way shorter than advertised even when very few programs are running. I've always had Macbooks and thought this would be an equivalent/possible improvement - and really wanted to like it - but between Windows 10 being meh and these hardware issues I'll be switching back.

The alcantara keyboard also darkens over time where your hands sit.

I use this product to do school work mostly and it has been perfect for my use thus far. It is fast, stores data well, I can easily switch between applications and touch screen makes it easy to do readings.

So far, I’m loving just about everything. The screen has a beautiful clarity and a perfect size. It’s slim, yet sturdy and everything works smoothly. My only issue is facial recognition doesn’t consistently work, so I just use a good old fashion password. It runs smooth and everything is great!

I've had it three months, and it has been glitchy and inconsistent the whole time. It doesn't consistently start up without being plugged in (yes, it is charged). Now it has started turning off without warning. As a matter of fact, right now it is fully charged. If I unplug it, it will just turn off, not shut down, just turn off. When it's on and working, great! The battery life has been great as well -- on the occasions that I've been able to use it unplugged.  I work with people who love their Surface laptops. I am fairly frustrated. I'm a user, not very technical.
This is a laptop I will use for years.  It has been extremely reliable for me and still performs at top speed, love it!!

I read a lot of bad reviews, mine came in perfect condition, exactly what I ordered. I am using it writing the review right now lol

The color is so beautiful, I love it. I got the burgundy one.
Good computer but on my laptop all sites ask me to turn on java and i cant find it i dont know if there something wrong with it or its me that dont know how to use it

This laptop looks great, light weight and has a great screen.  However, every time I'm busy working and searching it freezes up on me.  I have to shut the computer down completely because the restart button doesn't work, it just takes me through a crazy loop.  This happens often and it's very frustrating.

Love it so far. I've only had it for about two weeks - but it works well. I'm pleased with the laptop - boots FAST - pretty easy setup.  Light weight is nice and I purchased a docking station and hooked it up to my specialty keyboard and mouse.  Added a 34" monitor and all works great so far!

Its super light super handy and of course its a microsoft!! I love everything about this laptop and the color so I am reviewing it according to my taste and opinion, it all depends on every person how it will fit them. I use it for work because my employers are super super cheap wont provide work laptops!!
Screen quality is poor. The colors are too reddish. Another concern it that there is only one USB port.

Battery life is not as advertised of up to 14 hours (6 hours is the MAX battery life). Very disappointed. We have made every attempt to increase the battery life by adjusting the screen brightness to minimum, turned off the wifi and bluetooth, yet we can't exceed 6 hours of battery life.

Be Very Cautious.

Not sure why people are giving this bad reviews. I personally love this laptop. Very high quality and super light weight. On top of that, it looks darn sexy. This laptop is more attractive than me. Also very fast. I use some heavy software and it does a fantastic job. Overall very happy

I love this laptop. Although it's two generations behind, it meets my needs very well as I mostly use it for school (no gaming). It's really fast and the typing experience is by far the best. Overall it's just excellent. I'm never getting a Mac again.

Love this laptop.

I had a Surface Pro, but hated it due to the small screen size, small battery, and substandard keyboard. This laptop takes all the best features of the Surface Pro and adds to it. Sleek and slim form factor. Spectacular screen. Good battery life. The only slight knock is a lack of ports, but this isn't an important factor for me.

Excellent build quality. I have absolutely no reservations about the Surface Laptop. I think its better than the Surface Book I own. Microsoft got it right on this one.

Positives: Fabric on top of the keyboard, quiet, all metal build, small and thin, fast.

Note: I would suggest upgrading it to Windows 10 Pro from Windows 10 S. Its currently free to this at this time.

I bought this laptop around October of 2019. Reading all of the great reviews, I was so excited to buy this laptop. When I saw the case, I could already tell, it was going to be a great laptop. However, I shouldn't of judged the book by its cover. For a few days, it was working like a regular laptop would. I thought that it would bend back all the way with the touchscreen, but I was fine with that. I played games. I did business. I took care of my computer. However, in November, It starts to fail. My gaming slows down, business is harder to run, EVERYTHING. I still use this laptop, and I will use it to the fullest, however. I won't be buying another one of Microsoft's laptops (I will buy the Microsoft processor however, lol.) again. To all that hate my comment, I wont reply to any of them, and I have no feelings against those comments. Sorry Microsoft, I didn't want you to disappoint me like this.
This is an amazing laptop the only reason I didn't give it 5 star is because the GHz is 2.50 when the description said 4 GHz

This was a very disappointing purchase, after setting up all of the initial stuff, which was fairly easy the computer started an update, I get that this is common and proceeded to add email information, sync some other things, etc.  the screen resolution was amazing and I truly thought that I would enjoy this laptop....until I shut it down for the night, when I started it back up the next day I was unable to log in, my husband made several calls during the day while I was at work to see if it was something that could be fixed, we did a system reset and started the whole process of setting it up again....thought that two times would be a charm...boy was I wrong, exact same issue.  Google searches show that the problem we had is an ongoing issue with this system and there aren’t really any answers to help a novice like me to fix.  I have now returned it and decided to go with something that I know is reliable.
I paid US $ 1250 for this item and it didn't work without being plugged into the wall. this is a waste of money.
Market place sucks however much of things I actually use it for music and Microsoft word and movie watching is amazing ..nice sleek design as well
Great computer. Super fast, looks great. I wish it had more ports though. It was easy and free to switch to Windows 10 Pro. Overall though very happy with this laptop.
review_topics: ports input: This is my second K53SV from ASUS. My first one lasted about 11months before the NVIDIA card would no longer output to the screen. My second one (bought refurbished) only lasted 2 months before the motherboard fried and the NVIDIA card will no longer send to the screen. I have had numerous ASUS products and have been happy with them
this one is a disappointment. I am afraid to buy another ASUS because the newer models all have the NVIDA card in them. I will be searching for laptops with other graphic cards.output: ASUS K53SV

graphic cardsinput: The computer is VERY slow. I have had it for a couple weeks now and it is very frustrating. It takes it about 10 minutes to complete the start-up process once you turn it on. And once it is finally started up
it is very slow at opening websites and programs. I should be able to get on the internet and start searching within seconds on a new computer
but I often have to wait 30 seconds or more until it actually starts doing anything. I should also be able to open programs within seconds as well

but I often have to wait a minute or two before it actually opens. It is also VERY difficult to type on the keyboard. The keys are barely elevated so I have to look at the keys to make sure I am pressing the right ones.output: slow computer

reviews.review_body:
The laptop looks stunning, the burgundy color is just right, not too flashy not too dark, perfectly right. Besides the looks, the feel is also premium. Performance is enough for daily task: mail, excel, works, powerpoint, browsing etc...etc...
However my device got battery failure within 1 week, I contacted customer support and got replacement within 1 week however all my data is loss which is still quite frustrated.

First one I received fully crashed within 4 months, Microsoft has the worst customer service I've ever dealt with.  Amazon was great to deal with and sent a replacement, love the computer when its working, hopefully the second one lasts longer than 4 months

Actually my favorite part is the A I. Its Cortana from the game Halo. The first game I ever played when I was 10.
This laptop also has a lot of storage (SSD), a lot of memory (RAM) and the I7 processor so it is very fast.
It its aesthetically pleasing as well

I was hesitant to buy a laptop online and to buy a Microsoft laptop but I am so glad I did. This is by far the best laptop I have ever had. It runs smooth, has great features, solid construction, and is great to look at. I have had numerous people ask me about it and are considering buying one for themselves

When i fitst bought it. Did not turn on for 5 hours idk why. I was charging it and thought it was defect. But then turned on after and did not have problem. If you are looking to play game, press back button and look for something else. This is good for work purppse.and battery wise, like it said 10 hours plus, no. Maybe 5hours max. 4hours if u working on it.

The Surface Laptop is a great device.  Nice and light for traveling.  We use our often on the road.  No issues at all.  Streams easily through our phones when using them as a hot spot.  Form factor is perfect.  The keys are nice to type on - not too clicky, not too soft.

This is a great Windows laptop. I wish it had come with a little documentation (especially for how to take advantage of the free upgrade to Windows 10 Pro), but Microsoft support was able to take care of that for me. It feels and performs great. I had ordered a Dell XPS 13 2-in-1 with an i7 processor, and that got too hot to comfortably use in my lap on the sofa. The Surface laptop is perfect for me.

This is NOT NEW, they did a very passable job of refurbishing the item. But I have same computer for work and got mine new. There’s little packaging things that are off like a hair on the keyboard. There should be a piece of fitted cloth between the screen and keyboard and there would be a sticky plastic on the charger. I will probably keep it, I just wish it was as advertised

This really is an excellent product from Microsoft, proud owner of this machine since August 2017, never lets me down, incredible battery lifetime, totally silent and really thin! I've owned loads of laptops and this one tops them all. I also own the latest Microsoft Surface Pro (not the laptop) because I couldn't decide between these beasts. I really like them both, a really good hardware and overall goods products by Microsoft. They hit the sweet spot with these machines. Highly recommended!

Great value from Amazon Warehouse, but keep in mind your warranty period may be less than the full amount since the clock starts ticking from the time the device is first purchased.  This reminder should accompany all Amazon Warehouse items.  The laptop itself is brilliant - I love it.

I am accustomed to Apple products so my review may be biased.  I type on the Microsoft and sometimes it automatically retypes the word so I have to delete.  I never could figure out how to print from it even though my printer was inside it.  Folders are hard to find.  The mail list jumps around.  I love having the trash icon in the same box with the mail.

I was sceptical about whether or not I should be purchasing this laptop on a sale and with the reviews it had back then. Thankfully I did it and am loving the laptop. I've been using it for over 5 months now and there were no problems whatsoever. The package arrived when they said it would and with no problems or complications. I truly recommend the device.

Update: after 18 months of use. Had charger problems, then finally resolved by buying a few, then 10 days ago it became so slow to be unusable. I only used for browsing, no gaming, no high use programs. Did reset, looked on MS support, cleaned, defragged, you name it, it takes literally 2 or 3 minutes to load one website.

I loved this laptop until recent weeks when the charger (I thought) seemed to fail. Ordered a non MS replacement here and after a week that failed also, so I ordered the official MS version of the charger and after a few days that failed too. Now it's obvious there is something within the computer itself that is causing this, no way are all these chargers failing including the official one. Since it's four months since purchase seems I have no recourse! Do NOT buy this without getting some kind of warranty with it! There was no option for warranty when I purchased mine.

highlights: portability (this laptop is extremely lightweight!) and the screen resolution is phenomenal
lowlights: the intel i5 processor isn’t as fast as I would like it to be. it is especially slow on YouTube. the soft material feels nice but i’d rather have an aluminum material so i can clean it a lot easier.

I was searching online and on amazon for a reasonably priced, light weight, high quality laptop for school. When I came across this laptop I read through reviews and saw most of them were great! It arrived in a timely manner and I absolutely love it! It has been great so far, very happy with my purchase :) I would definitely recommend it to everyone who’s looking.

Amazing product, the materials are great. Feels that it is a premium quality.
The battery may disappoint you because in tech specs you can see that it will work 14.5 hours. As for me I couldn't get from it more than 8 hours.
It may heat if you will play games, then you need some additional cooling.
Also the screen ratio is 2x3 that is great for work. But for movies it may be not as wide as you would like.
Touch screen is great, very responsible. To keyboard and touch pad there is no complaints.
Nice and slender and meets my needs

Overall its been a good laptop. Working well. No hangs. But the charger has stopped working properly after only 6 months. I had heard from friends who had the charger problem with their microsoft laptops.

Overall it's a very nice laptop -- light, thin, with a very nice screen and a great keyboard. I'll just mention one downside: the i7 version gets HOT, uncomfortably hot to leave it on your lap (especially if you're wearing shorts!). I'll look for an option to slow the processor while I'm running it on battery, which might reduce the heat a bit without killing performance. All thin laptops have this issue, but just wanted to point it out.

battery life is about 6 hours, and it has a battery saving mode. Great for if you are on the go. The touch screen works really well, unless you get something on the screen. (It becomes unhappy, just clean it) The brightness setting is really useful, and the computer is super light. Makes school traveling much easier!
review_topics: great for if you are on the go

reviews.review_body:
I got the platinum version, and I won’t lie I thought the alcantara was dirty when it just came. Came to realize that the material does play tricks on your eyes causing you to think it’s dirty when it’s not.

Alcantara is a really unique touch but it gets dirty really fast, especially with oils/sweaty palms. Hard to clean, especially with that special illusion it’s little trickery. You’ll be there wiping it off for hours.

Cleaning isn’t as difficult if you use a cotton ball soaked in alcohol.

The laptop I received had some technical issues but it was promptly replaced. My grandson uses this for his online Zoom college classes and could not be happier with it. The touch screen is a huge plus and the weight & size are perfect to transport to and from class.  I highly recommend Micro Direct Deals for your laptop needs.

I got my first computer in 1985, a Kapro, and it was about as sophisticated as a World War 2 Jeep. The Microsoft Surface Laptop feels like I stepped into a Rolls Royce; compared to the Surface, everything else feels like a WW-2 Jeep. The touch screen is an incredible luxurious feature and it's amazing how Microsoft managed to get so much power into such a light and beautiful machine. As a writer, Its touch and overall performance brings out the creative spirit in me.

Still cant print, prints solid black page. Apparently a problem in Windows 10. Figured out how to print from my Android. Pretty soon wont use a laptop if they make it this hard to do simple functions.

I bought this laptop for school. and for the most part, it does its job. The only complaint I have is that because its a bit dated browsers like Chrome run slowly on it compared to newer laptops.
Also, a thing to note, check the specs of your laptop when you get it. I don't know if it is intentional but I have a feeling its more than likely just pure incompetence. But they will often send you a product with different specs than what you actually paid for.
Like if you paid for a laptop with a 3.1 GHz processor ($100 more in value) and all you get one with a 2.5 GHz processor.

This computer may be my favorite purchase from Amazon...ever!  I had a Microsoft Surface Pro for work for 4 years and decided to purchase this as a personal laptop.  I am extremely happy with this purchase.

P.S. - I wasn't at home when the delivery came, so I had to go to UPS to pick up my package.  A minor inconvenience for time, but it did give me some piece of mind that my package was not sitting on my front step all day.

I would have given it 5* review, however, the first one that I bought was defective. When I was setting up the PC, it got stuck on UEFI loop. Tried hard reboot many times but unsuccessful. Called the dealer about the issue, Luis was very good and helpful in resolving the problem. Got it replaced very quickly.

Was looking for an easy-to-use and straightforward laptop for my wife who has very general everyday use and this was perfect. It’s very light weight, compact, and great for non-tech savvy person. The laptop even came in brand new condition wrapped and boxed. It can get overwhelming searching the internet and even Amazon for a computer. The reviews are up and down and everyone has different preferences. This is a great product because it’s made by windows so you can trust it’s manufactured well like a MacBook would be.

This computer is AMAZING. the best computer I have ever owned. I was a little nervous about the mailing process after reading a few reviews but I decided to take a chance. They sent me the right computer and it was almost fully charged when it got to me so you know it wasn’t sitting around for too long. Every claim that Microsoft has made that I have read about this computer is true. Great computer to use for college. Holds a charge very well and runs pretty quickly. Very impressed.

I received my Surface laptop but waiting three weeks before using it as I was in the middle of a project on my old computer.  Three weeks into use, there was a hardware malfunction; the keyboard and mouse stopped working. Microsoft more or less willingly sent me a replacement and, after a 10 day wait, I was ready to go again. This time, however, the new machine came with an "S" code which means that ONLY MS software can be installed on it. The tech people insisted I run a diagnostic only AFTER which they admitted there was a software problem that they would need to fix. Timeline on that? Sometime between now and whenever. Meanwhile, critical non-MS software is unavailable to me. MS is very sorry for my inconvenience and lost work time and they will get back to me via email...someday.

Meanwhile, the third party who sold me this electronic piece of fecal material told me to go whistle because their return policy was only for 30 days. Not their fault although they should at least warn people about the problem.

Finally, there is only one USB port which is weird and annoying. This means I had to purchase and carry with me a dongle that supports additional ports. Also, the machine lacks niceties like a fingerprint sign on. I am a bit sorry I did not look more carefully at the specs. Of course, the specs would not have clued me in on the larger hardware and software problems.

I've been a devoted Windows user since the early 90s. In parallel, and in counterpoint, I've also cycled through countless Windows laptops over the years, including Compaq, HP and Dell, and often been disappointed with the longevity of the machines. I nevertheless retained my affinity for the Windows operating system---so much so that when I purchased a MacBook Pro last year, I partitioned the disk and continued operating under Windows 10. I therefore greeted news of the Surface Laptop this spring---with its sleek and unitary design, and integration with other Microsoft products---with great enthusiasm. At last, I thought, the hardware would rise to the level of the software. The Surface Laptop would be Microsoft's answer to Apple.

Alas, upon buying the machine (indeed, the highest-end model), I found myself severely disappointed.

First of all, it ran noisy and hot right out of the box. Second, I could not even obtain a full-screen display on a standard Samsung external monitor (a defect which could not be resolved through a lengthy call to Microsoft Tech Support). How could Microsoft overlook such a basic requirement?

After several hours of struggling I put the machine back in the box and returned it for a full refund. From Microsoft, I expected much better.

I am an intense user and the Surface Laptop is the best laptop I owned so far. Upgraded it to Win 10 Pro since I need a wide variety of software on the machine for professional use (Image processing, CAD, etc.). The upgrade was free and easy. The keyboard is very precise and comfortable, allowing for fast typing. Mouse and touch screen very accurate. The display is crisp with natural colors. Processor and SSD performance is ample. Beautiful detail solutions like the power supply plug and the additional USB charging port in the power supply add to the appeal. And the design is clean, minimalist, beautiful.
I hope I will have this laptop for a very long time!

First of all, the supplier did an excellent delivery job.
I was upgrading from a 12 year old laptop built for XP.  Going to the 1st Gen Surface Laptop was like going to the moon.  Once you get WIFI connected, be prepared for update mania.  You'll go from version 1709 updates, to 1803 and then 1903 with no problems.
Also, it will take a while for the battery to be fully charged.  I'm running on battery now to see how long it lasts.
FYI, mine came with the Pro version and the i7 7660U.

This is my favorite laptop I've ever owned! At $640.00 for a fully-spec'd and refurbished Surface Laptop, it's a steal considering a brand new one goes for about $750.00 as of 5/23/19. If you like doing light to moderate gaming but primarily use it for HD streaming, web development, remote work, or browsing, this is beautiful and comfortable laptop to work one with high battery life and a well above average price-to-power ratio.

Pros: Solid build, fancy color. Smooth keyboard and touch pad. Screen quality is amazing, sharp and bright. Speakers sound great. Everything feels pretty fast. Light as heck.
However:
- Not for gaming, only for work and school
- Need to switch out of Windows S mode
- Light-colored fabric can get dirty after using for a long period of time
- Sometimes it's not that fast (especially if you are extremely sensitive to lags). Maybe it's just me because I have had a strong gaming laptop before (and we all know that gaming laptop is really fast)

First of all I like design, it feels very smooth and keyboard is great. screen resolution is great, I like colors and laptop has wonderful sound, but it cant support CAD files as I expected. Its not for gaming too, I tryed Skyrim and it was lugging. Even though I like it and I think that It is a great price for this kind of laptop. Oh, once more: windows updates is killing me.

I put 5 for gaming but i don't game at all so idk but everything else is 5 star. I'm a nursing student and do photography and planning weddings and need my computer for literally everything. Great price, amazingly true to color, very lightweight and high quality. Fast with lots of storage. Links to my phone which makes things easy to track and fits in literally any bag and goes everywhere with me. I love this laptop. Best investment I ever made. Only down side is that i'd like a disk drive - CD - but I function without.

So it has been a year since I've bought this lovely product and it is by the far the best decision to buy. This laptop is a lot different than my previous one and a nice change.

The touchscreen is new to me and it's nice to play around with it, especially using it to do my signatures on documents and papers. The battery life is excellent and the performance has been awesome. It's also thin enough to fit with your books and binders in a school bag.

The only issue that I have with it is the lack of certain USB ports like a USB-C slot.

I purchased the i7, 8GB RAM, and 256GB memory. The laptop is lighter than my previous Surface, the Surface 1st Gen. The quality of the keyboard is much nicer than the first generation so there's definitely been a lot of upgrades. I love the feel and the quality of the laptop. The battery lasts pretty long when I have multiple tabs open. Very short delay when starting up the surface. Very quick to shut down as well. The laptop restarts in about 20 seconds. Love how quick the laptop is when changing tabs despite having multiple programs open. All in all, I love this laptop and the price is even better.

Mine came with windows 10 pro, which is superb (no update needed).

The best thing ever! It’s worth every buck and I can finally work in a fast pace. I don’t think I’ll ever own another laptop again. I’m never a MacBook person person, and Microsoft totally rocked this one.

I went for 16gb ram for fast usage and it’s pretty speedy. I love the face recognition and haven’t used the touch screen yet.

Recently purchased a cover to protect which is something I highly recommend. This is a great investment laptop and for those who seek the best quality. I’ll choose Microsoft surface for life.

Decided to upgrade from a less powerful surface to this one, a bit unsure as linux had to be tweaked a bit but so far it's been awesome. Portable and cheap price compared to Mac but still a lot of power and if you are a linux fan there an available Kernel with just all you need. I've got docker, rails server, node server, Android studio and the devise simulator running with no harm. No sound, and the keyboard is really comfortable.  The texture adds an extra bit of comfort and the keystroke is perfect. Recommended if you looking for something light with a lot of power
review_topics: light with a lot of power

reviews.review_body: I have the cobalt blue, & have had it for several weeks, I couldn't be more impressed with this laptop! The screen is incredibly vibrant, sound quality is very nice, and lighting behind the keys is absolutely wonderful! The material on the keyboard is a nice touch as well, I wasn't so sure about it before my purchase, but once my package came, I learned to love it as well. The fact that this laptop weighs less than 3 pounds is also a huge bonus! The magnet that the power cord plugs is surprisingly strong too. Over all I give this product 5/5 stars

Battery broke in a 1.5 years and the only way to deal with it is to get a refurbished laptop exchange from Microsoft with a fee of $450... so I have a choice of either loosing all my personal loval data and getting another old laptop for a fee or pay about the same for data recovery and buy a completely new laptop .... in the meantime, microsoft chargers have been breaking every few months. Microsoft quality is not the best.

I was in the market for a new laptop, and had done some research on the best 13 in laptops.  The surface was always mentioned and got very high reviews....I just didn't want to spend  $1200.  The first Gen Surface Laptop went on sale a few weeks for under $800 and I decided I'd take a chance and order it.. Great purchase.  8GB of RAM 256 SSD...beautiful screen.  I know it has a fan, but I have yet to hear it.  Yes, it's lacking in ports, but for what I use it for its perfect...If you can find the 1st Gen at this price buy it, you won't be sorry.
review_topics: beautiful screeninput: This is my first ever laptop. I am very happy with it. It met all my needs and more. The first thing I noticed is the packaging. a very nice sturdy box. The fit and finish of the laptop is second to none. It is a nice deep beautiful dark blue. The width is good but is a little thicker than I would like it to be. The weight is fine. Very easy to navigate. Came with Windows 10 installed. This is the first laptop I have ever used so I am not sure if the battery life is good. It does say it last up to 9 hours. I only get 6 but this may be because I haven't figured out the settings properly. I also have not used the camera yet. The screen is absolutely beautiful! I love the touch screen and the touch pad. They both work very well and I have not had any problems. Honestly
I could not see buying anything else.output: beautiful dark blue

reviews.review_body: I have had no problems with this device and I like almost everything about it.  It is light and fast.  The keyboard is comfy.  the main reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that Microsoft insists on the proprietary power cord.  there is no way to use a portable battery charger. it is all or none,  It makes no sense.  At least they could supply a usb proprietary cable for external battery pack use.  Fortunately this is not a big problem for me but for some it could be a deal breaker. If you had to go more than a day away from a standard outlet you would be SOL.  UPDATE 4/2019  I found a power cord aftermarket that solve the problem.  I lowered the star rating because the camera is now malfunctioning and that is something I used a lot.  after 9 mmonths the camera should work.

I love this laptop. I was a little bit skeptical ordering off of Amazon and not directly from Microsoft but I was looking for a nice replacement to my old laptop. The quality of this laptop is AMAZING. The keyboard is a nice change from cold metal/plastic and feels like a quality product. Compared to other devices that I have used, the screen quality is one of the best for under $1000. I highly recommend this product if you're doing some light gaming (Sims, CS:GO, Etc.) and can run lightroom + photoshop with ease. I really do not have any complaints when it comes to this laptop. I will update in the future if anything happens!
review_topics: photoshopinput: After reading the reviews on Amazon for this product
I had high expectations. I purchased this item primarily to use for Android development
which has been excellent. The screen is huge and the resolution is great
but I am extremely disappointed in the battery life and boot speed. After fully charging the laptop up
it only lasts for about 4 hours on battery saver mode

with no apps open. The boot speed for the computer is also more than 15 minutes! I have done everything instructed on the websites and consumer support with no luck on improving these issues. I even tried a factory reset and it did not solve any of my problems!! I am now contacting customer support to see if I can send the laptop back
because it is unacceptable to advertise an item as having features that it clearly does not.output: Android development

reviews.review_body: Had this for about six months and so far it has been a great purchase. Very good display, responsive touch screen, good quality keyboard making typing very comfortable. The CPU is fast enough for casual use like web browsing, YouTube, Netflix, Photoshop, etc. Would not recommend for stuff like video editing or heavy gaming. The only issue was the charger that came with it, it's of terrible quality and stopped working for me after just 4 months of use and had to buy a new one. But, overall for the price this is a great product.

This is a Microsoft laptop.  The description says it comes with Windows and Office, two Microsoft Products.  One would think that it is just a 30-day trial subscription.  And, they want you on Windows 365 and Office 2016--the latest Microsoft items.  As a consultant, I need a computere that is on the same platform as my client.  Microsoft Customer Service tried to figure out how I could get Office 2010 versus 2016....regardless, when we were close to thinking we might be successful, I asked the representative to stay on the line to make sure it worked.  They hung up.  It didn't work.  Relied on my former IT husband to Google his way around the issues.  It is not a great sync with my dear beloved Mac.  I've been using HPs/Compacts in the last three jobs.  My parents have issues all the time with their Surface, I blamed it on old age.  They blame it on frequent updates and having to resolve issues because of the updates.  Go figure.

So far, one of the most beautiful computing devices I have owned so far. That's a real statement considering I have owned more than 15 laptops in the past decade.

The screen is a stunner, touchpad and keyboard are simply fantastic and the sound is surprisingly loud and clear. The ports leave a lot to be desired but isn't a deal breaker. Although I have yet to confirm true daily performance and battery life, so far it has been overwhelmingly positive. I only felt this when I had ordered the Dell XPS ultrathin but was quickly reminded of its deal breaking limitations.

You'll want to show this off and will equally enjoy using it as your daily driver. Definitely remember to use the free upgrade to Windows 10 pro until the S version has a store that is well populated with the most critical windows apps for power users and general users alike.

I am an IT Manager who oversees 7 different locations, and 160 employees. We are a Microsoft shop, running Azure, Office 365, and SharePoint. We used to be Dell, with regards to hardware. These devices are fast, reliable, light weight, and as durable as any other tablet style device you will find. The battery life is incredible. I have users on them 8 solid hours, never an issue. Yes, they are higher price, but you get what you pay for. I do have a 3 years accidental on all devices. I've only had a single issue in 3 years with them.  A user left theirs on the roof of their car and it slide off and damaged the screen, obviously not fault of the device. I personally run a Surface Pro i7 with 512 Memory, and I love it.

Very nice piece of hardware.  I few minor complaints: Not nuts about how the charge cable interfaces with the laptop.. not as good as the maglock system but macs use but better than the typical connector.  It is short on ports.  Display Port, USB3 and a headphone jack... and thats it.  I wish for a built card reader when I forget to bring my USB card reader.

Aside from those complaints, its great.  Great keyboard, great track pad and HOLYSHITAWESOME SCREEN.  Looks great and 3:2 aspect ratio is so great for actual productivity.

Great battery life and highly portable size and weight.

Tight integration between OS and hardware shows.. everthing just works.
review_topics: tight integration between OS and hardware

reviews.review_body: I bought this laptop for college and I think I made a good choice. It's really lightweight so it won't be too heavy carrying it around. It has a touchscreen which is helpful for zooming in. The screen is also more vertical than other laptops so it seems bigger. At first I was iffy about the alcantara but it actually looks quite nice in person. The only thing is that the keys are heavier than I thought they would be. I prefer lighter keys because they help me type faster, but I've already gotten used to these ones. I would recommend getting the silver color because you can always add laptop skins (and the grey alcantara will match with more skins than the blue or burgundy).

I wanted a laptop with 16gb of ram and an Intel i7 processor - this one was recommended and price was manageable.  Yes, it is pretty, sleek and fast but after the first month I started having problems with it. The first time it crashed I was able to pinpoint the most likely cause as Windows updates. There were a few that failed, then laptop continually crashed, had to re-build my profile twice. It slowly went downhill from there. None of the drivers would update. I know my way around a laptop (spent my career supporting workstations and laptops) so I started with the simplest fix and worked my way up. Could not reset or restore. Fortunately I purchased a warranty and they put me in touch with a very knowledgeable person at Microsoft and we re-built from scratch  to Windows 10 Pro (10.0.19042 build 19042). Everything has been fine for a while but now it randomly crashes with an error of "WHEA uncorrectable error" which fortunately doesn't harm my profile but is almost impossible to identify the cause. I've run tests on memory and the hard drive and they seem to be fine. Very annoying and unstable, and this is the laptop I have to use for the next few years? I'm ready to go back to my old. slow HP Elitebook. Not a happy camper.

I am very satisfied with my Surface Laptop purchase. I was looking for a portable laptop that I could also use as my desktop. I had been deciding between the Surface Pro and Surface Laptop. After trying both, I found that I preferred the typing experience on the laptop. I ended up waiting for the Surface Laptop to go on sale and I got the Core i5, 8 GB Ram, 256 GB model. I have been very happy so far. I generally have multiple applications open (word, excel, internet, email) and this laptop is suitable for my use. I am also using a Surface Dock to that I connect to two external monitors. It took some trial and error to get it working, but it was worth it. I did convert to Windows 10 Pro (For Free) and it allows me to use my Google accounts. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase.

I just got this today so I may update the review if need be. Here’s what I’ve gathered this far.
I purchased the surface 1 with 4 ghz intel i7, 8 gb ram, 256 internal storage.
I immediately checked the laptop specks & it is all that it says EXCEPT the 4 ghz. This laptop says 2.5 ghz. Something to keep in mind.
It comes packaged very well & very closely resembles a Mac on size, look & feel. It seems to run rather quickly. I’m a photographer and intend to use it for photoshop so I will update later on how well that works. Overall I’m pleased. I’d definitely suggest a protection plan as this is a third party purchase.

I bought this laptop for school. I was really nervous about buying online, but this laptop is absolutely wonderful. The battery has lasted me two full days without a charge. I have watched Netflix, YouTube, and been on email and had other tab open. It is so quiet when it's running, super thin, and light weight. The fabric on the keyboard feels really nice and keeps my hands from feeling gross after typing for long periods of time (though the fabric kinda smells like a new car). The touch screen is very responsive and dont have to press hard. The keys under hand feel really nice and aren't loud when typing (so doesn't sound like a tap dancer). It came earlier that expected in very secure box and laptop box was in plastic as well. Only complaint, which really isn't horrible at all, is that  the charger dislodges from port occasionally and stops charging while it was in my lap.

I debated for a long time whether or not to upgrade from my Surface Pro 4 to this.... I am so happy I took the plunge and upgraded.
I purchased the burgundy colored one and LOVE IT. It's beautiful. Also, compared to my previous Surface Pro 4, the battery lasts FOREVER. I love not depending on a kickstand to keep the screen up, I love how fast it is, I love how long the battery lasts. Couldn't be happier.

With all this being said, the first Surface Laptop I ordered worked great for a while, then suddenly had a red vertical line through the screen that wouldn't go away. It was determined that it ended up being a hardware issue. I had babied it so it wasn't caused by damage or rough handling. Ergo it must have been some kind of a manufacturers defect. I returned it through Amazon and ordered another once the return was processed. Taking this into consideration, I am still very happy with my purchase.

Wow, the battery life was totally not what i expected. The battery life the ads give say about 14 hours, and i knew it wasnt really going to be 14, but i thought maybe at least 10 hours, or even 8! But nooo.... i get 4 hours of battery life... 4. Hours! Yes, i did switch to the pro, but still! Ridiculous. For $1000 i thought at least 6? I really hope they fix this, cause that's really sad. Macbooks get way more. Hp zenbook gets more. But the screen is amazing, beautiful and the keyboard is nice, mouse pad is smooth. And alcantra....it's a nice concept, but man does it get dirty and it absorbs the sweat from the palms. Oh yeah, the keyboard really collects the oils from your fingers, so does the mousepad, unfortunately.

Having used a surface pro 3, then 4 for the past few years I was ready to try the new surface laptop. The surface book was a bit too heavy . With the sp4's I opted for the i5 with 16gb ram to extend battery life. Also the i7 on the surfaces pro 4 were getting too hot. With the surface laptop I ended up with a i7, 16gb ram it's a bit pricey but it's a work horse and probably best laptop I've had for travel.

I do miss the sp4's ability to remove the keyboard and adjust the rear especially in the plane when I can stick it in the seat pocket. Also a bit getting used to having the dock/power mount on the bottom near the keys vs the screen on the sp4.

The bigger screen and better keyboard is a nice welcome after so many years with a surface pro

For power users I would also recommend the stylus, a usb3 Ethernet adapter as it also provides 3 usb3 slots and an 'active' mini displayport to HDMI .

I do wish it had a usb-c slot sometimes .

Had issues charging it after unboxing it. Found out that it needed to be updated and I guess part of the updates were a fix for the charging issue. After downloading the updates it wouldn’t install then since it’s not plugged in. Well it’s plugged in but it’s got issues. So I took a can of air duster and pray the charging port a little and it did the trick and starting charging. After it installed the updates and rebooted. The charging issue was gone. This laptop is not upgradable. It scored a score of 0 out of 10 on ifixit. Don’t game with it. You’ll be disappointed. But light gaming will work fine like Minecraft. Surprisingly it was able to play GTA V decently. But I wouldn’t push it. This is a very premium device. It looks great and feels great. You’ll like the keyboard as well. I got the burgundy color. It looks really nice in person. So if you’re in the market for one. I would avoid getting the ones with 4gb of ram. 8gb of ram is the sweet spot for today’s use.

To start off, I was supposed to get a $200 gift card for the purchase of this item, which I didn't, and Amazon would not work with me regarding the promotion (which is the only reason I considered buying this laptop). I will not judge the actual item based on my poor experience with Amazon.

This laptop is great. I took naturally to the touchscreen, but you can function on the laptop without the touchscreen (I realize some people do not like to "ruin" the screen). Some things may bother you though.

NO CD ROM. I lucked out in that I could download all the previous apps I had, but if you require a CD, you will need to buy an external CD ROM drive to run the apps, and to burn CD's.

ONLY 1 USB PORT. So I had to buy a splitter. Personally bought it to be able to use a mouse and keyboard, although I find it comfortable typing on the laptop's keyboard.

Overall, I've had it for over a month and I love it. No major problems, very fast so long has you have a decent internet condition. I have a lot of apps and files that I transferred with no problem and the computer is still running great.

The last laptop that I had was the Lenovo Yoga 2 so it had Windows OS. When I was looking for a new laptop (I had my Lenovo for a little more than 4 years) I narrowed it down between the Microsoft Surface Laptop and the Google Pixelbook. Both laptops were around the same price (the Pixelbook is slightly cheaper than the Surface), with similar specs. At first, I was leaning more towards the Pixelbook because of the slightly cheaper price, but I didn't like that the Pixelbook was a 2-in-1 (my Lenovo is also a 2-in-1 and while I liked this feature at first, it ended up becoming a problem down the road). I also read some reviews about the Pixelbook that said there were some software issues. All the reviews that I read about the Surface were extremely positive with only minor complaints that seemed as though they would be irrelevant for me. Because I was relying heavily on past reviews (I live in the middle of nowhere and was not able to make the drive to view either laptop in person) I ended up going with the Surface despite the higher price and I have absolutely no regrets.

The Surface is sleek and smooth and I LOVE that there are multiple colors to choose from! The fabric-covered keyboard is sooo soft and smooth, and the laptop itself is unbelievably thin! The Surface ticks all the boxes for me, and although I cringed at spending this much on a laptop, I am so glad that I did!

The only thing that I would note is that there is only one USB port, which isn't an issue for me, but I know some people prefer more than one. Other than that, I can think of no complaints thus far.

I got this laptop about a month ago and I LOVE it (there's a pros and cons list at the bottom of review). I needed something portable, quiet, and with good battery life because I am a college student. It's very light and I like the stylish design. I wanted a laptop that's aesthetically pleasing and has good specs. I can even play minecraft with my brothers without any issues. The laptop does get a bit hot when running minecraft or running multiple programs at once but the fans are always quiet usually making no noise at all. I went from a huge, heavy old dell to this laptop and it's great. It makes my life so much easier. Also on the power brick there is an extra USB port which I sometimes plug my phone into to charge. I've never seen that feature before and it's surprisingly handy.

The only issue I've had is with the trackpad. There's some visible wear on the trackpad already.  However, it doesn't really bother me as it's very minor and you can only really see it in a certain light. Other than that the trackpad has worked fine. A possible issue could be that there is only one USB port which I don't mind at all. But if you use more than one at a time then this laptop may not be for you.

Pros: Light, good battery, very quiet, fast, aesthetically pleasing, powerful considering it's lightweight design
Cons: trackpad wear, one usb port, gets hot when running multiple programs
Bought as a replacement laptop and it has out performed the laptop it replaced. Best electronics purchase in a long time. Love it!

I've been a Mac User for more than 15 years.  The price convinced y to try a Surface.  Works beautifully, reacts promptly, amazing touch screen, wakes up fast  and it is very light.  The keyboard is  backlit  so you can work in the dark and the  touch pad is a smooth as Apple's.  However, unlike Apple,  Microsoft is aggressively pushing  its own products.  The browser Edge works nicely and you can select which  search engine the  can use. (The default search engine is Bing.)  The AI helper Cortana uses only Bing. At  this moment  Cortana is less impressive than Google's Assistant. It is still very useful.

Microsoft is also offering a competitive cloud  cloud subscription.  At my job  I have to use Google cloud products (Drive,  Sheets, Documents). Also I have an Android Phone and  Google Photo  helps me sync my photo collection. These products  don't work as smoothly on the Surface.  At this moment you cannot even install the Chrome browser  on  Surface. (I read that Chrome is more energy consuming than Edge and can shorten the battery life.)  I do not need Microsoft cloud service since I already use two platform independent services  Google Drive and  Dropbox. I don't need  all the facilities of  Office 363 (the new Microsoft Office) since I can live very well with what  Google is offering freely.  I  don't know yet how Dropbox works with Surface.

Given the current deliberate  incompatibility with the Google products I need I gave Surface only four stars. If Microsoft  fixes this I will upgrade my rating to five stars  and switch to Surface.T hen again, I hear that Apple  will present this Fall the new generation of Mac Book Air.

First of all, i want to start by expressing how much i liked the product, its looks and feels like a solid midrange laptop for everyday use. The design is sleek and simple, i was disappointed with the fact that it is difficult to find a simple laptop that doesn’t cost an arm and a leg. All in all i liked the laptop, a lot! *The rating is for the product* not the for the story below

However, the main purpose of this review is not about the laptop’s performance, design etc... its about how I got scammed and was sent a laptop with specs that I didn’t order.

So the story goes like this, i get on amazon, I add a Microsoft surface laptop (i5, 8 GB RAM, 256 GB SSD) to my cart, i place the order, several days later I get the package, i set up the laptop started checking it out. I had a feeling that i should check out the computer’s spec, you know just curious. I was shocked when i found out that the specs of the laptop were (i5, 4 GB RAM and 128 GB SSD!!!!!!!) i was really confused, i double check the label on the back of the box and saw that it says (i5, 8GB RAM, 256 GB SSD), but the laptop has different specs, and what is more confusing is that the serial number of the laptop matches the number on the box. So to me it seemed like it was an attempt to pull a quick one on me. I ended up returning the laptop of course... I am still disappointed that such scam attempts could happen on amazon!

Check your laptops everyone! Don’t get scammed like i did.
It crushed after almost 4 years.

I bought this for my wife to replace her older, bulky, HP laptop. It was a few years old and replacement was due. She picked this one out at a retail store and we found it on Amazon for a reduced price. She LOVES it!! So light, fast, and cute because it's her favorite color. The palm rests have a cloth feeling but they are made of some plastic stuff that's easily cleaned, the screen looks great, and the keyboard feels right... partly due to the palm rests allowing a person to rest palms on them while typing. It has a fast hard drive, it's quiet and light. I really don't have negatives to say about it except that it only has a couple of USB 3 ports. That's OK... I bought a tiny USB 3 hub and we're all good now. Definitely recommend this device though it's not cheap.

I know most people cringe when thinking about Microsoft hardware.  There have been some massive failures over the years.  Remember around the time of the first iphone, the Windows Phones on AT&T?  What a mess.  Remember trying to update them?  The Surface line of tablets have actually been pretty good, but in the end most people either just want a really good tablet or a good laptop.  The surface laptops have filled a nice need which is a speedy laptop that is super slim and can act like a tablet as well.  As long as you get the model with at least a core i5, 8 gigs of RAM and 256 SSD, the surface laptop performs great.  You can hold it with 2 or 3 fingers and fits in a tablet sleeve.  I have one of these myself and we have sold about 20 of them for our employees and clients and have had very few issues so far.  The finish on the laptop looks nice, but it can show some fingerprints or new to be wiped off after a lot of use.  The reason I am taking off a star is because of the confusion and frustration of having these laptops ship with Windows 10 S.  I won't bore you with what Windows 10 S is, suffice to say that it is a stripped down version meant for large rollouts and not suitable for most people.  It's true that you can switch to Windows 10 Pro for free, but it's super confusing for people that don't know how or why they need to do that.  Overall while not perfect, for the price the surface laptop is a great choice.

I could not connect my Surface to a shared printer (see below).  My time with Microsoft support did not resolve my issue.  Printing is important, and I felt the 2 stars was deserved for a product I might have had to return.

After a few hours of working with it, I was able to resolve my problem.  This is what I experienced.  Your Surface may not experience the same issue.  It might have been a one off, or a bug of some kind.

My 5 existing computers had the "Workgroup" name changed to "XXXXXXXXX".  After updating the Surface to WIndows Pro at the Microsoft Store, I changed the "Workgroup" name to match the other 5.  At that point, it failed to connect to a shared printer.  Long story short, I set the "Workgroup" name back to "WORKGROUP" on the Surface and the computer with the printer attached, and it worked!

So, I changed the "Workgroup" name back to "XXXXXXXXX" on those 2 computers, and it failed to connect to the shared printer again!

I changed all 6 computers so the "Workgroup" is named "WORKGROUP" and all is good.  This should not have been an issue, but I'm glad I got mine working.

We love the laptop.  It has a great screen size, it is light, and it is quick.  Not excited with my support call with Microsoft, but the important thing is it works now.

ORIGINAL POST:
It started off really nice.  Fast, smooth, it looks great, etc.  Then I tried to connect it to a shared printer on another computer in my home.  It failed.  Over and over again.  I called Microsoft.  The young lady was patient and nice, but went through a series of tests that had nothing to do with my issue.  I requested my call be escalated, and after a few minutes, she came back on and tried a few additional steps.

She had me connect the printer directly to the laptop.  It worked (Who saw that coming????)!  Then she said "we have it working.  Is there anything else we can do for you?"  I could have done this.  The laptop REFUSES to recognize a shared printer on the network.  I have a Surface Pro 3, a Surface 1, an HP desktop and an HP laptop, ALL which can connect to the printer that is USB'd to another HP desktop.  Microsoft basically REFUSED to escalate my issue even after I said I was sending it back.

It's sad to give it a 2 star rating for a printer issue, but we like to print.  It is not an option.  Someone might say it is a printer issue.  It is not.  There is a network sharing issue with "MY" Surface Laptop.  Maybe not yours, but mine has an issue.  It is also sad that Microsoft wouldn't at least attempt to resolve this.

I may return this if I can't find a printer solution.  I'll update in a couple of weeks.

I'm only writing this to warn off anyone from purchasing a surface laptop--lord know I'll never buy one. I bought the laptop two years ago. The surface worked fine for the first year, though I had periodic charging issues, especially with the magnetic cable clip. The clip won't engage, sometimes you have to prop it up or tape it. The problems got worse, and just when the warranty expired (a year and half), I had major issues charging the laptop. So I bought another cable, which worked for a while, then bought another, and the problem continued. I had two conversations with microsoft techs, who convinced me to buy another cable--considering, if I wanted to send the laptop for repair, the price would be more than I paid for it, so they really gave me no possible solutions, other than buying a new one, and were really gaslighting me that any fix actually existed. Of course, why would I ever purchase another microsoft product. The Lenovo laptop, which I bought the Surface to replace it with, is still working five years later--only issue I had is with a hinge.

I've taken it to various repair shops and they tell me there's nothing they can do to fix it, that basically, microsoft made the surface to be disposable, and any effort to fix the laptop would far exceed the price to purchase a new one--planned obsolescence. From what I researched, what brought about the charging issue was some update I failed to download, and once the battery lost power,  it couldn't be charged, or even powered with the cable plugged in.

I've given up on this pos. I'm looking for a field where I can take it out and demolish it like the printer from Office Space, or possibly a parking garage I can drop it from. Maybe a wood chipper. I'm weighing my options. All said, don't buy a surface laptop, this is where you'll be two years later.

I've had my Microsoft Surface Laptop for about a month now and I genuinely could not be happier with my purchase. After weeks of research and stress trying to find the perfect laptop I stumbled upon this beauty. It was worth the wait and stress or research. It's amazing.

The keyboard is out of this world. It's so comfortable to type on. I love it.

The i7 core processor is amazing. I can run Photoshop, Spotify and a bunch of browsers without it slowing down.

Battery life is phenomenal.

The screen is great. The touch screen works amazingly too.

I got the Burgundy and it's even cuter in person. It's sort of punk pinkish. I love it. The material on the inside is nice, I'm not sure how it will wear eventually but in the meantime it's been great and comfortable.

You won't regret your purchase!

EDIT: almost 2 years later and this computer still works like a charm!!! the fabric inside isn’t worn down and i work from home on it, literally 8 hours a day m-f for the last 2 years! it’s not as new looking, but still in pretty great shape! still runs super fast, amazing. battery life isn’t as strong but not a deal breaker

UPDATE: So, I'm about two weeks in now and have had a bit of time to run a few photoshoots into my Lightroom catalog to get an idea of what this laptop can handle and I'm a bit less than ecstatic. I'm not knocking a star off because Adobe recommends 12gb of ram to run Lightroom smoothly, so its no fault to Microsoft that I started to have some slow-downs when I got my catalog up around 1,000 images with synced settings, 1:1 previews, and adjustments gradients and brushes on many files. I've got my cache set to 90gb and it just tends to really chug when I need to do more than basic adjustments. Outside of heavy lightroom use and sluggishness, the laptop absolutely flies with just about anything else. I really don't have a complaint to share. It's been a dream.

This laptop is fantastic. I bought the i5 256/8gb model with the gray/gold coloring. First thing that amazes is the weight. Just over two pounds makes this thing feel so incredible to carry around. I almost feel like it's a large phone sometimes. The design is sleek and minimalist. The speakers are loud and full and rich. The battery life is is superb. I may have a warped view on that because of the terrible battery on my old laptop, but I seem to notice 7-8 hours battery life depending on the usage. I bought this for Adobe Lightroom and Photoshop use, but haven't had much time to put it through a lot of work so I will update when I know just how well it performs there.

The only minor dislike is that the hinge is a little wobbly. For being touchscreen, it seems like it should have a stiffer hinge, but it's quite bouncy.

I've had this laptop for about three months, and this is the second laptop (after the Rose Gold MacBook), that I have looked forward to using day in and day out. It is a weird feeling, being in love with your laptop. Most of us have probably own at least 6 laptops in our lifetimes, so you can understand where I'm coming from when I say most of us use our laptops in a utilitarian sort of way: We use it because we need to, and when we don't, we just put it away without any thought. If you want a big screen, or to play games, you would use your desktop. When you want something portable, you would most likely use your tablet. When you want something on the go, we have all used our smartphone as our main day-to-day gadget. So that leaves our laptop, as more of a business machine for doing something that requires typing on the go, whether it be to reply to an important email you can't just use your phone for, or to type out something on Word or Google Docs. For many of us, browsing the Net just isn't as satisfying on our small phones, even if it is some 6.2" monster. There is something tactile, yet intangibly indescribable, about using our laptop

Yet, this is the first Windows laptop that makes me look forward to using it each day. The main culprit: Oh that gorgeous piece of metal and color. To be honest, if it just came in silver like its Surface Book counterpart, I would have never given it a second thought (by the way, I have that too, but its novelty has since worn off). I got the Burgundy version, which is just so unique - where else can you get a wine red laptop?? Each time I open its laptop sleeve and pull it out, I have to pause a moment to admire its chiseled look first, before propping it open and using it. Not only does it look great, it feels great too. As you run your fingers through it, you will appreciate that you have one of the most luxurious laptops ever. No that is not a hyperbole.

Another thing that make it stands out: The stereo speakers underneath the keyboard is the best I have ever heard in a laptop (I am overseas right now, and my Huawei Matebook X awaits at home with its Dolby Atmos Harmon Kardon speakers, so I'll do an update soon). It is loud and immersive - it can't get too loud where it would create aural distortions, so at its peak it is just awesomely loud and clear enough. I have a keyboard protector over it, but I always take it off when I have some audio playing - yes, the sound is that good.

Touchscreen laptops might be a gimmick, but having it is never a negative. It is perfect for scrolling web sites. Once you use it that way, you'll never go back to scrolling with your mouse or trackpad again.

Speaking of the trackpad, it's supposed to have the Windows Precision software aspect, but it still is goofy most of the time. Scrolling, switching, zooming, etc., still isn't as good as any MacBooks.

And speaking of the keyboard and keyboard cover, key travel and sponginess are excellent. However, the keys are a bit more slippery than I would like, so I definitely recommend one of those gel keyboard covers to help you type more precisely.

The screen is bright and excellent - one of the best screens I have used. The resolution isn't as crisp and nice as my Surface Book and Macbook, but definitely better than most.

About that whole Alcantara-layered interior - yes it is beautiful, yes it feels great (no more cold palms in the winter). Just keep it clean (no eating potato chips while using it).

Finally, the i5 and 8GB of RAM are good enough to avoid any hiccups in performance of your every usage of a normal laptop. This is not for gaming or video rendering, so if you are not expecting that, then this laptop's performance will not disappoint.

The bottom line is you will buy this laptop for its looks, period. There is no value for this laptop - it is targeted as a premium-level laptop, not a value-level laptop. Any other normal laptop with these specs would be about $200 less. So you just have to ask yourself if the burgundy or slate blue color, and the style of design/craftsmanship are worth it for you.

I bought this laptop in June of 2019.  This is the 1st generation of the Surface laptop and I got it for a great price because the 2nd generation was rolling out.  My Surface laptop is Cobalt Blue with the Core i7, 8GB RAM, and 256GB hard drive.  Got it for $725.  This was a great price in my mind and why I went with it.  I was looking at some cheaper laptop models (in the $400-$500) range, and wasn't really considering this level of laptop because it is normally in the $1000-$1500 range.  But at $725 I decided to pay a bit extra for the better quality.

One of the most notable differences of moving up to a laptop like this is the design.  It is nice and slim, and looks great.  This was important to me because I wanted something fairly sleek and compact that I could just put in my backpack and go (not a student, but I always have my pack).

The screen is great and I love the 3:2 aspect ratio.

As I'm typing this review, I can tell you that the keyboard is as good as people say it is.  It's got great spacing and the button press is nice and deep for a laptop.  This was big because I'm used to typing on a mechanical keyboard.  The Alcantera surface is a nice touch.  It is a smooth and soft feel and is something that separates it from competition.  Some people have stated that it leaves some oil marks after months of use, but I've mostly seen that in the light grey color.  We'll see what it does having the darker blue color.

The touchscreen works great.  I haven't purchased a Surface pen, but plan to in the future.  The trackpad is also great and gives a nice satisfying click.

The facial recognition for login is accurate and really fast.

I will typically use my Bluetooth earbuds, but I was surprised at how clear and nice the speakers on this sounded.

Overall, this laptop looks and feels like a great laptop and performs very well.  I have had a Macbook Air for my job for the last 2 years, and this is just as good a laptop. In fact, it is probably a bit better because of the little things like a better keyboard and personalized colors.  At the price I got it for, I would definitely recommend this laptop.

Also, I should state that a lot of reviews for this laptop talk about the Windows S operating system being installed on it.  That is no longer the case.  My laptop came pre-loaded with Windows 10 Pro.

reviews.review_body: I thought I was purchasing a new laptop, but it is, in fact, not. There wasn’t anything said in the product description about buying a used machine. This is not my user profile

I was advised by the HP customer service representative that this model was running way too slow for a "New" model.  Could not load the driver update.  Just gave up after many hours and returned product.  Did not exchange for new model as 1) I thought that was what I had purchased, and 2) did not want to waste another minute of my time trying to get this product to work as represented.
I purchased this laptop just for surfing the web, but this small but a multi function laptop is like my fav tool in my home office now. Very light it’sctouchscreen and easy to maneuver. Love it!
