Have had to replace 1 of the computers FOUR TIMES and another I am just having Acer fix instead of replacing since EVERY replacement (save the last one) had the SAME hardware issue (all within 8 weeks, mind you). The Mic won't work when a headset is plugged into the male/female plug. If you press on the computer casing near the plugin..all of a sudden it will work..but as soon as you release the pressure the mic stops working again. I believe it is an issue created when the company upgrades the memory (as I had them all upgraded). I wouldn't buy from this company either: Oydisen Electronics. Couldn't speak to a live person and even after emailing several times and explaining the issue they just sent me a canned response that addressed none of my concerns.

I'm not a big computer guy but I do like Acer generally . I have the Chromebook 15 also. It's ok but small memory. This Acer though thin and supposedly average specs is super slow. Transition between programs and clicking and opening is what bothers me the most. I end up clicking and typing multiple times before anything appears on the screen. Annoying. I should have returned this laptop.
It fell apart in less than 8 months.

The computer I received is not touchscreen; but this is listed under touchscreen, because the details say Not a Touchscreen. So, in searching for a touchscreen, this came up. The first day I used this computer, letters started coming off the keyboard. It is pretty lightweight with decent screen quality, but obviously it is annoying to have keys popping off continuously.

Personally I don't think this laptop is very user friendly but my main complaint is that after only having it for like 6 months the hinges broke. Was able to rig up to work but now stuck with an ugly laptop cuz I surely don't have the money to buy a new one.

This computer literally fell apart. The screen lid came apart and disconnected while sitting on my desk. This is after just 9 months of occasional use. Annoying setup.

I’ll never buy Acer again.
review_topics: occasional useinput: This laptop has my husband's stamp of approval. He's a computer engineer
so when he says this is a great deal for the money
doesn't get up to ridiculous temps (even when playing world of warcraft)
and has a 1TB of storage - with another slot for an SSD
if I ever need it. I'm not a huge fan of HP laptops
but I decided to give this one a try since the specs were so good for the price. I've been really happy with it so far. It's fast
the screen is bright and clear
and the battery life is pretty good. I've been using it for work and school
and it's handled everything I've thrown at it so far. I would definitely recommend this laptop to anyone who is looking for a good all-around laptop that won't break the bank.output: HP laptop

reviews.review_body: These is a good computer for basic use such as email, videos, and gaming.  The price was very good and I am happy with my purchase.
Study
Works well for my needs! Not too sure about "S mode", thinking about getting rid of that.

Reporting this seller to Amazon in the hopes that this gets fixed. I bought this laptop for a friend to study in college with, SPECIFICALLY because of the balanced specs and Windows 11 Home as listed, then waited a week for it to arrive at his house in a different time zone. The dang machine shows up with Windows 10 S installed. That's a solid hundred bucks I'm being ripped off for, I really could've just bought a laptop at Walmart and had a better experience than waiting a week to get an effectively defective machine. This laptop is for a really good friend of mine, my personal machines are all custom builds of some kind or another because i work in tech and music, and i wish I'd just rebuilt a pawn shop computer instead of losing money on this.

Really, just list the right version of windows in your product description, it's hardly 3 letters of effort but the user experience is dramatically different, please get this right
Has the features I was looking for at a price that was on target
It's a basic computer and serves its purpose. It's not for gaming and is not touch screen but I knew this upon purchase
Es buena marca y tiene lo necesario para estudiar o trabajo de oficina con los programas de office. El color es super llamativo y todo funciona muy bien.

The machine is nice and sleek very light weight, crisp screen quality and boots up quickly. The hinges between the monitor and CPU were a bit stiff, not sure if it's a general situation, but mine snapped and I am now forced to get it repaired a little over a month after purchace. Not happy about that.
I bought one about six months ago -in blue- and now a gold one for my husband. Nice machine!

product_title: Panasonic Toughbook CF 31 Rugged Notebook PC with Core i5 500GB HDD 4GB RAM Wi Fi Bluetooth Windows 7 Pro
product_description: Intel Core i5 2 5GHz Dust and water proof design conforming with MIL 810 military standard Windows 7 Pro 32 bit or 64 bit

reviews.review_body: this thing looks and runs great, had a full charge also.it came with windows ten but i can change it back to seven.i definitely am happy with this laptop
Great machine
Just what I needed, for an Amazing deal.
Makes other contractors jealous!
The toughbook was in great condition and works extremely well
quick deliver and in great condition!  Works great running linux as well.

Great product! Need something rugged for the harsh environment I work in. Definitely would this product and ABCD Computers have excellent customer service!!!  Shipping was so fast USPS couldn't track the item!
can not love an inanimate object, so it gets a 4.  Very satisfied. It is tough, dropped it already, no problems.  Work in industrial construction.

Excellent notebook, very well-made. My friends want to try tossing it down the stairs to see how tough it is, but I'm somewhat hesitant. It came refurbished, so there are two long scratches on the screen. Otherwise, it is a solid computer that I'm not afraid to go mobile. I dropped the Microsoft operating system quicksmart, installed Ubuntu, and am happy to report all of the ports, WiFi, etc work like a charm.
Disappointed...it has not worked well. Froze up up. Upstart and does not hold a charge for very long. Trying to work with it ,but it should not be this much work.

product_title: HP Chromebook 14 inch Laptop with 180 Degree Hinge Intel Celeron N3350 Processor 4 GB RAM 32 GB eMMC Storage Chrome OS 14 ca040nr Gray
product_description: Processor Intel R Celeron R Processor N3350 Dual Core 1 1GHz up to 2 4GHz Google Drive Get 100 GB two year cloud storage with Google Drive Display 14 0 inch diagonal Full HD AntiGlare IPS WLED backlit Display 1920 x 1080 Memory 4 GB LPDDR4 2400 SDRAM not upgradable Storage 32 GB eMMC Battery life Up to 10 hours and 30 minutes mixed usage Dimensions and weight unpackaged 13 27 inches W x 8 94 inches D x 0 72 inch H 3 39 pounds Operating system Chrome OS

reviews.review_body: I like my chrome book. It is nice and handy for my school and college. I will recommend this product to others.
wORKING FINE.
One thing I like about this chromebook is that it is very durable and the battery life lasts long enough. The product itself is great and it is in perfect conditions.
Really makes a difference for me to get my homework done and also watch movies. Only one dislike - Can’t put apps in the desktop
review_topics: Really makes a difference for me to get my homework done and also watch movies
but I only have one dislike - Can’t put apps in the desktop

reviews.review_body: Plays well its purpose: do homeschooling and simple work-from-home stuff. Love the white color and that converts to tablet!

Purchased in may of 2019. Five months later the chromebook doesnt power up anymore. Contacted hp and  found out there was only two weeks left on the one year warranty.  The warranty was activated six months before I purchased the chromebook from the seller on Amazon. If the chromebook didnt stop working ,I would of never found out about this warrany scam. Beware. Amazon should be held accountable for their sellers.
review_topics: found out there was only two weeks left on the one year warranty
the warranty was activated six months before I purchased the chromebook from the seller on Amazon

reviews.review_body: This computer is definitely "no frills". But it does all the basics, (email and internet connection), and it does them well. I heartily recommend this.
not bd

I am very pleased with the chrome book.
I use it for email, reading, and word processing.
It looks great in white.
Don't have many hours on it yet. So far it is just what I need for document making and web surfing.

When it worked, it was perfect. I loved the touchscreen. I loved the design. Unfortunately it kept shutting down at random during use. I tried doing a factory reset (“powerwash”) and then it never came back on again. Wish it wouldn’t have had the powering off issue. It would have been the perfect laptop for school. Disappointed :(

Excellent computer! I already live in the Google Apps (gmail, google calendar, google drive, documents and sheets) so it was a natural change over to a Chromebook. Perfect for my business and personal use!
Worked great while we had it. My son had it stolen from him in Milan aboard the Night Train.
Great body; Horrible Screen resolution: pass on this product.
Great product at a decent prize.
review_topics: great product at a decent prize

reviews.review_body: I have only had this for a few weeks but love it.  It works great for what I was looking for.  I can used easily anywhere.
Its more like a tablet

I purchased this computer and after a 5 months the screen quit working. When I open it up it is blank and my home page flickers on and off. I have not been able to use it in almost a year. I though maybe it wasn't working because it was not on a flat surface, but that does not help either. If for some reason the screen does work it will flicker off after a second or two. Not worth the money.

I loved everything about this computer until the keys on the keyboard started to come off. One by one I tried to have it fixed but the damage was too great. Damage? I used it for school and work,  very lite work out and still the keys which were badly glued on popped off. I ordered another cb  the lenovo  for only a few dollars more for more storage.  will stay clear of HP products from now on. Not like they used to be.

I have had the laptop for a year and it just died on me. It will not charge, it will not hard reset and no electronics store will help me fix the problem. I am very frustrated that I have had it for such a short period of time and now I have to drop another $300 on a new laptop.
I bought this used (not renewed) & Im happy to say its in pretty pristine condition! Definitely recommend for students on a budget :) (sticker is my addition)

Ordered and received in August,  first week of Sept. all of a sudden the screen goes black and then a battery pic comes on that shows 1%..  I did everything the HP website said to do to fix it except take the  battery out and put it back in which I had no tools to do and didn't feel like I should have to anyway.  My previous HP lasted 3 years and I gave it to my grandson because it was still operating...but this HP Chromebook has been packed up and shipped back.  I'll not get another one.
Functions great for our family of four!
I just wished I knew what the screen look like. It's a little matte for my linking but it does its job.
Only lasted a year and a half before it broke.

Way to many pop ups and redirecting when online. I would not purchase this item again and would return this one if I could. It goes off when I try to use some of the apps I put on it. I have had IPads, Kindle Fires and All In One computers and I have never had a device that is as much trouble to use as this HP Chromebook.

The wireless mouse that came with the laptop doesn't work with for the laptop.  I try to connect using bluetooth but the bluetooth couldn't find the wireless mouse.

Plus, I ordered this product the second time for my mom, because it had touch screen, and it didn't even come with touch screen. I'm very disappointed.
I just got mines today and I’m in love! The laptop has a nice lightweight yet sturdy feel to it . Also the overall look is nice. It was easy to set up and get started!
It seems to crash quite a bit. The cursor seems to jump around when your typing an e-mail. Sometimes it just gets wiped out.
Bought this for my daughter for school. Was a breeze to set up (took less than five minutes)!

Received the new product and it displayed ‘an unexpected error has occurred’.  I looked up all the information to reinstall Chrome OS due to the “Chrome OS is missing or damaged” message on the screen, to try force the Chromebook to boot into recovery mode. Long story short, all our efforts failed and I shipped it back. I bought a new product as a gift and the recipient let me know of the issue. I tried to rectify the problem without optimal results. I feenlike I shouldn’t have to struggle with a new product and this time was unwilling to pursue correction further and returned.

I have used the Chrome book since February, 2018. It runs kind of warm, and now some of the keys don't work at all. I am not able to log in because one of the keys is in my log-in address. Pretty mad!

Now it is September 21 and the replacement that I received on August 20 has quit working. There is power but the screen stays black. Pleae help me.

I paid $299.99 for this Chromebook in May 2020. It lasted 6 months until November 2020. I looked up the warranty and it expired June 2019-Expired a year before I even purchased it. SO the Warranty is no good, I am out all that money, I used this for school and now have nothing. The seller would not answer back when I tried to contact and Amazon said it doesn n ot qualify for refund or replacement. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!!

After 3-6 months key after key stopped working to where you can’t use the delete key and several others.  I have been trying to get in contact with this company directly and through amazon and no luck.  Now we are in real need for this laptop to use for homeschooling and can’t get anywhere.  We bought a chrome book because kids already know how to use them because they’ve used at school.  Very frustrating when I can’t get a response for an exchange or return!
Bought for my granddaughter for her birthday, she loves it

I ordered this laptop for my daughter for Christmas and barley two days later she came to me saying the sound wasn’t working. After doing some troubleshooting, I just restarted it and the problem fixed. I thought it was a fluke. Eventually she was coming to me constantly about the same problem. Not even a week later it stopped working entirely and was making this really creepy mechanical sound continuously (even off...its been two days and it’s still going. I put a few pillows on top of it to muffle the sound until I can get it all packed up to send back). We’re pretty disappointed.
Good little laptop. Bought for a 10 year old. It seems very durable the battery life is really great and it charges really fast if turned off. Less then an hour to full charge.
This chrome book shuts down too often. I really do not like it although the battery life is good. I have had better chrome books!
Love this.  Perfect.  Plug and play.  Worth every penny.  Bought a second for my son one day after plugging mine in. Simple and effective.  Great sound and resolution. Light weight.  Can't go wrong.
Having lost my touch with an android electronic, there was a little bit of a learning curve. I love the touch screen, it makes scrolling super easy, works just like a phone or tablet

I don’t usually write reviews, but I felt it was needed for this product. Bought for my daughter to use for school, she also used it for other non-school uses as well, like watching Netflix. Worked great, for 2 weeks. The keyboard and mouse suddenly stopped working, as well as the power button. We tried all the tricks to get it to work, including the only suggestion HP’s tech support could offer of “power washing” which is their version of a reset, still didn’t work. It was basically now a big touchscreen tablet with a non-functioning keyboard attached to it.
Only good thing was Amazon refunded me in full without any hassle because it was in the 30 day window for returns.
They Chromebook is light and very useful for what I need to do for work and play.  They screen quality is good and great price.
Great lap top, was expecting touch screen after reading the questions and reviews.
I love it, my job uses this laptop and it’s so easy to use!! Battery life is amazing
The reason I'm giving this 4 star is because the screen glitches but everything it works fine
I'm not a big Chromebook guy - gave it to my granddaughter and she is happy with it.
I dislike the fact that it doesn’t have a caps lock button very disappointing, overall great product
It came early which was a plus and it’s amazing. This laptop is easy to carry around while doing my school work. The battery lasts all day. It makes it easier for me to download my pictures.

I loved it!!  I was afraid at first to switch from a regular laptop to a chrome book. I was very pleasantly and gratefully surprised. It’s so perfect. Everything I can do in a computer, I can do on the chrome book.

I bought this for using the Linux terminal. It works pretty well, I could run Docker and VSCode with no problems. Will slow down a bit when running HD videos and browsing at same time, but no big deal.

I was hesitant to purchase my first chromebook, but glad I did. Since most of my time is spent on Chrome with little need for traditional pc based programs, the chromebook is perfect.
Pleased with the speed and convenient, seemless use of Google applications throughout the chromebook.
So far just now using it. No issues. Light weight and just what we were looking for. Great for the price also

I use this laptop for everything involving school and I love it so much! The battery literally lasts forever, and there is so much space. Now I can use my desktop for strictly major projects, TV, and such which I use my laptop at the comfort of my bed and work on my notes.

This will only allow Google account and information. It sends other info to the trash so you can't add/ transfer windows accounts.  I called Google and spoke to Sonia from Pakistan. If you want to get to another account you log into Google  then try to access a different account which is my default account. It throws it to trash or u can't use it as before. She said it would be easy just one step more to do ,,NOT. Don't even think about transferring data etc. I'm sending this back to Amazon. If u are a first time only Google person perhaps great. I've had a computer always a Windows type since 1998! I've Seagate to hold data. I've had many this was a big mistake. The info isn't accurate. Google traps you... DON'T BUY THIS.
Wife is in a nursing program which requires her to access powerpoints and google docs. Does everything she needs it and light weight

Got this laptop for my grandson.  He loves to play video games and always wants to use my desk top computer when he comes over.  So, I bought this laptop for him and he loves it.  This is how to keep an 11 year old quiet and engaged.

I absolutely love my hp Chromebook. Just made th switch from a full laptop. Was a little nervous but the lightweight design plus super quick speeds and fast startup left me wondering why I didn’t make the switch a long time ago. Love being able to convert to different configurations.
This chrome book is perfect for a teenager the only downside is it’s memory capacity but for a young teenager it’s great
cute laptop , battery lasts a long time .. great for watching movies/tv shows !

This HP Chromebook is EXTREMELY great. I was more than happy with it the moment I started using it. The screen size is huge, HD quality, great speaker sound, and I love how mostly all the apps you use on your mobile are easily accessible for the laptop. I highly recommend. Only thing I would have wanted was backlit keyboard.
review_topics: speaker soundinput: I love this system
and am glad i decided to try an HP product again. I usually prefer Dell
but they didn't have anything I liked in my price range. I play Sims 4 with all the expansion and game packs and it runs very smoothly. Other games I play also run well
SWTOR and WoW. I have had HPs in the past and have found their hardware to be as good as any
and better than some. The only thing that I'm not thrilled with is the keyboard. The keys are a bit too small for my taste. Overall
this is a very good system for the price point and I recommend it.output: HP

reviews.review_body:
I bought this as a stop-gap chromebook--until the new chromebooks all come out and I can get something better.

Pros: Price, size, decent screen.

Cons: Takes longer to start than any chromebook I've ever used. Muddy blacks on screen. Gets pretty warm (no fans, so I'm a bit concerned).

I would not buy this again.
Still getting used to the key board but so far so good ...I do miss 10 key on the right side but I love how compact it is and user friendly.
L button was detached when I opened it, didn't return it being that my other laptop crashed mid semester and my classes were online. Otherwise good computer, stays charged for long periods of time.

Having used numerous laptops and several Chromebooks I know what works and this one is not on the good list.  The first one had to be replaced because it was DOA, the 2nd has been running reasonably well until 2 months ago then started getting random horizontal lines and flashes on the screen.  And now in just the last few days, the wifi will drop repeatedly, the internal radio is failing.  I've had to powerwash a couple of times to address performance issues.  The screen is not very good but workable.  On the positive, it is light, great size, love the keyboard, and B&O speakers are good for this design.

I had a regular desk top and my son talked me into this kind of computer. I am so happy with it. I have left if plugged in so I can not comment on battery life. I do love the ease of the chrome system and this light weight, streamline computer is the nicest I have owned. I like the key board, the keys seem tight and pop, if you will.Just very happy over all.

I was very excited to get this chrome books for my twin girls now homeschooling but one is working fine since I got it 3 days ago but the second one only turns on once and I barely was setting it up and died forever.. desapointed but I will order again and hope they will send me one that works

Great battery life, does everything I need when recently traveling.  I kept an eye on my online retail, mapped destinations I sent to my phone, kept contacts updated.  Very seamless and intuitive interface.  We played podcasts through the car stereo on the long road trip.  Truly a great buy for my needs.  Used it for under a month so far.  At home I throw YouTube onto my Chromecast on my TV.  Works great.

It was good enough for surfing the web while it lasted.  You shouldn't expect much more than streaming and surfing on this device. It only lasted 3 months of light use before dying on us.  Screen went dark and won't come to life even when charged.

Edit:
It came back to life about a week after writing this review and is working fine now.  Not sure what is up with the thing.
So far I love it, is only giving it 4 stars right now because ice only had it 1 day. I will follow up in a few weeks if anything changes but for the price I paid it is a really decent lap top.

I havent even had this notebook for 2 years and I think it might be done/dead already. For occasional use, it works perfectly fine but you must keep it on the charger otherwise. I have run into the issue of having to recharge it for days and simultaneously turn it on while plugging it in hoping to get any power back! A known issue for these. Now, I got the notebook slightly wet (not enough that I would think would do any damage) and it has done it again. It's been much longer than last time and I still can't get any power going. I'm not sure if the money to pay to have it fixed would even be worth what I paid for this, I will probably be buying a new laptop soon.

Being new to the Chromebook I would have appreciated some type of instructions being included.  I don't even know how to turn it off!.  However, price was great and it shipped faster than promised.
Still learning!!

Great running computer just doesn't run applications I needed for school such as the adobe cc programs and illustrator

No HDMI port either

Other then that it runs beautifully and the Wi-Fi connects better then any comp in the house  fantastic high def picture as well

My old HP Chromebook finally died (after years) so I was very happy to find this one as a replacement. Although I liked the outer casing on my old HP better - simply for aesthetics - this Chromebook is much nicer overall. The fact that it converts to a tablet is a huge bonus. The keyboard has a nice feel and both the touch pad and touchscreen have the perfect amount of sensitivity; they respond well to the touch without responding to every accidental brush across them.

I really like the look and feel of this product,I can only give 3 stars because I cannot even get beyond the wifi sign up page.I cannot get it to sign into my wifi it either says wifi to far away or password incorrect.other devices sign in with no problem so I know its not that.If anyone can help me I would appreciate.If not I will have to ship back ,I really don't want to do that so if anyone has any ideas thank you ahead of time

I bought this laptop for the sole purpose of social media and watching hulu/netflix and twitch. It is amazing. The battery is awesome.
ONLY COMPLAINT IS
no fan???? be careful about how hot it can get because it has NO cooling fan! But i wouldnt tell you not to buy. DEFINITELY buy!!!

This is our second HP Chromebook.  The first one required 2 different repairs (purchased SquareTrade insurance for 3 years).  Yes, it was repaired but went without the computer each time for over 7 days.  The first HP is still working at 2.25 years old.
Second purchased 1 year ago.  Several keys and trackpad stopped working.  Fortunately, I purchased the SquareTrade insurance for this one as well.  Just found out that the computer cannot be repaired and SquareTrade will send me a check for the purchase price.  WooHoo.  I am done with HP.  All of the issues with both Chromebooks were related to regular wear and tear, not accidents.  If you purchase this or another ChromeBook, invest in the insurance for $30 for 3 years -- the insurance is worth it!

An excellent value for the price. My only complaint is that it occasionally has unresolved sound driver issues that force a reboot to fix it. The sound system occasionally turns into an unintelligible screeching that can be fixed with a reboot. Overall a great value though in an inexpensive and fun laptop for my grad school.

I am a broke college student. When my macbook broke down this year I need a fast and easy alternative. I bought this chromebook for $250 not expecting much, and my expectations were definitely met. I was honestly surprised at how fast, easy to use, and sleek this computer is for only $250. Sure there are some minor downfalls here and there, but I can't imagine getting a better computer for $250. I would have paid $400 for this, especially since I already had the means to increase storage which is a huge plus.

Got the chromebook a few days ago, set up was easy, its running fine, like the screen and the speakers.
Not to heavy, quality looks ok.

Problem is I cannot connect it to an EPSON L 380 printer, using a USB cable. The Epson L 380 does not support wifi.
Any idea how to connect to the printer? Thanks for any help !!

The Chromebook works great. The only issue I have is that after 2 years the power cord develops a short in it. its easily fixed by ordering a new cord however if im paying almost 500 for an item i expect all parts to last at least 3 years with no issues.

It was lighter than expected, due to it being made from a lighter plastic-like material. Still sturdy, just not as much as I thought it’d be. The 14” is not a touch screen, which was a big selling point to me but it’s still easy to use. I already use google everything so this was nice to have. Little bit of a learning curve but a good laptop for students like me.

What I like most about this Chromebook is that it uses a USB-C charger. It was one of the big reasons I bought this one. I can use my MacBook charger and don't bother taking the Chromebook's charger out much. One standard charging system is so nice. I've also used charge and video over USB-C to my LG monitor with no trouble.

The higher resolution screen is nice. This model has run Linux apps in containers using Crostini since before I purchased it. You don't have to root it to use Linux apps. It's nice to have Atom, SSH, etc.

Otherwise, it's a Chromebook. They're all the same.

I use this for work, mostly the Zoho Web App Suite and Google Docs, and an SSH client.

The best part is the battery life.  This thing lasts 1-2 days with moderate use, and fully charges in under an hour.  It also will install apps from the Play Store is a plus.

Know what you are getting with ChromeOS before you buy.

Cons:  It’s not my favorite keyboard but I’m getting used to it.

I really like the fact that 4Gb came with a laptop of this caliber. Although it does not have a usb port for removable disk, it is still worth the $200 I paid. I am happy with the speed and memory this laptop has. I have purchased an adapter to use a removable disk with the laptop and now it is complete. I am able to use for my job and I cant forget how nice and sleek it looks. White is a nice color for this laptop. So, I would recommend and urge others to purchase if they are looking for an affordable option to fully functioning laptop.

My laptop was received without an operating system installed.  I needed to go on line with another computer and an 8 GB flash drive; so that I could download and install the new operating system.  I was able to follow the instructions and install the OS successfully.  This had been a somewhat frustrating and unexpected experience for a brand new computer.  However, now that it is done this laptop works very well.

bought this as a birthday gift and while my wife doesn't like to use her old laptop due to size, this was gets way more usage than the old one ever did. It boots up super fast, weighs very little, small enough for her to travel around with, good screen resolution and brightness, decent sound, and the battery life is great. Obviously she isn't gaming or rendering videos on this thing, but if you're just trying to get online, do some research, watch some netflix and chill, then this a good laptop (Chromebook) for you. Also, don't forget that the storage Drives on these things are tiny which is fine for her since we use Google Drive and photos for storage.

First one failed about 40 days after receiving it. Amazon replaced that (even past the 30 day period) with a new one that has been so far working as it should. These are very nice and battery life is excellent. A student could carry one of these to class, use it all day without recharging most likely. Note that these use a micro-sd card for data storage (you can also use the Google Cloud). You can store pictures on the card (a 32 gig card is the size used) so there is actually a lot more capacity than what might be believed. Note that a Windows computer can "read" these cards so you could save the contents to the Windows computer if so wished.

I bought this with the idea that it would be good for travel.  If someone stole it, I wouldn't care and that it would have a long battery life.  On those grounds, it worked beautifully!  I also use it when I go to meetups and need to have slides running on a continuous loop and don't want to worry about a device that I use regularly (for security).  I haven't experimented much with Linux on it (though it seemed to install cleanly).  Android apps have worked fine on it.  I'm definitely satisfied with this purchase!

After going through two Acer products and returning them for various problems this HP smoked them. The screen is nice, keyboard solid, and memory card addition works (yes, use a small band-aid to ensure to keep it in place). My first Chromebook was an HP and nice to see the advancements made with keeping the price point in the right spot. I was thinking 13.3 was the way to go, but compared to my prior 13.2 screen maybe a quarter of an inch larger in width. Glad I went this route and back on 14 inch but with a small format. Okay, HDMI is MIA but can buy a USB-C to HDMI for 10 bucks so if I need will purchase but not be a whiner as not on this laptop. Good Job HP you ripped this one!

This was for my 71 year old dad with 1 bad eye. In chrome OS you can't put icons on the actual desktop. You must slide the taskbar up, or tap a button. You can't put links to websites like I did for him on windows with a good description of each. You can't set it to log on without prompting for a password, which for him is almost a deal breaker. I had to guide him to type his password in if websites forgot it. To do it every time would be murder for him.

Those things I could talk him through, if he never got used to the convenience of windows. But here's what happened the first hour of use to me setting it up for him, checking all things out. In YouTube a video was playing, I was trying to delete some old bookmarks. The whole thing froze, no response, sound of the video was like a broken record. Then after 100 presses of power it did shut off. When back on, no sound. Had to reboot it to get the sound back. This is the first hour, of the first day. Be sure you all know what these are. Limited, clearly less stable than windows. Android, but not Android. I got a launcher, but couldn't link sites to it, or make it my main desktop. Facebook Android app wouldn't load, though in chrome it works fine. Just know this everyone, it's not as good as Windows, I don't care what anyone says.

This review is for HP Chromebook 14"  14-ca040nr.  The display resolution is really awesome. I like that the USB-C power/data ports  are  located on both the left and right hand side of the unit! So you can plug it in from ether side.
 This unit does have  left and right stereo speakers  mounted directly below the screen. The B&O sound system is nice I guess, hope your are not buying any Chromebook anticipating awesome sound quality.
This was purchased to replace an Acer model 720 which I have used for 5 years.  The user interface is nearly identical. My Acer suffered from battery bulging as I left it plugged in all the time. No laptop especially ones with non-replaceable batteries should be left continuously plugged  in to an AC outlet.
I really like to have a Chromebook around usually use by bedside, also when my Windows desktop is under going a 3 hour update right when I really need to get something done.
The  price on this model changes daily I paid  $299 the next day it was selling for 259. Rats... oh well it's nice and I was scared to recharge my old Acer with the battery issue.

I can't stand Windows OS anymore. To damn controlling and the forced updates that mess things up and always when i start it up because i don't use it much anymore so i might as well pour a cup of coffee and sit down for a while. Google is questionable as to how android is going, so i figured it would try a cheap chromebook. I do not care for the operating system at all. So stripped down, and everything software side sucks. have to get root access to be able to have reasonable access to file system, mouse support is crappy, and i will stop cause i could go on for awhile. Guess it is good if you only want mail and internet access. Have to hope you can  find an extension or app on the chrome store.
update 12/7/18: i really really don't like Chrome OS. Access to the app drawer is a move your mouse around to get to the drawer with two clicks instead of opening by clicking on the drawer button.  Finding files is a hit and miss deal. I installed a video downloader and only the app finds the files. Does not show in the Chrome file app, nor in the ONLY app for this in the chrome app store. Shouldn't have to go to Play store to find such a common app. Need to root to get access to files and that erases all your data on the chromebook. Updated this morning, and it took about 15 minutes before it would restart. I was freaking out that my new laptop was dead. Some warning upfront that it would take that long would be nice. That is one of the reasons I wanted to get away from Windows, and now it is starting to be the same with Chrome. So unhappy with Alphabet/Google. Maybe i need to start considering Apple.....

We've had three different "budget" Chromebooks, the Acer C720, Acer Chromebook 14 and this HP Chromebook 14 G5.  Of the three, the C720 has lasted the longest. We have young kids who are hard on the machines and only the C720 lasted.

This one only lasted one year. The trackpad is caput. It felt sturdy and of similar build quality to the C720 but ultimately it couldn't stand the test of time. Even the Acer 14 seemed to be more fragile despite it's aluminum body but that one we got two solid years of use out of.

I have to say we're disappointed with the longevity of the HP 14 G5. I was hoping it could permanently replace the C720 but it didn't.

If you don't have young kids who abuse your electronics then this is probably a fine option. It had the juice to run Android apps and we never felt it was underpowered for general web surfing, Google Docs or remoting into a work desktop with Google's remote access tool. I'm sure if it were better cared for it would have lasted much longer.

Let me start with saying, the chromebook is really nicely designed. Very lightweight. Love that it can go from computer to tablet..... BUT I feel that since this is my second purchase of the computer, I can leave an honest review. The first purchase we made, the computer kept restarting. We could not do anything. We returned it (to the store) and we purchased the same one online because we figured the other one was defective. No.. It does not restart constantly but it still restarts making the computer untrustworthy.  I wanted to use it for my son and also my nursing classes but unfortunately I am forced to purchase another one (DIFFERENT brand).

This Chromebook is a powerful thing. I can see things way better on a 14” Screen rather than a 11” Screen. The Color on the display is true-to-life and very vibrant. The color of the laptop exterior is my favorite part. HP Laptops have always been reliable, even more so with chrome inside. The laptop is super fast and very lightweight. I am definitely glad this thing comes with a warranty as well, seeing accidents happen at home or school. I intend to use this for the incoming school year and hope it meets my expectations.... so far so good. The price was very good for such a great laptop and definitely recommend.

When we bought this the first time, it worked great. One afternoon, I was minding my own business, using the computer when suddenly the screen turned grey, and then shut off. We were then unable to restart it. We then purchased the same computer again, and the same thing happened to me just today. We only got about two to three weeks use out of both of them. Therfore, it's probably not a good idea to buy these computers.

I love my new HP "14 Chromebook (14-ca040nr).  I basically use this Chromebook like a tablet.  Put another way I don't use it for work, nor for heavy duty computing.  I use it to stream videos, check email, shop on line and visit websites, to gather information.  For these type of activities, this product works fabulously well.  It is very small and light.  So far, it seems very durable and well built.  I am extremely pleased with the battery life.  10 hours is not an exaggeration.  The screen quality is also very high and video detail is excellent.  I'm very pleased with my HP Chromebook, and have no complaints thus far.

I bought this laptop to type my notes while i'm at work and at home for watching online dramas. This Chromebook  is fast and lightweight. Defiantly worth every penny I spent on it, and since Chromebooks are cheap. That's saying something. Great investment. I should of bought one sooner.

Loveee this laptop! The pure white color looks so pretty! I think it is so cool that it is touch screen and a can convert into a tablet. I teach students online and this has been a life changer. My previous laptop is bigger in size and slower since it is a few years old. This one connects well to my wifi and the video connections does not lag. I also like that I can carry it anywhere since it is small and lightweight. I have been using it for about 3 months now. To have the features of this laptop for such a cheap price is a dream come true.

*Update: Feb 6, 2020
Used this almost everyday since I have purchased it and it is still running strong! I am still in love with it!

**Update: Dec 2, 2022
I no longer have to use this laptop as my occupation everyday, but I do use this for my own leisure and it's still going strong!

This review is for the NON-touch screen 14-ca040nr.  Reviews get lumped together, so it's good to know which product you're reading about.

I'm a semi-retired IT technician, so this review comes from that standpoint.

If you're not familiar with the Chrome operating system you may want to do some independent research before purchasing a Chromebook.  While they are designed around Cloud computing (with most data being saved in Google Docs rather than locally), it's quite possible to work with the machine offline.  You can specify in Google Docs that files should be available "offline"; a copy of the file is kept locally and syncs back to the Cloud when WiFi becomes available.

Google Docs (word processor, spreadsheet, presentation software) all come with your Gmail account and is the "base" set of applications used by most folks on a Chromebook.

I've enabled Linux on the HP, and installed LibreOffice - primarily because there's no database application in Google Docs and I do a bit of work in databases.  Linux works very well on the HP for that purpose.

Linux also allows the installation of GIMP, which is a PhotoShop type image editor.

[EDIT 9/30/18 - I should note that Linux documents (such as you may create in LibreOffice) should be kept within the Linux folder structure.  Keeping such files on an SD drive doesn't work - Linux can't "see" that drive.  There may be a method to guide Linux to the proper folder.  If I take time to figure that out I'll update the review.  In the interim, plan on using a bit of the 32gb of internal space for LibreOffice docs.  The upside is that, of course, such documents are totally independent of the Cloud, just like they would be on a Windows machine).

I've enabled File System For Windows (another app) which allows me to contact to my Windows 10 Pro machine and transfer files to and from while on the same network.  Chrome RDP allows me to take control of the Windows machine while on the same network and Chrome Remote Desktop allows access to the Windows machine from wherever there is an Internet connection (without direct file transfer - if you need to swap a file, just drop it into Google Drive).

If you're a DropBox user, you can install File System for DropBox on the Chromebook.

Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, OneDrive, Outlook, etc. are all available from the Microsoft web applications.  Microsoft Access is not available on the web apps.  There are also Android apps for Microsoft (which I don't use, I use the web apps).  If you have encrypted Word or Excel files the M/S web apps can't open them.  You can install the (free) WPS office suite and it can open password locked Microsoft documents just fine.  If you enable Linux, LibreOffice can also open encrypted Microsoft documents.

Splashtop for Business works using their web app, and from that I can log into remote Windows machines (including  Windows Server 12r2).

As you can see, quite a bit of work can be done using a Chromebook - it all depends upon your needs and the setup.

The HP has a decent, but not great, keyboard.  Battery life is excellent.  Be advised - there's no dedicated "delete" key or "caps lock" key.  You can remap the "search" key to emulate a "caps lock" key but that affects cursor movement if you're working in Google Docs.  If you haven't used a Chromebook before, Google for how the keyboard works.  Takes a little getting used to, but it's doable.

There's a micro-SD card slot (I'm using a 32gb card, but it will accept larger cards if need be).  Remember that, while Chromebooks are fairly secure, the card is not encrypted by default.  There are encryption apps available for locking down the SD card.

The screen (the non-touch version) is O.K.; it doesn't come close to the Pixel screen but it costs only 1/4 as much as a Pixel.

The charger (included) plugs into either of two USB C ports - one on each side of the machine.  The machine also offers two USB A ports.

The touch-pad is good - it doesn't get in the way when typing.  However the "mouse clicks" on the pad are 'way too hard and loud.  In a library setting it would become annoying very quickly.  Better to use the 'double tap' on the touch-pad rather than click the corners.

The speakers, for this size of machine in this price range, are excellent.  (I'm not an audiophile, but they sound pretty good to me).  Unlike many lower priced units the speakers are on the Chromebook surface, not underneath or to the sides.  [EDIT 9/30/18 - Using the on board Bluetooth I was able to successfully "pair" the HP with an Amazon Echo.  Playing .MP3 files from the SD card using the on board Audio app works fine.]

Printing is still a bit of an issue with Chromebooks - if you've not used Chromebooks before, do some research on printing lest you be surprised.  Remember that Chromebooks don't accept ".exe" programs (so you can't load M/S Office from a DVD) and you can't load printer drivers (there are work-arounds but you'll have to look 'em up on your own).  Google Cloud Print is supported.  Still, most printers aren't 'plug 'n play' by simply plugging in a USB cable.  I'm printing to a Samsung, a Kodak 7.1, and an old HP4050n which is hooked up to a Windows 10 machine via Ethernet.  It may take a little more effort than you're used to with "plug 'n play" Windows.

There's no Ethernet port on the machine, but you can get adapters that use the USB C ports and have Ethernet connections.  Wi-Fi and Bluetooth are, of course, supported by default.

The power switch is above the "backspace" key and not likely to be hit accidentally - an improvement over my last Chromebook.

One note on Cloud storage - Google offers a 100gb "free" upgrade for two years (after that if you use more than the 15gb that comes with a Gmail account you have to start paying).  You can Google that - but be aware that if you have multiple Chromebooks (as I do) assigned to one Gmail account, you can't "stack" or extend the 100gb offer.  It's 100gb total for each account.  IMHO Google should change their policy on this and, if a new device is purchased for the existing account, the 100gb offer should be extended from the new date of purchase.  YMMV.

YouTube videos seem to play well - I don't play games or watch Netflix on the machine, it's more of a workhorse for me.

Out of the 32gb total internal storage, after Linux and all other apps that I use are installed, I have 18gb free space (not including the SD card).

Fit and finish is good (although the machine is basically plastic) and it weighs about 3 pounds (again, the non-touch screen version).  It is, for me, a true "laptop" machine in that the bottom doesn't get too hot to hold when it's in my lap.

Overall I'm really pleased with the HP 14-ca040nr.  I've read reviews that say that Chromebooks don't work offline, or don't offer software - and those reviews are wrong.  You just have to set the machine up properly.

HTH

Regards,

Jim

reviews.review_body:
This is a no nonsense workstation for whatever workloads you can throw at. Graphics is crisp with the RTX 3080, and the memory as is sufficient (and you can max out to 128GB if needed).

For the uninitiated, this laptop and any ThinkPad for that matter, is not known for its looks, but more than makes up in performance and ease of use.

This is a heavyduty - both in name and performance - workstation. The charger (230W brick) is heavy in itself, so you'd better get a padded backpack to carry this if you would be lugging this along.

review_topics: refurbished productinput: I'm a long time user of Acer/Gateway computers. Most if not all of the computers/laptops in my family and extended family are Acer (about 10-12 at the last count) and we've been very happy with all of them. My son had his eye on this particular 15.6" Aspire
so I purchased it for him. The computer runs Windows 8.1 (the current operating system)

but you can purchase a less expensive version without the OS and install your own (a favorite option for many). I recommend this and other Aspire computers if you're not looking for a high end gaming or business class machine.output: Acer/Gateway computers

reviews.review_body: I love this tablet. No complains so far. Beautiful line and design, good sound and resolution. The battery life is ok. I have to recharge everyday for at least 30 min, but that is to be expected. I wish it came with a better file manager but I guess there are apps for that.

I love the tablet when it works. It arrived as what I am assuming, a brand new item. This is my first tablet I have ever purchased/owned so wasn't sure what to expect. Super annoying when I'm in the middle of something like trying to read an article, watch a video, or play a game. Not sure if other people were or are having this issue or if it's something I'm doing to cause it? Even when I don't touch anything, it does it.
The tablet is good but it's highest sound is low. Even if noise in room increases little bit the sound from this tablet is not audible enough at full volume also.

Great product so far! Just received this today. It is the first tablet I now own, so I am no techy, but I am impressed with the fluidity of the screen and I am getting used to the tablet format of things. This is gonna be my on-the-go buddy from now on, especially with the Microsoft Office apps.
review_topics: on-the-go buddyinput: I'm an avid PC gamer
and just recently got this laptop to replace my old one. Just had it for a day
I'm impressed. It boots in an insanely fast 6 seconds
and the power-off to power-on time is about 15 seconds. It's a compact machine
and the brushed metal finish on the top makes it look and feel quite classy. It even has a backlit keyboard

which is great for gaming in the dark. The only irks I have with the laptop is that it has no extra buttons for volume up/down or for muting. I also find it strange that it only has 3 USB ports (2 USB 3.0 and 1 USB 2.0)
considering that most would expect a gaming laptop to have more ports. Another thing I can complain about is the crappy webcam. It's only 1.3 MP
and the image is pretty terrible. But all in all
for the price I paid for this
I find this laptop to be more than worth it. As I said
I've only had it for a day
so I can't say much about the reliability or battery life
but I'll be sure to update my review after I've used it for a while.output: gaming laptop
USB 2.0input: Good color and audio. The keyboard is pretty good for a laptop. The "chiclet" style keys also make it easy to clean. The battery life is okay

but not as good as some other laptops I've used. The strange thing is the charger. The cord just plugs into the computer with no way to lock it in place. I've had the laptop a few times where I've picked it up
and the power cord came out of the back. Also
the drivers are kind of spotty. It comes with Windows 7
and I've had a hard time finding up-to-date drivers for some of the hardware. Overall the computer is pretty good for the price
but I would rate it only 3 out of 5 stars.output: keyboard
Windows 8input: I bought this ASUS M51TA-B1 laptop in December 2010 - it will soon be 4 years since I have had it. I bought it because it was very affordable
and at the time I needed something on the go. I am very happy with my purchase. It was a great choice
since I am still using it as my primary laptop. The only issue I have with it is that it is only a 15.6" screen
and a larger screen would be more helpful. However
this seems to be the standard for laptops these days
so I guess I can't complain. It still runs pretty well
especially considering that there is a wireless router in my house that I use for my smartphone and my tablet
but the slow internet speed (512 kbps) makes it difficult to stream movies. I am very happy with the overall quality of the laptop
so I would recommend this to others looking for a good laptop for school or for basic home use.output: priced reasonably

new just the Box had the plastic seals ripped but it's nothing noticeable. 100% Satisfied

review_topics: operation input: I got the Acer TravelMate 7720-101916 17.3-Inch Laptop in April of 2010. It is now May of 2013. The laptop has been a part of my life for almost three years and It serves me very well. The keys don't stick
the battery holds a charge for hours
and the fan is quiet. The ATI Radeon HD 4330 graphics card has done well
though I am not a hardcore gamer
but I have played many games on here with absolutely no problems. The high capacity battery has lived up to its name
and despite being three years old
can still last for a good 8 hours on a full charge. For a 17.3-inch laptop
it is very light. It is only one inch thick and only weighs 6.8 lbs. As an added plus
it also came pre-installed with Windows 7 Home Premium. Overall
especially for the price.output: Acer TravelMate 7720-101916

Windows 7 Home Premiuminput: 2 years and still going! I purchased this laptop back in 2011 for my little sister to use in school and for entertainment. My experience with Acer up to that point had always been positive
so I didn't hesitate to give them another try. As usual
Acer did not disappoint. Once giving the laptop a full charge
I handed it to my sister and have barely seen it since! The laptop has been very reliable up to this point. There are no problems with the screen

or mouse pad. It runs Windows 7 64-bit with no problems. The battery still holds it charge for a few hours. My sister mainly uses the laptop for watching movies and browsing the web. She has yet to try running any games on it. The processing speed is 2.10 GHZ
which is plenty for what she uses it for. The RAM is 2 GB DDR3. I'm thinking about upgrading it to 4 G. The webcam is also a nice addition. The sound quality is pretty good
and the speakers are loud enough for the average user. Overall
if you are looking for a laptop that can handle school
I highly recommend this one.output: Acer

reviews.review_body: Wife loves it. She'd complain about her iPad all the time, slow, lockups, etc. The tab runs fast and with no problems. Only problem is when she has to recharge is, she hates having to use her notebook. Might cost more than the cheaper noname brands, but well worth it in the long run. Invest in this, you will not be sorry.

Great job Samsung ! This pad is fast and smooth. I would guess that the screen on this is about as good as you make it for the human eye. Pretty much every just pops when you request it to load. Very happy with it. I  have had four other tablets and I didn't think I would very see one this smooth.

I have purchased 4 Samsung tablets of varying qualities from Amazon.  This was just out when I purchased it.  It has seen daily use.  And I took excellent care of it.  It stopped taking a charge recently and will not turn on.  Every Samsung tablet I have purchased to date has had this problem. It just stops taking a charge after around 1.5 to  2 years of use.  I will not be purchasing another tablet from Amazon.  The protection policy I bought was no good either.  Amazon did me a disservice.

With all this scary stuff going on with the Note 7 don't let that prevent you from getting this tablet. It is amazingly light, lighter than my iPhone 6S Plus and feels great in the hand. The device is fast, can run custom roms and be rooted. The screen is beautiful as well. Just buy it.

My IPad needs repair and I thought this might be a good alternative.  It works just fine though I miss the feel of my Ipad.  The Tab S2 is amazingly  thin and light weight and, for the money, a very good value.  I haven't bought a screen protector or case yet, but I have dropped this twice and there is no visible damage
I love my tablet it's everything and more then expected, this was a hot item and you guys had it...awesome product I will buy again from you...

So glad I got this instead of another iPad to replace my old iPad!  It took a long time, but after first starting it up and signing in, it downloaded all my apps from my Samsung Note 4 phone, so it was super easy to set up!  Fast, powerful, great picture, takes a 128 gp micro sd card, thin, and light.  Definitely recommend over the iPad!!
review_topics: takes a 128 gp micro sd card

reviews.review_body: I like it a lot, only complaint so far is that when deleting emails you can only delete one at a time, unlike gmail where you can check the mails that you want to delete and then delete them all at one time.

A little marvel. The tablet is exceptionally light and well made. I haven't found anything yet to slow it down: everything works really fast. The much praised OLED screen is a missed blessing though: you do get perfect black with it, but the green tint really shows itself when view angle is not strictly perpendicular.
But hey, you want good colours, you buy a PC monitor that costs two times more than this tablet.

The product came as advertised. New packaging and obviously a new tablet. So much faster than my four year old 10.1 Galaxy tab. Soooo much faster. Absolutely love it! Samsung makes upgrading so easy to with smart switch. Copied everything, including apps, from my old tab to the new in under an hour. The display just blows away the newest Ipad side by side. Got a great price from the seller and love my new tablet.

What's not to love about this SG Tab S2!  I chose the 9.7" size which is just right...can still slip in most of my handbags.  Amoled screen is beautiful. It is very fast.  I added a 64 GB micro SD card for any apps that can be moved there to free up device storage.  Also use to store music, etc. Tab use is easy and intuitive.  I highly recommend this Tablet...thin, lightweight, easy to use.

My wife had an iPad prior to this tablet, one day all of a sudden, the screen went black.  We took it to the Apple store and they could not repair it. Normally I am not an Apple guy the only reason we purchased it was because there was an application that I could not get on android. So we purchase this tablet and it has been awesome my wife loves it

Amazing tablet - especially after having the original iPad one!  Display is gorgeous, easy to use - especially correcting text and has a delete key, which is something the iPad didn't.  Sound quality just w/ the tablet is amazing when using Spotify. I vetted this between the new iPad and reviews said the iPad had a higher quality than the "plastic" Samsung and wondered about that, but it is extremely high quality and I couldn't be happier w/ my choice.

I used this for 3 years now and it realy is a great tablet. It gets everything working. The battery is a little short living after 3 years of heavy usage, although it still lasts one day wihtout problems. Now you probably have better options. But this is a great one if you are on budget.

This is a great tablet I like how smooth it runs.no lag issues alot of the apps I use run so smooth on this beautiful tablet. It is great for game play or any other purpose. The screen is bright and vibrant. The octa core is very handy in keeping this device running smoothly, I am happy you can expand your memory with an SD card. I use this daily. Ice used many samsung tablets in the past this is definitely a huge step up.

Too expensive. Great tablet, but still second best behind Air 2 (I know the spec is bettter in some area, but Air 2 still better device when actual hand on. Just like I had a low end digital camera that took much better pictures than expensive high-end pixels canon). Tab S2 will not win over Air 2. I bought this tablet because I want android tablet. If I don't mind IOS and itune. Air 2 is a better tablet even for same price. A copy cat and 10% more expensive is just a bad way to do bussiness in general.

Quality midrange priced tablet that is as good or better than jpad. Google play app store is great and so much better than amazon Kindle app store. Tablet is fast and easy to use. Onscreen keyboard is better than ipad (has alphabet and numerical on same keyboard). Tablet also has built in back button on tablet as well as home and multi window button. Battery is decent - watching movie on 3 hr flight only took battery from 100 to 85%. Only downfall would be the android OS which can be buggy.

Awesome screen. Super light. Wicked speed.
My first one arrived with a weird defect on the back cover that I thought was only cosmetic. Within two days though the letter M in Samsung came partially detached and gave me a paper cut (its made of some thick foil). I decided that for $400 I deserve one that isn't going to pick my finger and exchanged it through Amazon. Great customer service with Amazon, too.

Beautiful, thin, fast, and easy to use tablet. It is shockingly thin, though as you'll see in any reviews you read, this does have a negative impact on battery life. Still, the tablet is fast, comes with all the benefits of Android, has a nifty fingerprint scanner that works just like the TouchID on Apple products, and has a gorgeous screen. Strongly recommended for anyone looking for a top of the line Android tablet!

Really well made tablet. I purchased a 64Gb card to add to this and it has everything we need for a mobile device like this. We use it for our travel and for around the house when using a laptop is just too much. For example watching a show on tv you may get an idea and want to research it. Performance-wise it is very responsive. Seems on par or slightly better than the iPad we had in 2015. The Pictures are VERY clear and the shutter responds rapidly. I like the flexibility if storage and applications this has over the iPad. I can see why it is becoming so popular.

Great tablet.  Lightweight, thin, excellent screen, great sound.  But if you turn it off, then plug it in to recharge, the tablet turns itself back on.  It is very difficult to get the think to stay off while it is charging.  This seems to be a common problem with this tablet.  I hope it gets resolved soon.  ...If not for this problem, I'd give the tablet a rating of 5 stars.

very quick and smooth tablet .  the charger that came in the box was defective so both samsung and amazon sent me new ones.  very pleased with  Microsoft Word and all other features.  accessories I've added are: Vostrostone  Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 9.7 Keyboard case, KuGi ® High quality Ultra-thin Detachable Bluetooth Keyboard Stand Portfolio Case / Cover+ Free stylus & OTG cable for Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 9.7 tablet,  and, Tonor Bluetooth 3.0 Wireless Mouse Ultra Slim Portable Optical Mouse 800/1200/1600 DPI  both work great with Bluetooth and handy for typing and editing.  truly portable.  tablet Bluetooth also connects to my little speaker for Pandora or Netflix

Purchased for my son for Christmas.  I had purchased an earlier generation of this tablet for him about 4 years ago, and he was complaining that it is finally wearing out, so I chose to get him the same brand again.  I also had to buy him a new cover for this tablet, since the cover for the earlier model didn't fit this one - evidently, manufacturers change their dimensions marginally in one direction or another so you can't reuse your covers.  I must leave it to a more technologically savvy reviewer to discuss the performance, but suffice it to say that my son likes the Galaxy tablets very much.

This brand of tablet was highly recommended to me by 2 friends from work & I see why they also loved this tablet.  I have been using it now for 6 months & it has run flawlessly.  The weight of it feels just right & even with the case that I added to it: https://www.amazon.com/Logitech-Keyboard-Samsung-Galaxy-920-007985/dp/B01798WM38/ref=cm_rdp_product , it is not too heavy.  Love the convenience of the additional storage card option.  This is my first Android product & it took me a bit to get used to the operational aspects.  I love it, my wife doesn't, so I guess we know who is using this most......easily recommended product overall.

I bought this tablet because my old one was running too slow. It gave me nearly five years. The tab S2 is very fast and responds quickly to commands. With 3 gigs of RAM, it can get in and out of programs very quickly. It has a high def display. The screen is absolutely beautiful. It is important to note that these new tablets are built similar to phones which is why they have both landscape and portrait displays. At 9.7 inches, the screen is more than big enough. Very good investment.

At the price I picked this up (<$200), it is great .  I work a professional job where I am meeting clients at their offices, and I use primary for basic office functions (sheets, docs, ect)/ email.  It works great for that, internet surfing, online shopping and watching videos.  Great screen quality and fast enough.

For slightly more intensive apps like games, this might not be ideal being that it is a few years old.  However, for a low price, this is a great economy tablet.

Bought one for my wife. Used it while setting it up for her. Why should she have all the fun. Bought one for myself. It is a superconvenient tool for the web, movies, pictures, reading books, all on a bright, highly pixelated screen for its size with outstanding clarity. I looked seriously at the 12.2 /Samsung but the nearly double price wasn't worth the small additional viewing area. Treat yourself in 2016. This is a beauty of a machine. Got mine in Wi-Fi, I have a Samsung Note smart phone for out of the house communications. Picture taking results are outstanding. Would have liked a longer lasting battery though. Samsung do something about this. I am on this honey most of the day. Teamed them both with a ProCase Folio Case Cover. Life is good.

Great screen, numerous options and configurations. Can hook up blue tooth mouse and keyboard for a laptop-like experience but Android is not optimized for that. Does not ever seem to get hung up when I run apps. A Windows 10 version would be even better. Great for media consumption as the screen is very rich and has high contrast. Web pages and video really pop.

Don't buy this for lots of productivty work. You need a full operating system for that. The Tab s2 9.7 is great at what it is - a Tablet for media consumption, email and web surfing. Don't try to make it what's it not and then hold it against it. Also - the 4:3 aspect ratio on a screen this size really helps make icons pop, and the interface big enough to click.

To be fair, I just received this two days ago. When it asks if I want to use Chrome or Internet, if I choose Chrome I get a pop up that says "Unfortunately, Chrome has stopped." Every time. No choices but to say Ok. It's not Ok. What is up with this? I also want to move my contacts over, but that hasn't happened yet, either. However, when I opened my Calendar for the first time, my husbands entire calendar was there! We have no connection except both use gmail. But how did his calendar get over and not mine? Another mystery. I love my Samsung Note 3 phone so thought it would be a seamless transition. Not so. I might be sending this back. Too bad as I bought a case and screen savers and keyboard to go with it.
Update: I had to uninstall and reinstall Chrome. Then I had to install another app to bring my contacts and gallery over. I'll use it today and see how it works.

Very happy with this purchase. Beautiful, light, fast and completely functional tablet at a great price. The HD Super AMOLED screen is a plus with its vivid colors and crisp images. It's refurbished, but you couldn't tell as it looks and works like new. I only give it four stars because it came with a generic charger that took at least seven or eight hours to charge from 0 to 100%. Bought a Samsung original charger at Best Buy and that solved the problem. Now it takes 3 to 4 hours to get a complete charge, which is normal considering this tablet doesn't have fast charging capabilities.100% satisfied!

I would have given this 5 starts except for two reasons:

1.) The plastic case is very slick. My old Nexus 10 had a bit of rubber on the case giving it a nice, natural grip when holding it. This tablet is just a slick plastic that I feel could slide out of my hands unless I am lifting it from the bottom.

2.) The speaker is pretty weak. There is only 1 and it is on the side, not even front facing. I get they did this to reduce bezel and width, but I felt like they could have added at least another speaker on the other side to give more a stereo effect.

Other than that this tablet is great. Bright, crisp screen. Very fast and responsive. Everything I am looking for to replace my old Nexus 10

A month in with this tablet and I'm generally really happy with it. Samsung's Android skin is extremely smooth, adds function without clouding the Android experience. Hardware powers through websites and apps without a second thought. The screen is gorgeous, deep colors and crisp blacks. Its difficult to look at my new LG G4 phone after looking at this screen; it just pales in comparison.

Big gripe, though: the battery on this thing... well, it sucks. Its really bad. It will not last more than a 3-4 hours of a lazy afternoon's heavy use (browsing imgur, a video here / there, web browsing). I have to turn it off whenever I'm not using it, otherwise it has to be tethered to it's charger.

Lastly, the thumb print scanner is not functional. Not worth the headache of setting it up. It fails no matter how carefully you replicate your initial placement. Would be nice to have an update where it continued to learn your print in the future, to make the scan more efficient.

All said and done, this is very likely the best Android tablet on the market.... for now. Google's Pixel C tablet comes out soon and I need to figure out a way to swap this Samsung for that new beast.

The tablet is very thin and light.  Very easy to hold with one hand for reading.  The screen is beautiful, and it has plenty of power for playing games.  There are just a couple of small things I wish they would have added to the tablet.  It doesn't seem to have any notification lights like you have on phones.  So, if I get messages when the sound is off, I don't know that they came in.  It also doesn't seem to have a vibrate setting, so notifications are either muted or noisy.  Having a Galaxy S5 phone, so I expected a USB3 charging port on the tablet, but it just had a regular micro-USB port.  The battery lasts a long time, and I've often charged it over night, so I'm not sure how long it takes to charge, or if having the USB3 port would make it charge faster.  Overall though, it's a great tablet.  I'm very happy with it.  I'd recommend it for sure.

Okay, its not a big secret that I am fans of the Samsung tablet lines. The screen looks great when I look at my pictures, there is no complaint there, the 4-3 ratio is a little bit weird unless you are a reader than it will work out well for you. Watching HD movies is not a bad thing, but you will notice that there is some wasted space. Apps, now when you star your device there are a bunch of choices to pick from. Yes there is pre installed software but most of it was things i was going to use anyways. there are two app stores to chose from but i normally just use the google one. The cameras, while not the best, I find that I dont normal use the cameras for much more than when I am video chatting with friends. I find that I normally use the tablet for a few hours at a time but never have to plug in unless I am going to sleep. I dont have battery issues so i guess I got lucky. The storage is never an issue bc you have the 32 or 64 gig and than you also have the option to add an SD card too.
All in all I find myself enjoying my new tablet and turned the slower one into a media device. Its worth the upgrade and if you are thinking about this one and wondering, Yes this is worth it.

This is a pathetic device. Since beginning the device had issues related to charging. The tablet used to display message to use original charger in order to charge it quickly. But this message was not coming very frequently. But now after 2 months, device is showing this message all the time and device is not getting charged at all. Its a big CHEATING by seller. I tried to charge it with my another samsung cable (original USB cable that came with my earlier samsung new device), but still this tablet is showing me the same message. It seems there definitely a problem with device. I would not recommend this to anyone. I want my refund back but amazon.com website is saying that their return policy is for only 30 days. I am feeling cheated. I want my refund back

If you are looking for a tablet and not obsessed with getting an iPad look no further!  I am very familiar with both iOS products and Android products.  I have owned a Nexus 7, Galaxy S5, Galaxy S4, Nexus 5, Nexus 7, iPhone 6, and iPad Air 2.  The Android products are what I choose to use at home and for personal use.

I debated for a long time between getting an Android tablet or a new iPad for my own personal use.  Based on my experience with Android devices, especially Samsung devices, I was concerned that the user experience and operating system would not be smooth.  My Galaxy S5 and S4 both experienced glitches and flaws that would sometimes frustrate me.  But Apple products are just so much more expensive and not easily customizable.  When Black Friday rolled around I was able to snatch up this tablet for $340; if the product turned out to be a dud I could always return it using Amazon's excellent return policy.

I don't know what Samsung did to resolve their issues but this tablet operates very smoothly; much better than my previous experience with their devices.  First there is absolutely no lag when swiping or loading apps; everything transitions smoothly and provides the kind of experience you would expect from an iOS device.  Secondly the device is very thin and extremely appealing; I chose to get the white version.  The battery life is excellent, I watched 6 hours of Netflix and still had plenty of battery life left.  Thirdly it is very customizable which is of course one of the primary reasons users choose Android in the first place.

You should get this device if you are on the market for a tablet and not obsessed with the idea of owning an Apple device.  I have a hard time imagining a better tablet on the market right now and especially for the price point.

I LOVE, no, I ADORE AMAZON.  Their customer service is EXCELLENT!!!!

First, let me say that I adore this tablet! The clarity in picture, and functions are amazing. I have been super happy with this product. I did A LOT of research before finally deciding on The Samsung Gallaxy Tab S2 with a 9.7" screen and have not been disappointed with the performance of the tablet except for one thing...The charging port. I don't know if I got a defective port, or if this is a weak point for this product, we shall see.

I purchased this tablet about a year prior to the problems with the port. At the same time I purchased the tablet, I did purchase a two year protection plan through Square Trade for $40. Unfortunately, the warranty through Square Trade would not kick in until after the Samsung warranty ran out. I spent a very frustrating morning looking for HELP through Samsung regarding their warranty on the tablet and what to do when something went wrong with it. I found NOTHING. I looked online, made a few phone calls that lead no where. I thought it would be so easy, but it wasn't. Samsung needs to fix this. If you're going to offer a warranty that comes with your product, include information with the product so a customer may follow through with help in the event there is a problem. The information included with the tablet, gave me nothing but dead ends. I called the numbers in the booklet, and the numbers were not up to date and with no help whatsoever to resolve the issue.

My partner could see my frustration. I wasted time, and energy leading to dead ends, and he suggested I call Amazon for help. I thought there was no way Amazon would be able to help because it was an issue with the warranty through Samsung. NOT TRUE. Not only was my problem SOLVED, but Amazon sent me a REPLACEMENT tablet in TWO DAYS and gave me 30 days to send the tablet with the defective port back!

AMAZON STANDS BY THEIR PRODUCTS. GIVES THE MOST AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE SO THE ***CUSTOMER*** IS HAPPY WITH THEIR PURCHASE AND CAN PURCHASE WITH UTTER CONFIDENCE!!!!

I would NOT want to purchase items ANYWHERE ELSE if I can purchase them though AMAZON. I ALWAYS check Amazon FIRST before I purchase ANYTHING. The prices are competitive, the customer service is OUTSTANDING and without a doubt STELLAR!

Thank you AMAZON for turning around a very frustrating situation into an experience that ended up being RESOLVED painlessly. THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU!!!!

Love on first sight!!! this tablet is fantastic, fast, light, full of storage and Ive got it with a very good price. After just 7 months of use,  the original fast charger which is included stopped working. I'm not complaining the seller,  which by the way is very good, I'm complaining to the quality of Samsung and the rest of technology suppliers which are not cheap but have decrease the quality to an extend that we don't find a good quality device any more at reasonable prices.

Pros:
1. Very lightweight and comfortable to hold.
2. Great screen.
3. 4:3 screen ratio is so much more comfortable than 16:10 or 16:9 I used previously on tablets.
4. Very fast.

Cons:
1. No notification light. That's very surprising move from Samsung. Why remove it?
2. MicroUSB port is located far to the right, so it is highly unlikely there will be a charging cradle/holder for this tablet. Or it will be made specifically for this tablet and useless for all other devices because of weird location.
3. Headphone jack is located on the bottom just like on the phones like Samsung Galaxy S6, but it is great for phones and not so great for the tablets, especially this one as it will be used vertically most of the time... I wish it was on top like on iPads.
4. 3 physical buttons are not easy to use when using tablet horizontally. I wish there was an option to turn virtual buttons (app switch, home, back) in this mode.
5. No wireless charging. Small weight is nice but wireless charging at expense of some weight would be amazing.
