6. Require case because of the camera unit.

Excellent tablet, even for the uninformed masses like myself.  It it so airily light, there is no arm strain from holding for hours.  Good battery life, likely to last you all day from average use.  I like the screen, both in output and dimensions though others may crave a 16:9 ratio I like the 4:3 more myself.  I love the expandable memory; just dumped a bunch of movies on there on a 128gb microsd card.  Very responsive performance, no percievable lag or slowdown at any point.  Worth the money.

WOW.  This tablet is crazy awesome!  I've used an iPad Air 2 for a while but I really wan't like iOS.  I like my iPhone but I played with a couple of android tablets at best buy and decided that was what I wanted for a tablet I use for reading comic books, books, and watching movies.

I bought a Fire HD 10 recently but the screen resolution and os stability was off, stuff worked but not very well.  I ordered this 9.7" model after playing with a friend's 8.0" model and it's just impressive.  It's fast, no stutter, the apps work, the screen is beautiful and it's light.  Even with a cover attached, it's still light.

It was kind of more expensive than I would have liked but I'm using it heavily and it's just great.

Before I purchased this tablet, I owned the Tab A 9.7 and loved it, except the lower resolution. Finally, I decided to step up and upgrade to the Tab2 S 9.7 and I am so glad I did as I state the reasons why below:

PROS/SPECIAL FEATURES...

+ Size/Weight/Ease oh holding this S2 9.7 - I had the Tab A 9.7 and before that Tab4 10.1. Both of my old tablets were THICKER and heavier compared to the S2. This tablet is feather light for a 9.7 and more comfortable to hold and to carry in my purse or backpack.

Screen Resolution, Brightness and Other Info – The resolution on this is 264 ppi compared to 132 ppi (pixels per inch) of Tab A 9.7. This is more than double the resolution. And note that the colors, pictures, videos, everything is so sharp and clear. The screen just pops with color! And I find it easy to read eBooks, watch videos, etc on this tablet. Even at a higher price for this tablet, I find that the tablet has been a wonderful purchase.

* The screen aspect ratio is 4:3 vs the 16:1 type of screen. For me, I like this 4:3 screen because I found that the webpages are easier to read and clearer, I did not have to scroll to the right. Also I found that the pictures on a website were easier to view. I compared this tablet with my older Tab 4 10.1 tablet on my frequent webpages and while I viewed this tablet, I could read the larger text better, read my eBooks much clearer, emails better etc. This is my personal discovery from my testing of this and comparing it to my older tablet.

+ Battery life/Speed – Good battery life, but not quite as good as my oldercaTab4 or TabA. For me, I have found that I am constantly on WiFi (Internet). One of the reasons is the screen is noticeably brighter (Tab S2 has more brightness nits). So I had to lower the brightness.
The tablet I find is quite responsive and peppy with no lagging. The Lollipop 5.1.1 runs this tablet wonderfully.

 WiFi Connecting/Speed of WiFi and MORE - This tablet connects SUPER quickly to my home WiFi and has never ever dropped the WIFi signal no matter where I am in my home. WiFi is VERY STRONG at 144mbps, vs 72mbps on my other tablets. Also, my internet loads super, super fast in all browsers that I tried.. And even when I am far from my router I still have 4.5 bars! I went to Settings, pressed on WiFi and it showed speed on my tablets. A,lso, to test this WiFi and compare it to my other Android devices, I went to the Playstore and got the free app called WiFi Analyzer. This is a MUST HAVE app for any Android device as it gives you a visual report on the WiFi strength of your tablet, phone etc.The Wifi speed on my Tab S2 is near double of what my TabA had.
Also, there is 32GB Ram in the Tab S2, this is double Ram of Tab A or Tab 4. And this tablet is super fast, no lagging at all!

+ SPECIAL INFO about INTERNET CONNECTION - Yes, this is a WiFi only, but when you are away from an WiFi internet hotspot location, there are ways to can get onto the internet such as MiFi and there are ways that you can purchase equipment so that you can have data when you do not have a WiFi hotspot available.

+ Internet & Webpage & Video Viewing - The stock browser does a wonderful job and it opens up webpages very fast. Also I tried Maxthon Browser and this worked very well yet I still prefer the Internet App. Also, I tried out the factory installed Chrome Browser and liked it OK, yet again, I went back the the stock Internet App (this is my preference). Note that the Playstore has many very good (FREE) internet browsers as Dolphin, Opera and many more!

+ EXTERNAL SLOT FOR MICRO SD CARD/Internal Storage. This is a must for me as I keep my personal files, photos, and music on my internal SD card. I installed a SanDisk 64GB SD card and it works great on this tablet and I placed my music and files on it and have plenty of space left. This tablet accepts up to 128GB SD card.
The internal storage of 32GB is double of my Tab A 9.7 or Tab 4 10.1 that have 16GB. Even after Android OS, factory apps, Facebook, Twitter, Kindle App and many more personal that I installed, I still have  just at 23GB of internal storage left!

- + Camera / Video Camera - This has a camera of 8MP with no flash on this camera, however, in good lighting the pictures came out much better had I expected. However, I rarely use this camera as I prefer to use my Nikon digital camera for my overall picture taking...the camera on this tablet is OK for backup camera, taking pictures to send in an email, etc). Do not expect the camera on this tablet to replace your digital camera since it does not have a flash.

+ Home Videos - The stock video player is OK and plays MOST home videos, however, may I suggest QQ Player (Free App from Playstore and the ONLY one I recommend as it plays every home video I tried)..

+ Music Player/Sound Quality - This model has the regular MUSIC App, which plays by playlists, songs, albums and even folders. Also there is Google Music app is pre-installed in this tablet and does a fine job. However, I installed the FREE app called Rocket Player from the Playstore and love this music player! As for sound quality - The best way to really enjoy music is through a high quality Bluetooth speaker or Bluetooth headset as the sound quality is superb this way and you can walk about your home listening to your music!

+ OTG USB Compatible - This tablet comes with a free OTG On the Go adapter cable. Just plug in your flash drive and you can copy files to the flash drive so easily or view files that are on the flash drive. *Note that portable external hard drives and portable DVD/CD drives will not work using OTG in this tablet because they require a lot of power.

CONS:
-  Battery life is so-so, not the best out there. In fact, I had close to 2 hours less per day on the Tab S2 over the Tab A!  But this is not a deal breaker for me as I still have enough battery time, and I always keep a spare charger in car/purse.

- Cost is pricey compared to Tab A line or the Tab 4 line. The price difference us about 100 dollars more for the Tab S2 9.7, however, for me, I believe that I received a very high end tablet, so it was worth what I paid.

Bottom line- Yes, this is a pricey tablet, however, I believe that the old saying that you get what you pay for is true. This is a very high quality tablet.

Should you buy this or the Tab A or a less expensive tablet in my opinion?  While this is an exceptional tablet, I also recommend a couple of others below....

TAB S2 ... Yes you may want to consider the Tab S2 9.7 if you want a higher resolution tablet with larger Internal space, 8MP camera and other high end features and you do not mind paying about 100 dollars more for higher end features etc.

TAB A 9.7... Yes if you want a good tablet for a reasonable price and do not mind lower resolution or 16GB Internal, 5 MP camera, etc, yet this is good because the battery lasted me 2 more hours daily than Tab S2. The TAB A is a wonderful tablet for the money) or Tab 4 10.1, or other lower priced tablet. A 5 MP camera us OK on a tablet for emergency pictures, 16GB Internal is OK if you watch how many apps you install on the internal storage.
Also, the Tab A is a GREAT BUY and excellent for someone new to tablets.

If you have questions, ask me in comments. I am kind of a techie person and will answer promptly.

Thank you for reading my review.
review_topics: OTG On the Go adapter cable

product_title: MSI Pulse GL66 15 6 QHD 165Hz Gaming Laptop Intel Core i9 12900H RTX3070 16GB DDR5 1TB NVMe SSD Win11 Black 12UGOK 825
product_description: Intel Core i9 12900H RTX3070 16GB DDR5 1TB NVMe SSD Win11

reviews.review_body: Amazing laptop

product_title: Dell Latitude 7000 7320 Laptop 2021 13 3 FHD Core i7 1TB SSD 16GB RAM 4 Cores 4 4 GHz 11th Gen CPU Renewed
product_description: Intel Core i7 Processor Released in 2021 The Latitude 7320 Laptop is Dell s latest release in the 13 Latitude 7000 family It includes a 2 year warranty with on site Next Business Day Service and comes with all the latest technology including DDR4 Memory clocked at a whopping 3200MHz anda 11th generation Intel 4 core Processor The Quad cores on the Core i7 1185G7 processor allows for exceptional multitasking To save power and prolong battery life the processor will run 1 8Ghz under lo Display Graphics This Latitude 7320 Laptop comes with a 13 3 Non Touch Screen with FHD 1920x1080 resolution for stunningly clear visuals and a an integrated graphics card built into the Intel Core i7 1185G7 processor which will use the computer s 16GB of RAM for the graphics memory High Speed RAM And Enormous Space The 16GB DDR4 RAM Running 3200MHz will let you smoothly run multiple applications and browser tabs all at once and a 1TB 1000GB PCIe NVMe M 2 Solid State Drive will provide fast startup data transfers and large file storage Operating System Windows 10 is Microsoft s most battle tested Operating System and if you want to upgrade to the latest windows 11 windows 11 is a simple free upgarade through windows update Windows Pro comes with everything that Windows Home comes with plus extra features your organization might require like active directory and bitlocker device encryption normally an 100 upgrade if purchased seperately Extra Details A Wecbam comes integrated Wifi and Bluetooth come integrated PORTS SLOTS uSD 4 0 Memory Card Reader External uSIM card tray optional Thunderbolt 4 with Power Delivery and DisplayPort USB Type C USB 3 2 Gen 1 with Powershare HDMI 2 0 Wedge shaped Lock Slot Thunderbolt 4 with Power Delivery and DisplayPort USB Type C Universal Audio Jack

reviews.review_body:
First: The included charger was very small and the first screen I saw when I turned it on tells me "You have plugged in a lower wattage power adapter. Your system will continue to work, but may not perform at its peak." Really? $700 for a refurb and you cannot even send the proper charger? So I continue with the first boot and choose region and keyboard as usual then am greeted with a screen asking me for my Booking.com email address. What? I do not even know what booking.com is and there is no way to bypass this screen. See attached photos. The first screen informing me of the too small power adapter also had the Dell Service Tag number so I went to Dell to look that up. Turns out this service tag number has Dell ProSupport Plus until 25 September 2024. Wow. That seems too good to be true but I learned the machine needs a 65W adapter and you can see in the last photo the included adpater is only 45W. I might forgive the 45W adapter but I have never had a new Windows 10 machine ask me for my Booking.com email address upon the first boot. I cannot imagine what other surprises would await if I knew how to bypass that screen.

Update 9/29/2023: Thank goodness for Dell support. I was able to download and install the factory image from Dell so this laptop now appears to be okay and usable. I have no idea what the refurbish company had put on this machine but it was not a clean windows 10 pro image. HQCapital support has been very responsive (+1star) and is sending the correct charger for this machine.

product_title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 7 Inch Gold Brown 8 GB 2013 Model
product_description: Android 4 1 2 Jelly Bean OS 1 2 GHz dual core processor 8 GB Flash Memory 1 GB RAM Memory Store photos videos music and more with up to 64GB of memory available through a microSD slot and 50GB of free Dropbox storage Camera 3MP rear facing 1 3MP front facing

reviews.review_body: I had it for a few weeks and then when I grabbed my backpack it came flying out and shattered. Totally My Fault, and that's why I just ordered another one. The $20 dollars I am saving I will use for the insurance. Great little Tablet and I am still not in the Cult Of Apple Products!!!

I am very excited to own this tablet.  the colors on screen are vived.  the speed to connect online is very good.
having received it about 2 weeks ago, I am still on the learning curve.  I use it every day to become more fluent in the use and potential of this tablet.

Great 7" tablet running Android at a great price.. Has everything equivalent to my iPad, but more control over your device.. Only reason that I didn't rate it five stars is due to Samsung's design... The tablet is very slippery & slides out of your hands easily.. Definitely buy a tablet case/cover if you purchase this item!!

Purchased this on sale so the price was great. I bought this to use as a universal remote thinking I could ditch the multiple remotes laying around. All of the control features are app based and I have not found the right one for my needs yet. Works well and holds a decent charge.

I bought this to replace a defective tablet of another brand, that I had purchased my grown daughter for Christmas.  It was a good price, and there have been NO problems at all.  She uses her tablet on a daily basis, carries it with her and she loves it.  Rarely does she ever use her laptop anymore as this does all she needs to do.  Would highly recommend this, and the price was VERY good, much lower that the box stores.

This was a gift to my son for Christmas!  I worried that the 7 inch might be too small, but he says it is just the right size for his busy graduate student lifestyle.  Not as bulky as some Tablets can be.  We added a leather case with a wireless keyboard to complete the gift.  He couldn't be happier.  It's fast, it's efficient, it has a lot of features.  Couldn't be happier with this purchase.  Well worth the money!

The samsung tab 3 is a great tablet. I was searching for a relatively small tablet for portability. Don't let the size (7 in) deter you. The screen clarity and resolution are top notch. I typically use this tablet in conjunction with video viewing apps such as espn, att uverse, etc. The small size allows you to keep up with sports games and tv shows while grilling, cooking, or doing household chores. This was by far my best electronics purchase of 2014.

I do love my iPad, but I will say for something small and portable, this is very good. Had a great price point and fits good in my hand. Registration is a bit of a pain, and there is no iHeart radio in the samsung app store, but it still has a majority of the other major apps.

I was worried the 7 inch screen wouldn't be big enough but it's perfect and easy to stash in my coat pocket and carry with me.  I useit to follow the stock market during the day at work and it connects easily to wifi wherever I am.  I didn't think I would like the onscreen keyboard and would need a separate Bluetooth keyboard but so far it's not been an issue for me.  I highly recommend this tablet and I think you'll really enjoy it.

This thing is impressive. I know it is now outdated, but I thought it is sometimes nice to hear the long term satisfaction.  My Jr High boy has had this for a year and a half. He takes care of his stuff, but this thing has performed flawlessly for that long. Still works fantastic. I am really impressed. He puts hours and hours on it. Games, netflix, texting, blah blah blah. Seriously, I see why people like this.

I have read review after review about what is the best tablet. I have to say for the price this one was perfect for what I needed it for. I have not experienced any issues with my tablet picking up Wi-Fi or lagging. It does what I need it to do when I need it done. I haven't weighed it down with too many apps so that my be a factor. I use it more for leisure if that helps, and I am currently happy with my tablet.

i gave it a 5 star rating because I was really impressed. It offers so much more than the Kindle. I like thst its quite user friendly. I was worried about the color, because I really wanted a black and the white one looked like a toy, so I was happy to see that the gold-brown, was dark enough and so kept the sleek, sophisticated image. I would recommend this product to anyone who is interested in having a light mini computer at his or her fingertips.

This tablet is very practical and comfortable to use, helped me a lot to synchronize multiple computers in my house with the apps that I downloaded, and you can download an endless number of applications to be used, I have no complaints of this tablet, it has simplified my many of my tasks both at home and at work.

Initially, I loved it, but it does have some serious design flaws.

The most serious design flaw is that the receptacle for the power cord is not well secured to the housing, and eventually (as in 10 months) it got pushed inside the device, so that it can't be charged, and therefore can't be used.

The other problems with it are that the WiFi seems very slow, and that the "return to previous screen" button is placed just where you want to put your hand to hold the device, so that programs quit seemingly at random.

I own a TAB2 and I must say that the performance is the same. However if you dont have a TAB 2 get this since the design is superior. the TAB3 gives a more sturdy hold since i feel like my TAB2 can roll out of my hand with its rounded smmoth design, not so with the TAB3. Also with the TAB3 actual buttons for home and back its more convenient than the TAB2 which had a display touch screen home button which can be a hassle with screen rotation.

I ordered 3 Tabs for presents. 2 work fine, but 1 Tab flickers when the back light setting is turned down to its lowest setting. It was sent back to Samsung. If 1 out of 3 Tabs had this problem, I feel there is a pretty good chance of getting one that doesn't preform properly. The other 2 are nice.

I got this product pretty fast in the mail practically "brand new". The only thing wrong was a dent in the packaging. I'm still learning how to use it but this was a good buy. My only cons on this product so far would be that the screen sometimes is very sensitive but overall I'm satisfied with the product I received.

Device challenged, I bought this tablet after reviewing the list of devices that would support a "Square or Jax".  It does not support these e-commerce additions because it was the wrong version.  I was disappointed but realized I could input credit cards manually so decided to keep it and upgrade later.  However, my Son may be right, Apple products may be more suitable.  I noticed it has a pretty short battery life.  Not what I had hoped for and wish I hadn't bought another one at the same time as a gift.  Think I'll return the second one.

I am sorry I waited so long to buy one. However, I'm trying to figure out why there is no multi- screen. I am using it as a wireless keyboard and mouse in connection with my laptop when I'm watching in bed. I am also using it as a remote connection so I can use my laptop anywhere. It works great.

Aside from no flash this is a great tablet. Links up to wifi with no problem. Easy to use with nice sounding speakers and even better sound with headsets. HD picture is great. You can load lots of music and pics on SD Card. Apps install quickly. If you want a tablet to use with wifi only consider this one.

A pretty nifty little gadget. It's not a cellphone, it's not a pc, it's the perfect tablet. It fits comfortably on your hand and is not tiresome to hold but is not too small either.

With this one I got an issue. One night it discharged completely and the next day it didn't wanted to turn on. Even after I left it charging for a long time. The next day I brought it to work and connected it to the pc for a long time. It worked perfectly fine afterwards.

This tablet is great. Only wish I could have afforded a bigger screen version, and  I think it should come standard with a screen saver already on it . I bought my kid a Dell and it came with one already on it, perfectly
perhaps tablet makers can either follow suit or make it an option. An option that they could charge an additional, nominal fee, of course
aside from that I'm very well pleased with this tablet. It does all I need and more. Always been a Samsung fan.

When I received this item it was sealed in its original box as if it was brand new.  Everything was there no problems with the devise and I have used it everyday since I received it.  It is my alarm/nightstand/music desk clock.  I love the color.  I bought an Otterbox outside case with stand and it is the best tablet I have seen or had.  Fast and I can sync it with my Samsung Galaxy S4 cell phone and Dell Laptop.  It's great at this price.

Is a very good tablet sometimes freeze and need to restart when I use Google Maps and try to use Street View. This 7 inch model does not allow to use multi-user I don't know why this feature is very important nowadays, because I bought this tablet for all my family and each one has their own account. But is OK for this moment.

I'm a Mac person. iPhone, iPad, iMac, Macbook.  I'm taking a class in cloud computing and we are working on Google drive.  I thought I'd buy an android device.  I thought android would be more compatible with all the google apps.

This Tab3 is really clunky.  I found it s-l-o-w.  While supposedly running a 1.2gb processor and 8gb flash memory and 1gb memory.  It became really annoying while trying to open an app, then it would automatically close.

I tried to load some music on it.  I found on Youtube, a suggestion to connect it as an external drive than upload.  I unloaded one album, but could never find the music.  Another suggestion was to download an app called 'Kies' -  Kies asks if I wanted ALL my music, and i checked 'NO' I then downloaded one album, when I opened my Galaxy Tab3, I couldn't find the music, but i did find my entire iPhoto library.

Trying to delete my photos was impossible, unless I deleted them one at a time.  I had over 4,000 photos uploaded.

Finally getting so frustrated, I wiped it, reset to original condition, repacked it and sent it back to Amazon.

I've had this tablet for four months, and barely have the energy to try to use it. To wake it up, I have to press the button repeatedly, or even try the power button. Eventually it does turn on, and that's when the challenge begins.

Most times I am trying to watch a video, the tablet freezes and makes a maddening noise. The only way I was able to stop it was by trying to turn it off repeatedly, since I couldn't figure out how to open it and remove the battery.

Typing anything when browsing the internet is a challenge. I press a letter and it takes a few seconds for the letter to be entered. And it freezes or opens other pages when I simply get my finger too close too a link. If I try the back button, it usually doesn't work or simply kicks me out of the internet.

I should clarify that I have not overloaded my tablet with apps. The internal memory has more than half left. Samsung support suggested I clear my internet apps completely, but this didn't work. I simply hate this product and will have to try to get it replaced or just throw it out the window.

Seen some bad reviews for this.  I have to say that I don't agree this tab is great.  If you are familiar with the Android system then the useage of this tab should be no problem at all.  If you have a gmail account it will sync with it and load all apps and info to it that you have on other Android devices.  It does have instructions but like all Samsung products you have to go online to get the manual as that's how they do it to save paper.
Excelente tab

The galaxy tab 3 7" is quite a good gadget. It meets most of my expectations though I'm still acquainting myself with it. I give it a 4-star rating because I am yet to fully explore all its features and do not know what I will find and because the battery life though ok, is not quite as good as I expect it to be.

I was very satisfied with my Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 until it fell out of my hand and the face shattered.  I think the best improvement that can be made is to make the face shatter proof.
This tablet takes beautiful pictures and one of the features that I like the most is that it can control any TV.  On, off and change channels.

I wanted to get a tablet and after looking around I chose the Samsung.  This 7 inch is small enough for my handbag and light compared to the others.  Amazon was the only place I could get the brown one.  I can't say much more as I haven't really got into it yet but the kids are doing fine.  I think if I was going to use it for pramarily for reading I would get the 8 inch but the 8 is a little heavier so it would be a trade off.

I ordered the Gold-Brown one but received the black in instead, which was the first time I ever had that problem.  I have another Galaxy through Sprint that I pay $15.00 a month for.  This has no monthly fee and works great with my internet service inside my home or outside.  I order this one for my daughter  as well as Chromecast, she loves it!

Met all expectations and research prior to buying. Easy to set up and intuitive, user friendly. My wife wanted this Galaxy Tab 3  for health care provider applications. She likes it a lot better than previous devices like Palm Pad. This 7" is a very good size for transport and screen viewing. Excellent resolution and pretty generous memory. Even with Epocrates healthcare software loaded, I have not needed to install a memory card that is available. So far, no issues with battery life either, a pleasant outcome. A lot of capability for under $200. I highly recommend.

I was hoping the other reviews about picking up the wifi just had to do with other peoples wifi connections, but it is doing the same with mines as well. I have perfect internet at my house, but you have to be close to the router in order to get good signal otherwise is very slow.  Love that you can print from this tab, which is a plus

its $150, what are you expecting, it works great for what i wanted it for, but compared to my galaxy s3, the camera is worse, the screen has a lower resolution, it is noticeably slower, and it has less ram, however it does have a nice screen, and an infared blaster that can be used as a remote control for your tv, or others if you want to have fun.

I received my Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 and had no problems setting it up. Two days later when I went to use it the screen was frozen and would not allow to use the tablet.

I made three calls to the Samsung Tech support people This did NO GOOD at all. I felt they were lacking in solving the problem. Their answer was " you need to send it in for service" I called Amazon and they provided me the option of a refund or a new device.

In all fairness I elected to try the tablet. I can only say Amazon is the BEST. I will post  a updated review.

This is my first time using something other than an apple product and I love it.  I have been an iphone and ipad user since they arrived on the scene and have been drinking the cool aid ever since .  My experiment with Samdsung galaxy has been an eye opener.  The Tab 3 7 inch works great for me.  I do recommend getting versions with built in wifi.  This version is great around the house and anywhere wifi is available.  ALL stars from me.  Samsung Galaxy,  out of the park.  M

I did what I thought was a good deal of research before buying this. Unfortunately, none of the review articles (and certainly not the Samsung site) will let you know that this device will not work with many of the accessories. Most important is the lack of an HDMI connection via MHL/micro-USB port (I also wasn't able to get any of the micro USB to USB connectors to work with this device and couldn't get the Peel remote to control the TV). I didn't find this out until I had already bought a MHL/micro-USB to HDMI connection and tried to get it to work. Don't bother, it wont. If you want to attempt to connect this device to a television, there is no good way that I can think of. Apparently the 8 and 10.1 models have this capability. Nothing on the Amazon or Samsung websites point out this discrepancy. Even the older (Tab 2 models) can be connected via a dock, not the Tab 3 7-inch though. Returning my 7 inch tablet as a result.

I purchased for just for the sole purpose of playing games for my 5 yr old daughter..and watching movies in the car..it is alittle sluggish at times..not the fastest..but I knew that from watching reviews and the price..but would recommend to others..great for the price and good function..I have used it as a big Navi screen on a small trip..worked great..I jus turn on my Wifi on my phone and good to go..

Sadly, I didn't read all the reviews or the description carefully enough, or else I would have known that 8GB wasn't going to be enough. My son has downloaded about 15 apps, and that's all she wrote. Internal memory is almost full, and since you can't move apps to the SD card, well, for every new app he wants to download, we'll have to uninstall one. Of course you can't uninstall all the preloaded crap (why do they keep doing that to us?!).

As for the rest, the picture is beautiful and great for watching Netflix. The empty SD card is waiting for when my son is interested in taking pictures and listening to music.

It's a great machine when it's working fine, just like my Galaxy 3 phone but has a tendency to freeze often when playing games and has to be restarted.  It was given to my wife as a gift and she started to complain about the freezing.  When playing Angry Birds it acts kinda whacky.  I know that doesnt say much except that Angry Birds becomes un-playable.  The screen flashes, the birds do not react to the correct finger movements and go off in the opposite direction.  When play slots it will just freeze.  I hoping that Samsung will address this issue and put out a software patch to fix this soon.

We bought two tablets for our daughters for Christmas.  Each received the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (7 inch).  Our daughters are 11 and 9.  It was a perfect gift.  First, the price was very reasonable for a quality product.  They use their tablets each day playing games, skyping with relatives and friends, email, etc.  And what I love most is that they enjoy it.  It was hard to justify buying an ipad for them when the Samsung offers everything for them that an ipad would.  And our experience with all Samsung products has been a good one.

I bought this to use with my credit card reader for my business and now I don't really need it. I decided to keep it to put my finished photography pics on it to show people. After 2 weeks I finally figured out how to do that and I'm fairly good with computers. Unless you have readily available wi-fi, it's pretty useless.There's no real manual for it. What happened to manuals anyway? It has apps I don't want, need or can't figure out a use for. It seems like every app has to go thru google + and who likes google +? The screen is clear and the speakers are OK. I feel like I bought an expensive radio.
review_topics: relatively inexpensive laptop for general use (surfing internet
etc.). I purchased this laptop to replace my existing Asus EeePC 1005PE netbook
which is several years old and starting to show its age. The EeePC has served me well over the years

but its small size and limited processing power were becoming limiting. The Asus VivoBook X202E-DH31T was a good value at $249. The only other current laptop I found for under $300 was a Celeron-powered HP Stream 11
which is likely slower. I preferred Asus over HP
and the VivoBook's Pentium processor was a significant upgrade over the EeePC's Atom processor. After a week of use
I am very happy with the VivoBook. The screen is large and clear
and the keyboard is comfortable to type on. The processor is plenty fast for general use
and the 500GB hard drive provides ample storage space. The only downside is that the battery life is only about 5 hours
but that is still better than my old netbook. Overall
I am very happy with the Asus VivoBook X202E-DH31T. It is a great value for the price
and it is perfect for general use.output: Asus EeePC 1005PE

reviews.review_body: The tablet is great it works very close to my samsung phone the only reason I didn't give 5 stars is I wish I could move apps over to as  card without having to connect to computer.I thought I could but my mistake in assuming all samsung android devices were alike.I got the 8GB but I would highly recommend 16GBP especially if u like to download lots of games but overall the tablet is a good tablet

Within 2 weeks of giving this as a gift to my dad who is retired - he has been enchanted with all the features, the convenience.  He loves that with a wireless router he can sit in the living room with mom  and play his games, read his e-mails and check his stocks and not have to sit alone in his office at his computer.  The quality is good and with all the apps the opportunities to learn and discover is endless. Dad is 81 and his mind is very, very sharp.  This will keep his mind active and healthy.  He loves it!

I wanted this tablet cause I figured It would be like my phone and it is the problom is its almost exactly like the phone its to restricted from certain on the web I wanted a tablet that was more like a laptop like my last one. I like it but I dont love it it often freezes and the worst freeze and kicks me out of what im doing. It has a fairly slow response on almost everything but otherwise its ok. I think it has a pretty good battery life.  But if I could I'd probably get something else. Maybe my expectations were to high but thats the product I have so im slightly disappointed.

This was a simple and elegant solution for my wife.  She wanted a pad, but did not want to have a data plan.  She uses it on our WiFi at home and at her office.  She uses it mainly for Google searches, e-mail (Yahoo), and Facebook.  It does all of that well.  For most other computer work she uses the home computer, which is in heavy competition with my daughter using it very often.  Anyway, I've been using a Galaxy 3s phone for some time, and It appears to be the same high quality item, essentially working like a great big smart phone.

Super excited about my first tab, and it'll be just like my phone, which I freaking love. Yeah...Not so much. It's glichy and slow, and has done some really concerning things- like shut down and reboot and be at factory settings with none of my purchased apps! I rebooted it, and they were magically there. Just a weird thing. Also, none of the accessories I've bought for it fit. (and I made sure they were the right ones!) They're all to big and floppy, with holes in the wrong place. I love my galaxy phone, with all my heart. I just wish my tab was as fast and with it as my phone. It's the slow stupid version it seems. Poopy.

I have been viewing email, web articles, etc on my Samsung phone. I decided I wanted a bigger screen, so bought the tablet. I  looked at Kindles and IPads, but decided I wanted to stay with Samsung. The tablet feels very familiar after using the phone for some time (also have good luck with 3 Samsung TVs.). I got the WiFi version as I can use the Samsung phone as my WiFi hub to the web.. and I always have my phone. Works great. It uses our home wifi when I'm home and the phone when I'm out. Still learning to use various things, but recommend the tablet without reservation.

This tablet is great, I bought 2 of them, one for my girlfriend and the other one for me. They're great for web browsing and watching videos.
The tablet is not the fastest on the market but first I want to use it and test it before purchasing a bigger/faster one.

The only complain I have is that I bought 2 Items and neither of them arrived in it's original box but in a plastic-cardboard pseudo-box, the description said that everything was in like-new condition and all the manuals were included but for one tablet they were missing... One tablet had only minor cosmetic details on the back.

I bought it because I got tired of lugging around a heavy laptop on vacation. It is very small, lightweight and convenient. It doesn't have the computing power of a laptop, but the display is sharp and high quality. I don't have a smartphone, so it is my first experience with apps too. I find them problematic, for example flash is NOT supported by Android, so most videos won't play. That sucks, but it's not Samsung's fault. Overall I am very happy with the purchase.

I really love this ! It charges pretty quick and the battery lasts a long time...
I can watch movies great pix.. read books play games I also listen to books on the road !
and I am sure it does a ton more !  I haven't put my music on it yet.. I hardly ever use my ipod anymore since I got this ! The only thing it doesn't have is facetime which is a bummer but I can Skype ,,, anyway its great !

For the money, this is hands down one great device. It works smoothly and seamlessly. But it doesn't do all those wonderful things anyone owning an iPad or similar will have become used to. Games and apps are great, google play is getting there now, and this thing is sturdy and easy to handle. Can't do iTunes of course, and can't play Amazon movies either - which for me is a big disappointment. My kid loves it, also cause its compact and easy to carry around.

Samsung is making leaps and bounds above the others! I bought one of these for my wife after she was constantly complaining about how much she hated my smartphone! She quickly learned Android so she could play games and the like, and now SHE has a smart phone! Next, I bought another for my Grandson, He's ten and it's time he had his own computer, I warned him it's fragile and got him a case telling him, if you break it it's gone and won't be replaced! Another lesson for him that is working. He's keeping his grades up (straight A's) and he's taken good care of the machine he loves. I couldn't be happier!

I already had a Tab3, and love using it.  It's fast, has a very clear and bright hi-res display, and is priced right!  My kids wanted their own tablets for Christmas, and I cannot justify the iPad mini for kids, so these Tab 3 units fit the bill nicely.  I'm not too concerned about the 8GB onboard memory, because I can install 64GB microSD cards, and have more than is needed.

I'm really picky about devices like this, so giving 5 stars is a big deal, but I am really impressed with Samsung.  I also have a Samsung Galaxy S4 phone, and they are laid out identically.  That's a bonus!

This tablet lasted about three years until the battery just gave out on me. I mean, it's fairly good for it's price. Nothing really to complain about except that the battery completely died. Worth it, I think. I would buy it again, but I'm trying something a little more expensive to see how I like it. Worth the purchase, though, if you just need a tablet to read or watch netflix in bed!

Pros: The tablet works well, very clear, just the right size to carry around without adding too much weight. Its been 3 days but i love it
Cons: Amazon promises to "Pre-loaded with free content including Hulu Plus membership, Google Play credit and Boingo Wi-Fi Access" Not true! theyre actually referring to the Free memberships we already get, there is no added benefit. Notice they dont even mention how much the google play credit will be. It was all very sneaky of Amazon and I am very surprised and disappointed with them

I got this so I could put my textbooks on it and carry it to class. I wanted something lighter than my laptop. It has been working pretty well. I have a problem  with one textbook it is very sluggish, but it is a very large textbook and the other 3 do not have that problem. I used Google drive to put them there. I liked that all the apps from my phone went onto the Tab. It has been pretty good. I'm still learning some things but so far I'm happy

This was a gift for my wife. I have a Galaxy 2, and she had a Nook, but wanted to be able to get Kindle Books.  She has been delighted with her Galaxy 3.  It is everything that she wanted and more.  I pointed out some apps that I thought that she would like to have, and she has been using the Galaxy even more than she thought she would.  This was one of the best gifts that I have given her in our many years of marriage.

I'm a Apple user that is being converted to Samsung.  Family got the phones so I decided to try out this tablet.  I really like it and will be adding a galaxy phone to go with it soon.
Pros:  Bigger; nuff said.  Really like the homescreens and especially the "widgets" that have active content on them,  unlike just the icons only like Apple does.  Plus the Google Play store (read: Apple App store) gives away free stuff!

Cons: Well, it could be bigger.  The screen seems to attract lint and junk. Wish I could change the volume on the screen instead of having to do it with the buttons on the side.

I love the galaxy s4 and galaxy tab 10.1.  So I thought the 7.0 tab would work well for my 9 year old daughter.  This tab was a disappointment.  Problems included random crashes, sluggishness,  and the datetime would reset everytime the device was restarted.  Loading web pages was very slow... so were games.

I was planning on returning to amazon, but decided to do a little troubleshooting first, which included: factory reset, clearing the device cache, turning off extra features like the lock screen, power saving (which limited CPU), auto updates, and widgets.

I also discovered a flaw in the plastic around the on/off switch.  It was sticking "on" sometimes, causing the device to randomly reboot.

It's working better now.  As for quality, it's ok now but not in the same league as the other galaxy devices.  I'd say a better price should be $125.  I wouldn't recommend if you pay more than that.  Spend a little extra and get a better tab.  I wish we had gotten a nexus or another galaxy tab 3 10.1, given that I had to spend at least 4 hours troubleshooting the device.

So I got 2 of these (8gb model) for my kids for christmas this year.  By the day after Christmas one of them was already completely out of internal memory after downloading less than 20 apps / games.  That is because over 4gb is used for the OS and other bloatware that cant be removed.  So that leaves less than 4 gb left for apps, photos, videos, etc which goes pretty fast.  My sone had 1 game that was taking up over 1Gb. Now, I thought the external SD card would solve our issue so I went out and got a 16gb card.  That's when I found out Samsung disables the option to install / move apps onto the external SD card. It's only for photos and video which doesn't help the apps problem. So 2 days after turning it on for the first time, we're already into deleting apps to make space mode. Given the price, there are other tablets that offer a better value in my opinion.

Overall a decent tablet otherwise. I would rate higher if Samsung would remove the restriction on putting apps on the SD card.  Other vendors android based tablets allow this.

I have owned and used many Samsung products and have been happy with all of them in the past.  I wanted an affordable and reliable android tablet for around the house to replace an Original Kindle Fire,  so I purchased the Galaxy Tab 3.

After I received the Galaxy Tab 3 and started using it,  I noticed how sluggish the interface was in comparison to other devices that I have used such as the Kindle Fire HD and the iPad Mini.  It also did not feel as "solid" as some other the other devices I was used to.  Under normal use such as web browsing or streaming movies, it got hot to the touch.  I also had to frequently reboot the unit to keep it responsive.

Unfortunately, After about a month after purchase, the unit locked up and shut down to a black screen.  It would not come back on after that.  I have had to send it back for warranty repair and am anxiously awaiting the results of the repair.

Other Samsung tablets may be better and may be worth the money.  However, I can not recommend this unit.
review_topics: unit locked up and shut down to a black screen

reviews.review_body: The tablet is awesome! Fast and very nice resolution screen! I used it mainly for movies and games like clash of clans! But after a year the tablet turned off by its self! I search this issue and apparently this model has the battery poorly atached they say it can be easily fix placing an electric black tape over the battery.... But I'm scare of opening it so thats what I dint use it anymore... But for the price I recommend it!!!
review_topics: battery issueinput: I had used my old laptop to it death and so it was time to upgrade. My old laptop had been an Asus laptop and I was very happy with it. I had also had an Asus desktop computer for years that I had also loved. I was pleased to see that the price of a decent Asus laptop had stayed within a reasonable range. This Asus laptop has the features and the amount of memory that I was looking for. The color looks even better in person than it did on line and the finish on the actual product looks very durable (my old Asus laptop still looks great even though it has been well used for almost 4 years). This laptop is very fast which is one of the things that I wanted. Another thing that I really wanted was a backlit keyboard. This laptop features that keyboard and I am really happy about that. This laptop features windows 8.1 which had been a concern of mine. I had 8.0 on my desktop and did not like it at all. I am pleased to say that I very much like 8.1. I am looking forward to getting many years of use from this laptop.output: Asus laptop

reviews.review_body: Since I couldn't convince him to get himself a new computer or laptop, I gave this to my husband for Christmas and he loves it. We have Samsung phones so that made it easier for him to navigate. Wanted something for him to be able to play his videos and listen to his music and this is perfect. It's also easier for him to read with the bigger screen. This was not intended for work purposes, strictly entertainment, so it does everything he needs it to do. It came in a couple of weeks before Christmas so I was able to play around on it myself and familiarize myself before giving it to him on Christmas day. Great gift. Now I'll have to think about getting one for myself.

Bought it for my son's birthday and he is in love with it. One of the features that he liked the most is the ability to video chat with me whenever he has WIFI access. 'Google Hang out', allows him to talk to anyone who has the 'Google hang out' app on their smart phone. All that is required is a Gmail account. It also had a neat app called Watch-On, this app acts as a remote control and can change channels, change the volume, power the TV and set top box on/off. Very cool app, very cool tablet, would purchase another one.

I have Nook, Kindle, and iPad, too, and find the Samsung to compare favorably except for its small size.  Unfortunately, it does not do what I bought it for which was to mirror to my Samsung TV and to act as a touch remote.  It will send saved video and photos to the tv but it will not mirror live streaming data or web browsing.  If you want to do.that buy the 8" tablet.  Apps download easily and I have not yet found any that are incompatible.  Don't worry about color choices if you are going to use a cover.

well the tablet went dead just over a year , I bought it for my son who was never on it for any length of time just to play games. it looked new when we got it , and worked fine. then after a few month it would freeze up and make a noise. I own a galaxy tab 4 and never had issue with Samsung devices. it was never dropped so I am not sure what happen . I think I should  have had more years from this . I am now left to get a new one and so dissapointed

The reason I gave it 4 stars because it didn't send what it advertised, it says gold/brown, it is black and silver, so if you say it is something it should be that,  but it works and I am happy with it. if you play on it a long time use power saver for the brightness because it will heat up on you.  but it does what I need it to do, music games and video. I watch my mp4's or Netflix and HULU just fine. graphics looks good..

I purchased this tablet as a gift for my sister's boyfriend who lives in New Zealand, so naturally global shipping was the key driver in my purchasing decision.  He says he loves the tablet, but that he wishes it wasn't just for wifi (my mistake).  It seemed like a really good price for what it had to offer, and I liked that it has the ability to add more memory storage later if he needs it.  Overall, the tablet makes it easier for us to Skype and stay in touch, which was the ultimate goal.

Works pretty good.  Wife is not a tablet person but she likes it.  Kids love it.  I have had the Tab 2 for a while and find it faster than the newer Tab 3.  Tab 3 lags behind inputs and is a little glitchy.  Games are a little jerky, lessor quality video card or something I guess.  Tab 2 has upgraded Android 4.2.2 but Tab 3 is stuck at 4.1.2.  Don't know if an update will come any time soon.  I have rooted the Tab 3 to get rid of the bloatware... so far so good I guess.

Pros:
* Great price on sale
* Nice look & feel
* Works well for our simple needs
* Android

Cons:
* A little underpowered, definitely feel some lag.
* Battery life. But that's expected, nothing unusual.
* Front camera is underwhelming, especially since Skype was one of the main reasons for buying this.
* Registration took several tries, was a bit annoying.

Definitely the best value at this price range. But if we were to do it all over again, might have spent a few $ more on a Nexus 7. But this was bought as a gift and the recipient is very happy with it.

I've just had mine for a couple of days, but so far, so good.  I did find a User's manual online, and that's much easier to read than the one that came in the box. I don't think anyone has mentioned that before.  I have a big tablet, and use it mainly for reading and playing games, but it is a little heavy for my purse, so now I am brushing up on things I just never bothered to learn because I was using the first for different things.  I am having a little trouble getting Prime to recognize that I have two, but I probably missed something in the directions..  One comment.  I didn't think I wanted white, but was confused by the color gold-brown.  I still am confused.  To me it looks black.

I ordered 3 of these tablets for my family and so far they've been great.
Games, social apps, streaming services all perform above average. I almost went for an off brand tablet but then I realized that this was not that much more expensive for what I needed them for. My kids love them and stay glued to them for hours(after homework of course).
I know they come out with a new model every year or so but in the mean time this will do then I'll probably upgrade to the new models when the time comes. Samsung and Android have made wonderful technology and I can't wait to see what's next.

I bought this for my 9 year old. This is the second child we have bought one of these for. We have had no problems with it's functionality. They use it for mostly playing games, some internet searching and picture/video taking. We have had a problem using the additional sd storage.We used up all the internal memory and can't get the sd card to store anything. According to an internet search, you need to root the tablet. Not being much of a computer savy person, we haven't figured out how to do that, so we just delete things as we want to use more space. Overall satisfied, except for the storage issue

I bought this as a Christmas gift for my niece and as such I am unable to personally attest to the functionality of this tablet or how it compares to others.  All I can say is that 2 weeks after Christmas my niece is still thrilled with this gift and thanks me profusely for it every time I see her.  I didn't know at the time when I purchased it that she is a fan of Samsung and already has a Galaxy phone, so I got really lucky there.  She is a bit more tech savvy than I am, so based on her pleasure and enjoyment of this product I would recommend it.

So I've had this tablet for a few days noe to play around with it and I must say I  pretty im pressed with  it so far. I did get it for a few different reasons like school and entertainment. Haven't done the school thing yet but  I have checked out some movies and I almost freaked out because the first movie I chose was from '92 and it was very poor quality but I chose a different movie from that same era and it was digitally remastered and it was much better. I tried a few more and Im satisfied with this tablet. It can be a bit sluggish at times but Im diggin it.

Este dispositivo llego a tiempo y en las condiciones que ofreció Amazon, el color y la nitidez de la pantalla son increibles, muchas aplicaciones para todos los gustos y sobre todo la aplicacion de hablar directamente al equipo lo hace genial. Lo unico que extrañé es que no tiene SIM card, con eso seria completo, por eso no le doy un 5.

This device arrived on time and under the conditions offered Amazon, color and sharpness of the display are incredible, many applications for every taste and especially the application to talk directly to the equipment makes it great. The only thing I missed is that no has SIM card, with that would be complete, for this I not give it a 5.

It's a great tablet. The perfect size; you can easily hold it in one had which is ideal for reading. The screen has great resolution and the battery seems to last forever. The reason it has a four star rating is because, like everything else, it has its faults. I doesn't have S Beam, so I couldn't transfer files from my S3, but that was an easy fix, I just sent them using Bluetooth. It still doesn't make sense that it doesn't have it though. Another thing I didn't like is that even though all my apps are set to be updated manually it updates them automatically, which can be kind of annoying. Other than that it's an awesome tablet that I highly recommend. :)

Bought two of these refurbished, huge mistake. Lasted only a few months, like 3 or 4, before the charging ports failed within days of each other. It wouldn't charge or power on at all. After taking it too shop to get fixed, I discovered that certain versions of these tablets have a charging port that cannot be replaced. Waste of money and I had to buy new tablets, but I did purchase a 2 yr warranty this time! The tablets are great so the tablet itself is a 4 star product, but I wouldn't buy any refurbished from Amazon sellers!!!! I bought two different models from two different sellers and they both suffered the same problem about a week or two apart.

Ok. I'm a first time tablet owner. I must say that so far my experience has been great with this tablet! Understanding that because of the low price you'll not get the "best" features but beside that everything is workable. The back camera is not good but I didn't buy the tablet for the camera (i own a digital camera). Front facing camera gets the job done well. Battery life is excellent (can go 24 hrs + without charging.... depending on usage). I will have to expand the memory however. I'm able to stream my movies and use other flash content after downloading the adobe flash player. No glitches experienced as yet. I've purchased one for myself and 2 for my sister and father. Will update after another month or so of usage.

I bought this a year ago and tried to like it.  The tablet itself works like it is suppose to.  I just am not used to android so it was not for me.  I gave it to my daughter who has an android phone and she loves it.  I think it is probably one of the better quality low cost tablets and if you are not already used to the I-pads and phones then I am sure it would be fine.  A couple things worth mentioning are I thought the battery run time was kind of short, and it is finicky about wanting its oem charger.  The screen quality is great and it is nice that it has the micro sd card slot.

Arrived in a timely manner and was packaged well, the only comment is that the tape on the box that states if this is unsealed return the product. I didn't and everything is fine but makes me wonder why it was. This was a gift for my son who is 10 so I didn't want to spend top dollar in case of accidents and such. He uses it everyday and is loving the fact that he can watch Netflixs on it. I am not a techie so I can't get into all that, but I have noticed that while playing games on it it's a little slow to respond to play. He doesn't utilize all the tablet is able to do but it does everything he wanted one for. Good item for the money and a good starter tablet for a young user.

Ok so 8gb isn't enough for me, after awhile the lack of space slows the hardware down (as with most things)

I brought this for myself as a belated birthday present
The operating system is great runs smooth and vividly.
My favorite feature is the S Voice (It's samsung's version of Siri), just wish there was an option to make it masculine.

It charges fast which I really like and it lasts long. Normally I would unplug it around 11am and won't plug it back in until 4-6am , with extensive use.

Skype does run the battery down a bit.
So far the power saver feature causes freezing with facebook messenger and skype.

It's great for spanish lessons and bookclub reading

Just brought my mum one for my birthday yesterday this way she could watch her favorite shows on the go.
No real problems, other than memory but that is a simple fix. Microsd cards go on sale around back to school deals.

Try it out and see for yourself, it's a great tab for a great price.

p.s. you can control the font size so there's no true "size" problem.

UPDATE:  I've now used the tablet and it's pretty good - rating upgraded.  It seems to work fine for everything I've used it for.  The problem noted below (Linux/USB Mass storage) turns out to be Android 4.x related, not just Samsung.  Newer Linuxes have MTP drivers that make it useable, at least in Nautilus.  Based on all this, rating upgraded.

OLDER:
I have not used the tablet yet.  But I found this out when I went to copy files:  LINUX Users beware - you cannot connect this to your Linux machine and transfer files!  The phone has Windows-only drivers on it, so you can (usually) connect it to Windows and transfer files.  Extra software is required on a Mac.  Stock Android does USB mass storage by default in my experience.  I am seriously disappointed, though I will probably end up keeping it, as I have promised it to someone for Christmas and I don't have time to do a swap.

I had ordered this because I had thought my Galaxy Tab 2 had died. It has since come back to life but that is cool cus now I have 2 tablets. I would give the Tab 3 a 5 star rating except for one annoying thing. Quite often when I am online on this tablet all of a sudden I won't be able to bring a site up, it says unavailable check your network connection and I look and it says I am connected. I have to shut the wifi off and then put it back on again so it will recognize that it is connected and then I can continue what I was doing. I can't understand why it does this but it is not that big of a deal overall it is a great tablet the same as the Tab 2 was. Actually the Tab 2 would do that internet connection thing once in a while too but not as often as the Tab 3. Overall I am very happy with this tablet.

I ordered this tablet the 5th of July and got it the 7th as promised (it was a Prime product). I however ordered the tablet in the gold-brown colour, but received it in the midnight black colour; I couldn't be bothered to return it. The features have been cool and have been as described thus far, however, I did note that when this tablet was compared amongst its larger versions (the 8.0 and the 10.1), the box that lists that it has the multi-window feature, was left blank. I'm not sure if that's true for every 7.0 model, but the one I received does indeed have the multi-window feature. Both cameras take pretty decent pictures. Only one little weird design with the tablet: the volume buttons do not operate in the manner you'd expect them to; to turn the volume up, you'll have to press the conventional 'down' side of the button and vice versa.
Overall, I'm pleased with the tablet and will be posting pictures if I can.

This tablet, I have used and tested thoroughly and found that it does have overall advantages. So as a techie, I tested this tablet out and below I will list what I have found to be the Pros and Cons of this tablet. *Also, I own the Tab 3 7.0 3G (T211)UNLOCKED PHONE/TABLET COMBO (in white and I purchased it recently on Amazon and it is just 96 dollars more than this WiFi only one). The 3G model is a real phone and has a Micro Sim card slot in it. For just about 90 dollars more, I got the phone part and the 3g data abilities in the Tab 3 with 3g (which is very much worth the added cost). The P211 I also purchased on Amazon and now I carry it everyday as a phone and mini tablet combo. So if you need a phone and tablet in one unit consider the Tab 3 7.0 3g as it is just one unit to carry for phone and tablet! Both my Tab 3 versions are peppy and run great!

Tablet tethers to my cell, and it is rocket fast on the web.  Overall?  For under 200 bucks delivered  to my door not bad!!  2 weeks into use...HUGE  problem...the headphone jack went silent...started making a clicking sound only...now no sound!!  A common problem with the product based on my research.  You can go to wireless headphones...but me personally...I like hard wire so...I guess more EMF for my brain.?

Positives:  No lag in key strokes, price is good... I like Samsung personally, graphics are clean, have'nt experienced pixilated screen with streaming video, size is perfect, SD card slot, more freedom than Apple products.  Again, you get your money's worth with Samsung.

Negatives:  I believe a common manufacturing error has occurred with the headphone jack, as it started right out of the box and progressed to clicking alternating with working fine to now no audio at all from headphone jack.  Camera is not up to par with most Samsung cell phones from the same generation.

I  will stay with the Samsung tablet due to freedom of controlling data etc...hopefully the next gen tab has a better camera megapixel like the S4...AND the headphone jack manufacture improves.

This tablet is good. Almost perfect size. Good size screen but still can fit in some large pockets. The stock memory of 8gb can be filled quick because some games can be 1gb in size. But the memory can be expanded easily and not for too much. Performance is good. I am still surprised by the graphics of some games. I just wish I could get or find a gimp or photoshop like app to do graphic designs on the go without having to root or basically hack the tablet. The wifi range is good if you are within your home or the same building as the router but it can get weak when  you are outside. I am looking for a way to boost its signal by maybe using an usb wifi adapter for rasberrry pi like boards and use a usb to micro usb adapter to connect it to the tablet. Should work since rasberry pi uses android and linux like this can but this tablet has to be hacked to root it so you can install linux while it comes with android out of box. I would recommend and buy this tablet again. Battery is about 12 hours with wifi off but with wifi on it can be drained in about 6 hours if you surf the net alot and can be drained even quicker if playing a game with 3d graphics while wifi is on. But with all the usb power adapters on the market I doubt that will be much of a problem for most people. I have two wall power adapters and one car adapter while only spending about 40 us dollars so i can not complain too much about having enough power for my needs.

Received the tablet just the other day and being my first tablet, it took a slight amount of  break in time.
The size is just right for me and I am glad I did not buy anything larger as easy and light portability was part of my buying decision.  The color quality far exceeded my expectations.  Played a newscast from NBC and it was almost as good as watching my HD TV. It is a fast device with a logical interface that provides smooth connections to the internet.

I am impressed by how fast the start up and power off works..........literally a few seconds to connect or disconnect.  The keyboard is user friendly and if you purchase the optional 64gb micro sd card, you should plenty of storage space for smaller sized photos.  Apps are also downloaded with above average speed and work very well.

On the downside:

Strength of Wi-Fi signal is reduced sometimes but not really a big issue as it usually shows full waves but when it falters I lose only one of them........still a reliable connection, although my laptop and notebook are 100% in the same area which is about three rooms away from the router.  When the tab is in the same room (or next room) as router it performs 100%.

I know I can buy the screen protector (and I will), but fingerprints get piled up on the glossy screen quite fast.  So for now I wipe the screen with a good cleaning cloth designed for computer screens.

Lastly, I would rate the battery life as underperforming..........2-3 hours if high power is used.  Of course, you can adjust power in settings to save battery power.

Other than these minor shortcomings, I feel that you are getting an excellent valued product for $199.  Don't think you will be disappointed at all.
review_topics: apps are downloaded with above average speed

reviews.review_body:
First of all, this is a decent tab.  I like it for what I use it for.  Value wise, it is a 'great success.'  I use it as my car navigation/radio device.  First thing I did was root it (XDA developers is AWESOME).  I left the stock rom on there, but needed root access for the Tasker app to be able to do all the things I wanted it to do.  I use an Akron dash holder to keep it mounted in my car.  When I power on the car, it boots Pandora, Waze, and other apps I want open while driving.  This thing spends 98% of it's time on my dash.  It does all these tasks admirably.  I have no idea how well it will do in the Utah summer heat though.  This is the WiFi model, I use WiFi hotspot from my phone for data while driving.

Pros:
- Bright screen with decent resolution
- Battery life is quite long (even though it is always plugged in while driving)
- It's Android rooted, so you can do whatever you want if you know what you are doing
- Audio is sufficiently loud (I normally have the headphones plugged in to my aux while driving but sound is good)

Cons:
- Doesn't do great in the cold, even though I can't expect that; if it's cold, prepare for cold warnings and no charging, sluggish LCD refresh.
- Menu/Back buttons don't light up on this 7" model, sucks when night driving while trying to use it
- Camera might as well not even be there, it has terrible resolution and horrible color.  Don't plan on using it for any reason.

Overall, for a dash rider, it rocks.  Using Waze, Torque app for car data, Pandora or whatever music app you like, and Tasker seals the whole deal.  This app has a medium learning curve, but once you master it, you can make you phone do just about whatever you can imagine automatically.  8/10 would buy again.  Good for kids too at home with the WiFi.  If it breaks, oh well.  Not $500 bucks down the drain like an Ipad if it gets broken.  This thing has 200% more VALUE dollar for dollar over the Ipad.

Cant beat the price at $150. I bought this for my 8 year old son, instead of getting him a pricier and smaller iPod for xmas. I also bought a 64 gig card with it, so I can load it up with movies and games for him. (I have a program that downscales DVD's for mobile devices on my PC, so all the movies are free for us). I'll put some music on there for him also, all from my own collection. All sorts of free games he loves off of the Android Google Play marketplace. Plus, I can get him all sorts of childrens books that he'll have more fun reading on here than an actual real book. And lots of interactive books, which he loves. I totally recommend this tablet for kids. Just buy a decent case for it, and a screen protector, or take it to one of those cell phone accessory stores and have them put a screen protector on it.

I did a lot of research before choosing to buy a tablet to use as an e-reader, and chose this one because of its size, price, and the fact I've always been very happy with Samsung products. The expandable memory allows a MicroSD card to expand the memory from the default 8GB for significantly less than it would cost to buy an e-reader or tablet with those same internal specs. The height and width dimensions are roughly the same as a mass-market paperback and are perfect for carrying it around on a daily basis and fitting in my purse.

The Android OS lets me install all the apps I need for what I read. Along with several news and magazine apps, I use reading apps for Kindle, Nook, Aldiko, and Kobo, and I'm confident I'll be able to find whatever else I'll need in the future to consolidate all my e-books in one place. Each app operates independently, so I can download reading material directly from the internet to the app or device or update my libraries with what I purchase using a computer or other device. The Dropbox app makes a good middleman for getting free books from Project Gutenberg or documents from other sources to Aldiko.

The way the tablet is set up physically makes it perfect for e-reading. There is a button on the lower left which gives different options based on the app being used, and the back button on the lower right toggles you back from the book to the library. To use the Kindle and Nook apps as examples, once the apps are up and running, you would not know you were on an Android tablet and not on a dedicated Kindle or Nook device.

Of course, there are other perks to having a tablet, including being able to hook up to free wifi for internet browsing and email, games, Google maps, music, weather, other cool Android apps (which are very similar, if not identical, to iOS apps), widgets, and the front/back camera. The screen has the option for automatic brightness adjustment, so you're not always fiddling in the settings to make it comfortable to see.

I bought this for my daughter. It stopped working 6 weeks after delivery. Too late to return it. I will seek support from Samsung on how to fix the problems.

Update 3/2/14 I followed the directions on the Samsung site of things to try and get it working again. One was to plug it in for one hour and then hold the on button down for 5 seconds. It booted up and works great. My daughter had already tried this a couple of times and it did not work for her. For now, the problem is resolved and I am sending it back to her. I am changing from one star to three (not 5 as it did stop working).

I've had this tablet for about 2 weeks now... and its like my sidekick.you know how we didnt have cell phones years ago now you have to turn around and go back home to get it cause you just have to have it.this tablet is with me like the pacifier is with a baby. whenever im ready to go I slip it in my purse grab the power cord and im off.love the wifi. so many businesses have free wifi from the eateries I frequent to my grocery store or the car repair spot. I go to town on this thing.i can read pdf excel powerpoint presentations you have a world of apps.i dont know where this thing can go wrong. Im very careful about what I download if I dont use it its deleted.i havent saved much just still seeing how much it can manage.i did say before I started saving pictures & books I would get a micro sd card. the storage is expandable to I believe 64 gb.i can say so far the camera quality is a little ify.it may be one of those where you need bright light and a close up. Will test that more. Using the internet is just as good as the portability. and just when you think it may stall (not that its slow at all just low expectations) you see the blue processing line going across the top of the screen like lightning. So far im very much enjoying the tablet.along with this purchase I bought the tech armor anti glare & anti fingerprint screen protector (love it). I recall the reviews being ify but it was a snap for me its a 3 pk comes with a smoother & wiping cloth. I also purchased a silicone skin cover to protect from scratches. I think i will get a case. Its another level of protection it was a life saver for my last tablet. I liked to open in close like a book. One thing I wanted to mention if your looking at your screen and it looks too dark dont worry it auto adjust to your lighting. If the room has low lighting the screen will automatically dim. turn the lighting brighter then the screen gets brighter.  Oh another thing that drove me nuts was wanting to organize or remove apps or delete one of the 3 home screens. To move the apps around hold drag and drop. if you want on another screen hold and drag to either side you'll see a blue line as if turning the page. It'll go to the next screen. To delete apps hold drag and drop to the trash bin. To adjust the home screens while viewing the home screen drag your fingers across screen as if pinching the screen. the screens will minimize and you can drag and drop to the trash bin

First the good, people put down the screen resolution being low, but samsung screens are one of the best , there 1024 by 600 resoution is so much better than other screen with same resolution . Side by side with my kindle fire hd i can barely notice much difference. The tab is not extreme fast but it is not slow either, if you install  a task killer or ram manger , you can keep the ram clear and it will improve your browsing experience. People say it take 3 secs more to open apps, really 3 secs if you cant wait an extra 3 secs, its time to slow down your life.
  I test the wifi and it works great the bars are not correct , when iam outside i get one bar but the tab work perfectly still loading pages and loading u-tube, test it yourself u will find even with 1 bar showing the connection is great.This is a perfect tab for movies and emails, the size is quite small and light fits almost perfectly in my pants pocket.
  Since the price drop you can find these as low as 149.00 , which is a great price for the tab. The tv remote is great for using the tab to control tv.
  Most people make fun or hate samsung touch wiz, but i love it , it has lots of useful features and mekes it easy to use the tablet, i have own the nexus 7 2013 and yes it is faster and smoother, but i like the samsung so much better, with the nexus you have to be very gental as it is very thin I was always afraid the screen would crack.
  Like i said if you install a ram manager or task killer and keep the memory clear , you will find the tab work fine, as long as your not expecting it to be blazing fast....
  Really the only real bad is the 8 gigs of strorage which is about 4.5 gigs useable .....

My husband complaint that he did not have a tablet... My kids have one each and I Have 2 (well, for anyone in the house to use).  But my husband wanted his own!  So, what a perfect gift for his birthday!  I have always liked Samsung products, and this one was just as I expected.  I added a memory card and loaded some movies and music; downloaded some games apps and others he may be interested and he is loving it.
The tablet is fast (in my opinion) and the screen is nice and clear.  The camera works well (even though he does not use it much). Mainly at this point he uses it for movies and music, browse web, play a few games and skype.  A very good buy and simple enough for the beginner user.

I'm not one to go to the top when rating anything, especially when I haven't had it long. But I like it better than a mere 4 stars. I'm still figuring out all the quirks. I wanted a tablet that I could carry when commuting by bike. WiFi only is fine; I have access to networks in most of the places I would want to use it. It saves paying for a data plan.

This little gadget is fast. The 7-inch screen seems quite generous, considering I would have settled for something even smaller. Now that I have it I'm glad I didn't. This one is the ideal size to fit the rack bags on either of the bikes I regularly use to commute. No complaints so far. I'll probably get a Bluetooth keyboard because it it hard to type on the virtual keyboard that comes up on screen. It's still surprisingly effective even with my fat fingers. I wouldn't want to blog a novel on it, but it will do for quick posts, email check-ins and spur of the moment searches.

I was looking at quite a few 10.1" Android Tablets under the $250 mark but left a 7-8" option open if I found a decent one . I couldn't pass up $149.00 shipped , using Prime . I have a Samsung Centura phone so I was easily familiar with the operating system and functions . Out of the box this tablet is awesome and does the things I want it to do . It's lightweight , battery life is pretty damn good around the 8/hr. mark depending on applications running and usage . It charges quickly like most Samsung products and comes with a nice Samsung-branded charger .

The only thing I wish it had , is the Multi-Window feature found in the Samsung Tab3 8" and possibly the 5MP rear Camera of the 8" , since this one is only 3MP . I think a fair competitor would be the ASUS Google Nexus 7" which has a NVIDIA Tegra 3 quad-core processor and is priced in the same range . I am very happy and would definitely recommend this Tablet to first-time users and those wanting something smaller but very capable .

I couldn't even fully charge without the adapter getting dangerously over heated. The good parts about this computer aren't enough to overcome these flaws and are pretty much standard.
