reviews.review_body: Worked great for fist two weeks, then it wouldn't boot up.

Randomly locks up -- unresponsive, screen goes blank. Happens infrequently, but when it does my work since the last Save is lost and unrecoverable. Others report similar experience with Windows 11. I've downloaded and installed the latest Windows 11 update. Thought that would fix the problem but it bit me again. This is not something that can be very well demonstrated because it can go days without locking up. I don't have the time or the inclination to try all of the various remedies suggested online. (I did a memory scan, which did not cure the problem.) So I'm going to put it on the shelf and use an old machine. Maybe after a few months I'll download the latest updates and try it again. This is really insidious because it can go a long time before locking up and then the likelihood of losing a lot of work is greater. Probably it would be best to throw it in the trash and buy a Windows 10 machine while they're still available.

I picked this up to replace an older XPS-13 and even though this Inspiron 13 is a lower tier model it is noticeably more compact and higher performing in nearly every metric.Wifi, Startup, and Browser speeds are atleast twice as fast as my old XPS.Some small gripes are that it is not made of aluminum, has only 1 USB-A port, has no touch screen, and the hinge design does not allow much tilt angle.Overall at under $600 I am pretty happy with it and dont think I could bring myself to pay over $1000 for the XPS if I could do it again when this model packs so much more value per dollar.
I like the 16:10 screen for everyday use and for CAD program that I use with woodworking hobby.
Great computer for the price. Well built and great specs

reviews.review_body:
I was hoping to capitalize on the CPU power for simple ethernet work.  Problem is that I have not been able to get this computer to work for longer than 40 minutes before getting a BSOD.  Have tried updating the OS and resetting the OS..  still the same problems.  And never the same error codes either.
In addition, when I try to update the computer to the latest OS feature, it crashes during install every single time.  Needless to say I haven't been able to use this computers potential at all.

Split it into 3, with the main drive C being just 150 gb. I didn't even realize that until I quickly ran out of room from uploading videos, forcing me to move videos to the partitioned drive to clear space. By then I would have had to reformat the hd to get the full benefit. Had one other issue. It died after a few weeks. Fortunately the tech support helped me and told me how to fix it. I had to tear it apart and remove the tiny battery type object and it worked again, and is still working 2 years later. Good little computer, but make sure they don't partition.
review_topics: partitioned driveinput: This is the second of these laptops I have owned. They are good value for the money. The first one I had for four years and the only problem I had was the rubber feet kept popping off. I replaced it once

and then the other one popped off when I tried to put the laptop on something. Battery lifetime was good untill the last few months before I replaced it. I wish the power cord could be coiled. It is the type that has the power block in the middle. Keyboards are no longer made that allow you to turn the back light on/off -- supposed to conserve energy and it does but it is still annoying. No power switch on the laptop. Not too fond of that either. Keys are good size and easy to use. Slight difference in feel on this one than the first one I had. Not quite as smooth as the first one

but after four years of use maybe that one is worn in. Speakers are okay. Nothing great or bad. The screen is a slight improvement over the first one I had. I have owned four 15.6 inch laptops and not one had an excellent screen. They all have odd hues or different color temperatures between the center
and corners. Maybe that is normal
but I do not think so. All had okay to good brightness. I had to return two of them; one for a black spot on the screen
the other because the output connector was not soldered to the motherboard. My screen has light bleed around all four edges
but it does not bother me. Overall a good laptop for me that will serve for three to four years. Then I will probably buy another.output: laptop

reviews.review_body: We need another one, it is good for our job

reviews.review_body: The computer never worked, SJ COMPUTERS LLC made me pay for the return to their shop to fix it, and they returned it not working again, it doesn't even turn on. Very bad customer service and bad product. Don't buy!

My first review was block for "not following guidelines".  To detailed I guess, So let me just say, it is not as advertised, wrong hard drive, wrong placement of OS, no hdmi, no wifi and bad packaging.

This has been an absolute nightmare to own.

It constantly freezes. I've reinstalled windows so many damn times.

You get what you pay for! I'm never buying HP anything ever again!!!!
Absolutely quiet. Super fast.

very sound computer :))))
way faster than my 2013 iMac :0
most people don't recomend buying a used P C but I thought I would try, 4 months  and won't reboot,  only guaranteed 90 days
Excellent product. Quiet and fast.

The PC case is scratched up, did not include a  WiFi Adapter or HDMI Adapter as promised, there is no COA sticker anywhere on the PC, and the included 2TB drive makes a loud grinding noise and has a manufacture date from 2010! I will be returning this PC.
Great performance, exactly as described
En perfecto estado, con los accesorios descritos en la compra, y funcionando perfectamente
Couldn't ask for a more capable machine for this price, and compactnesss.
after a month of using this no problems works great
I use mine for running vms on my homelab
Very clean and ready to go.  No trouble setting it up. Quick Delivery and good pricing!
This is a solid computer, a great bargain. Seller replies to my question very quickly with satisfactory answer. Highly recommended.
Just so so.
didn't use tech support. Thickness is fine. Works as designed.
Great PC. No issues whatsoever.  Thanks to the ssd and 16gb of ram it is very fast and quiet. An outstanding value imho.
came well packed and looks new. Features were as stated - working well currently - would buy again from seller
exactly as advertised and the one I got showed almost no wear on the case
Received my shipment and they did not include the hdmi adapter.
It’s one of the better desktop unit so I have purchased seems to be pretty fast and I’ve had no issues
The product received met the stated description. The shipping seemed to take a long time but we received the item without damage.
Computer was great until hard drive failed on day 4.
Using this as a host for different VM environments. Installed virtual Machined for training on Microsoft & Cisco.
Don’t forget to insert the wifi key and run the drive before trying to connect web as I did. Most satisfied with the tower and the deal. Best buy!
Clean inside and out. Fresh OS install on SSD. Wifi dongle and displayport -> HDMI adapter.  I connected my 4K TV with no problems.
CS adjusted the order and made it correct and followed up with communication. The unit works excellent and I would recommend  it to all.
Very happy with this new computer which enabled me to have Windows 10.  Great - and speedy!
From my son's point of view,100% value.  I wish it was fully programed with Microsoft word, office and publishsure.

Item shipped with an 8 year old hard drive (older than the manufacture date of the computer (2014 computer with 2010 hard drive). Hard drive makes grinding noise when idle.  No DVD drive installed - not as described.

No DP/HDMI cable included as others have indicated. Depends on the seller.
Computer is exactly as described.  The SSD is blazing fast and keeps up with whatever I throw at it.  Customer service was fantastic to deal with.  Highly recommended.

We have purchased several of this PCs from other vendors but MicroBee does not know what they are doing.  It says warranty for 1 year and number they provided (888) 305-3402 has been disconnected.  The operation system was installed, installed on the secondary drive (2TB drive) and the SSD drive was not even configured and the video ports were misaligned (mother board needed adjusting) terrible QAqc.  Buyers beware!!!!

I have to order twice this item as the first one has arrived with broken parts and uncleaned. The second one arrived with misalignment of display ports at the back of the system. PC door quality is very cheap quality and also the power plug is very loose and it comes off frequently and shuts off the computer.

Bought it may 3rd, Set it up may 15th, drive died last night (June 10th).  Otherwise system has been doing well, fast for the things I use it for (web content, documents, audio editing).
Is quiet and according to coretemp it stays pretty cool even under load.

I have contacted the seller, will update the review when they respond.

No hdmi adapter as specified in the description.
This is a preliminary rate as I just opened and unpacked the product.  Will update in a few weeks.

Early update. It works fine. I removed all the junk programing it comes with and installed a few usable ones after it did all its updates. So I added a second star.
I needed a little more umph in my studio. This computer is great. Small size, big performance. Tech was excellent taking care of a small glitch.
This was very easy to set up, have had no problems that I've needed tech support on the computer.  Love that it doesn't have all those annoying apps that comes with new computers.
So far this PC has worked great for my home studio.  16GB ram easily handles multitrack recording with lots of VST's on each channel without lag or latency, which is exactly what I wanted!

Arrived quickly, not dirty inside, runs well. Thank you.The disk drive and wifi are external (usb) which turned out well because space is left inside for an additional SSD and video card. I like it (after two weeks.)

Seemed like a deal and I needed an i7 to run production in a small machine shop. This computer was also going to run some fiber laser programs but after opening and running the machine its be relegated to shipping. Claims to be i7, claims to have wifi built in, niether are true. Initial boot brought me right into windows with a preset user and programs already loaded... sketchy... After a thorough reformatting it seems to be okay speed-wise. Aesthetically there was some greasy looking spots on top (maybe paint) and some gross looking cat hair or fuzz stuck to the stickers residue that were removed. Buy from someone else...
Just the way discryb the inside everything is new the ouside no scratch tech support fix all your needs will always buy from SUNSET MICRO
Great performing system, like new really like it. Great value.
This is a great computer for the price. I had a couple minor issues when I received it, but Moe in tech support helped me right away.
Purchased this computer for our Church. Added a low profe video card, abd runs our Easy Worship perfectly.
review_topics: one review centered around the video card input: I replaced my 4 year old 15" Sony Vaio with this computer to replace my daily work and play computer. I mainly use my laptop for surfing the net
and playing games (not too graphically intensive games such as World of Warcraft
I needed a laptop with a great graphics card
lots of RAM and a great screen for watching movies. This computer has all of the above. Now
after having used the computer for about 2 weeks
I am very happy with this computer and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a laptop with similar needs. Pros: - Great screen! 1080p resolution results in very crisp and clear images

and the color rendering is very good. An excellent screen for watching movies. - RAM - 8GB of RAM results in a very responsive computer that can handle multiple programs running at the same time without a problem. I've got at least 5-6 programs running at the same time (Firefox with 10+ tabs
I don't know how well the computer will handle more intensive applications like video editing

etc. - Graphic Card - AMD Radeon HD 7670M graphics card runs my games very well at high resolution with no lag. I'm very happy with the graphics card and its performance. - Sound Quality - Output: Asus K42jr-a1

reviews.review_body: I don' dislike anything. It takes up less space and has more up to date features than my old tower. I am still learning more about it as I use it and I suppose I will eventually have to update it.

This is a great buy, it's fast and quiet, my unit had some sticker residue on it and my display port to HDMI adapter was a little faulty, the seller replaced it without question and the residue cleaned off with a little alcohol

Everybody else seems to have great things to say. I wish my experience was the same. I received a computer that doesn't boot up with some damage to the back. Since then I have received NO help. NO conversation. Nothing. You would think with such an expensive item them would be ready to make the situation right. This will be the last time I purchase something expensive over the internet. If I had bought this from WalMart or Best Buy they would have made it right by now.

UPDATE:
Still no response from the seller so I had to return the computer. Now let's wait a week for them to get it and return my money. What a waste. Amazon was of no help either. Seriously consider purchasing your PC from a physical store.

Machine arrived without wifi and hdmi adapters. Microbee sent adapters within 2 weeks . I am delighted with the machine now. It looks new and is now complete. Excellent machine for the money. Recommended.

Jerry

This desktop is a great buy, it's fast and quiet.  The Microbee Customer Service was very helpful with replacing the DVD player with a DVD-RW for me.  Will use order their products and services again in the future.
Computer is kind of slow but seems to be working as described.

We purchased 2 units for one of our clients and they love the computer.  Fast, reliable and just fun to use.  Internet run like a race car and never seems to want to stall.  With plenty of memory installed it makes multitasking a snap.

This is not a computer that you’re going to have for more that 5 months, I brought it less Than a year and it is not working, I contacted the manufacturer and they said that it is to old to fix it (10 years). Don’t waist your money

Had an issue with promised accessories mentioned in product description not being included with the PC. The description said PC came with wifi adaptor, Keyboard. Mouse, and HDMI adaptor. Only power cord was in bow with PC. Seller called me and made it right within minutes of posting my complaint.
I bought a new video card , and a SATA board to upgrade this.  I also put Windows 10 and Windows 98 on it.  It is very fast and a good value for the money.

Everything about ordering this was scary for me but I can assure you it was the easiest thing I’ve ever done in the computer works fast and flawlessly! Thank you so much- you guys have done a great job refurbishing this tower!

Great desktop, fast with plenty of memory and storage, 256GB SSD with 2TB hard drive is a nice combination. Refurbish was well done, very clean, well packaged  No problems with setup of Win10 license and loading of software, no need for tech support.

The computer is as described. It works great. It did have a few scuff marks on the plastic ad the case was repainted, but it is refurbished. I wanted an i7 to be able to use zoom virtual backgrounds.  and this worked wonderfully.

I've had computers for 20 years now (have a small on line business).  This computer really had everything I wanted except the most important thing - it needed to work.  It came on for 2 seconds, off for 2, on for two, etc. etc. etc.  I checked everything thoroughly and it just wouldn't even come on.  It was boxed up and back at the UPS store within the hour.  My refund just came through after having been a week since I returned it, so that was good.  I wish I dared take a chance again, but I don't.

Everything is good and functions perfectly. Only issue I faced is the HDMI port is not working as in I can't plug my cord into it. So I'm using VGA instead. I tried multiple times to try to fix it but it's not working probably from shipping.

I am happy that I purchased this HP Elite Desk computer.  At the beginning, there was a little difficulty setting up the disk drives, but Stallion Tek's tech support was friendly and helpful and walked me through the set-up in a seamless manner.  I would purchase this product again and recommend Stallion Tek for their friendly efficient service.
review_topics: tech supportinput: While looking for a cheap computer with a reasonably large hard drive to replace my Synology 4-bay NAS for data backup
and was shocked. Initially I wanted to get at least 500 GB
but these days to get a 500 GB laptop is an extreme luxury. I didn't really think I was going to get such a large amount of storage. Of course
I was interested in this 160 GB model immediately. I was able to get this for less than $220. Considering most smaller laptops go for at least $250

I thought this was a pretty good deal.

The only real thing I want to talk about is the absolutely terrible speakers. Do not buy this if you're planning on using it with the integrated speakers; they are downright awful. I don't see how anyone using cheap plastic enclosures for speakers thinks that's a good idea. Anyway
the keyboard is also awful. The keys are absolutely lousy. I don't know how it's even possible to type something
because it is so uncomfortable. The keys are sticky and smushy

and using the keyboard for more than a couple minutes would probably give you carpal tunnel.

Of course

it's not like I bought it for the speakers or the keyboard. I bought it because it had a huge hard drive. The hard drive works great. I have no complaints whatsoever with it. I put the laptop in an open area and managed to recover a lot of my files rather quickly. Then I partitioned the hard drive to make a new partition
but that's about it. I don't plan on using the keyboard much
but I am really happy with the large hard drive.output: 160 GB model

reviews.review_body:
Not as described. No HDMI as listed in the description. After two attempts the seller made it right and besides the inconvenience I am satisfied.
I would give 5 stars but in reading other comments this isn't the first time the HDMI adapter issue has come up and they really should verify contents before shipping.

My PC arrived in pristine condition looking as new with all advertised compliments in place.  Windows 10 was installed and I was able to quickly customize features to my liking.  The SSD drive is fast and the HDD easily addressed as additional storage.  Overall, I am quite pleased with this purchase.

Must have come straight off the storage shelf to me. Needed 16 critical updates immediately. The wireless mini that come with it is virtually useless, slow and not much range -- looked it up and its value is 14 bucks so guess you get what you get. Also, the keyboard and mouse quality is less than a dollar store toy. Flimsy lightweight /thin plastic. Going direct to recycle bin. Once I connected my cisco wireless into it I was able to download the updates and begin accessing the internet. So far its doing fine. On a more positive note - The shipping box was very good and components very well protected with inflated casing.

I'll start by saying that I don't use this for gaming. I do use it for processing pictures on photoshop, surfing the internet, word processing, etc. For that it works terrifically. The i7 processor with the 16gb of ram works very fast. The fan is so silent that I had to open it up to verify that it was working.

Comes as advertised, had me spooked for a minute with the i5 processor sticker but had the i7 in it. 16gb of ram was ddr3 with 1333Mhz which isn't great but not bad for the price. Came as advertised booted right up and was easy to use. No issues with the fan. The proprietary power supply and motherboard will likely be an issue later on but at the moment this is great.
I bought this so i could run Photoshop for a college class. I put a GT-730 graphics card in it and it is working perfect so far

Things seemed to be going well for a week.  I then put my trust in storing data on the 2TB hard drive to free the solid state drive up for the operating system.  The drive crashed and would suddenly no longer boot.  I had to remove it from the PC and make the necessary changes in the bios.  So now I'm out of a storage device and more importantly the art/music data I had created.
I really appreciate the Bargain_r_us2 customer service. Even though I didn't keep this computer because it was noisy, they were swift at enabling that I do a quick return. Thank you!

Not sure I can say anything more then my Title. This is a great little Computer for the money. The Processor is a couple of years old but between the 2 hard drives and memory you cannot go wrong for the price. I would definitely recommend to friends and family!

This computer is great so far for my business. Two things to note, it came with a different but better CPU (i7-4790) instead of the i7-4770 and I would have loved to have had an HDMI adapter in the box. I only use display port on high end gaming computers.
Decent quality good cable management the only problem I have is the mouse and keyboard that came with the PC was broken but thank God I ordered a new set at the same time.

I initially received the wrong computer.  While it was frustrating, hear me out. I got the wrong computer at 3pm on a Thursday. I called Stalliontek. I had the right computer by 9am the next day. I am in Alabama, they are in Maryland. Let that sink in. The computer itself is fantastic with the usb 3.0 on the front and is super fast and extremely quiet. Looks brand new. Quality product. Quality product. Mine came with the wifi dongle and the hdmi adapter.

It handles heavy usage very well. I can run some pretty CPU, RAM and surprisingly GPU intensive games. It can run basically any application, I wouldn’t count on it for gaming use but I can run many games. All specifications are true. It’s very very quiet, I can keep it running all night without any issues even on high usage (which I wouldn’t recommend but it still works). The SSD is very nice, but the 2TB additional drive makes the PC amazing. For the price, it’s a truly amazing PC.

I bought many of theses HP refurbished units in the past years, it's really awesome for the price, super fast. Just be aware that given that it's refurbished there is a higher risk of the motherboard to suddenly die, when that happens you're out of luck, it has no warranty and you have to dump the computer, you could salvage the data from the hard-drive. It happened to me on 2 computers after using it about a year, while many are still going strong after many years.

Its been a week and this machine has work perfectly for what I needed it for. I use this computer as a media server for Plex. This computer has improved my experience with transcoding outside my network. The only thing that was a negative was the the internal harddrive was not recognized so I had to get the hard drive recognized and everything was smooth.

I like the unit as a whole and the size is great. Speed is fast enough for my needs this far.
What I do not like......No HDMI adapter in the box at all. As other reviews have stated they left that out and it was crucial for my use with an HD TV as a monitor. Stalliontek told me they've fixed the issue but I am sure they told the last customer the same tale. So a Best buy trip and $20 additional dollars later I got her running the way I intended. Buyer beware if you need the HDMI adapter prepare for it to not be included.......

This thing is great.  The internals were so clean you would have thought it was brand new.  I'm well-pleased with my purchase BUT...  a few surprises were no SD card reader.  That's a pretty odd thing for a modern computer to be missing.  The other thing is this computer is never going to win a beauty contest.  She has the heart of a champion but a face you'd rather forget.  The boxy and plain appearance isn't a big deal if you put it beneath your desk.  Tremendous bang for the buck!

I purchased this PC mainly as a Blue Iris security camera software server.  Works great, running five 4K and two 4MP cams 24/7 only using and average of 44% CPU and about 20% of the memory.  The i7-4770 processor has "quick sync" with its Intel integrated  HD4600 graphics.  Add the 16GB RAM, 2TB HDD, 240GB SSD, and Win 10 Pro makes this a great deal for around $300.  A new i7-4770 processor alone is about $200! (best price I could find at this time).

Works great so far.  The keyboard and mouse were wired, and not very high quality, but I didn't buy it for the keyboard and mouse.  Everything works well, and it's plenty fast enough for my wife and her small business.  If I had to pick a reason I didn't give it five stars, it's only because it was a little dinged up on the outside.  Other than that, great for the price!

I purchased this unit in mid Feb 2019. After setup all was good and unit was fine. In late June the solid state drive failed. On the description of the unit on the AMAZON site it clearly states there is a FULL year warranty on this unit. Now TekRefurbs AND Amazon are claiming there is only 90 days!! Amazon "CLAIMS" the full year warranty is a manufacturers warranty, of course we ALL know the manufacturer has absolutely NOTHING to do with a refurbed unit. I still contacted them as I was asked to do and they confirmed to me that their warranty had expired in 2017, (and had been 3 years long). Still nothing from TekRefurbs NOR Amazon and now to make a bad issue worse, I had purchased an extended warranty when I bought the computer but when I contacted them they also told me the site says it has a year warranty so they will not honor their warranty because it doesn't go effect until the origional one expires! For whatever reason Amazon has now cancelled and refunded the extended warranty I had purchased when I purchased the machine!! I had NEVER mentioned nor asked them to cancel that!! So now I have NO hope of ever getting this covered. Still all I get from TekRefurbs AND Amazon is that the full year warranty is "manufacturer" warranty! This is a PRIME example of the beginning of the decline of Amazon. I know as much of my few thousand dollars have already started being spent elsewhere.!!

I sent an email to the company about a software issue I resolved on my own, no problem.  I did not hear back from them, however.  I am wondering about that if I ever need tech support.

The key board is the cheapest of cheap, which I read about in the reviews and was prepared for.

The computer set up was easy and it is working great.  I am very satisfied with my purchase.

First PC was defective, but Stalliontek customer support responded and sent out a second PC that worked perfectly.  This unit is fast, quiet and with an updated Win10 OS is quite easy to use compared to older Windows operating systems. Upon receiving any reconditioned computer, make sure you check all the hardware ports for functionality and do the system updates before setting it up. Should give you years of safe and efficient usage.

This is actually a 600 G1, not an 800 G1. However, I still rank it top notch. It came already with a username and no password, hence I'm knocking a star off. If it had come ready to set up, it'd be 5 stars easy. When a PC is already setup, it takes so much longer to go back and figure out what they did and fix things the way you need them.

I've ordered numerous of these for clients. With the SSD, WiFi and 2nd HDD they are a great price for the value. Even the the I7 processors are 4th gen the performance is great when paired with the SSD drive. Don't expect them to be in perfect condition but I haven't had any of my clients complain.
These machines have room for additional drives if needed.

Bought this PC for a video surveillance application (Blue Iris), and it doesn't have any trouble keeping up with a dozen 5M pixel cameras. However, the holes that give access to the connectors on the back sheet metal, were misaligned in such a way that it was impossible to plug in the Ethernet or video cables. I had to remove the mother board and insert spacers to make them match up well enough to plug in. These makes me wonder about the thoroughness of the testing after it was refurbished.

This product arrived yesterday and has worked fine so far. The shipping box was undamaged and contained the computer, a keyboard, power cord and a wifi USB adapter. I checked the specs and it was as advertised. It did not come with the vga to hdmi connector (-1 star), which is no a problem because I am adding a low profile video card which has hdmi along with sound. The Windows 10 pro key provided worked just fine. All in all it is a fast, quiet computer and quite the bang for the buck. I would recommend to to a friend.

This is a refurb, so I expected it to be a little "rough around the edges".
The unit was a lot cleaner than I expected.

The motherboard had been seated a little high in the rear, making the ports essentially inaccessible.  A few turns of  a half-dozen torx screws later and it was as it should be.

A few parts were missing from the shipment, an the supplied keyboard was broken.  The vendor. MicroBee (ComSales)  fixed everything without any problem.  They answered the support line within a minute, and resolved all of my issues. The replacements/missing parts were fedexed to me so I had them within a couple of days of my original shipment arriving.

Very happy, and I would certainly do business with them again!  Nothing in this world is perfect, but we can make it better by doing better. MicroBee did better!

My unit arrived in very decent shape. Everything worked. Did not like the fact that the user, Owner, was already set up and the computer name was set up. I really want to reinstall everything from scratch but am concerned that I might have issues with the licensing key.

Two corrections on the stated config:
  #1 CPU in my unit is actually a Core i7-4790 (a slight improvement over the stated i7-4770).
  #2 Although the WiFi yin yang symbol is displayed next to the image of the computer on the web page, there was no wi-fi dongle in the box (a slight disappointment - you lost a star for that).

So I ordered the listed computer.  Read all the reviews and was hoping that I was not going to be one of the customers that did not receive the HDMI adapter.  Of course I did not receive it.  On top of that the computer once turned on and hooked up right made a loud noise over and over.  Given the fact it was late I waited till the next morning to try and install everything.  The next morning the computer was making an additional sound on top of the other clicks.  Once setup the Windows key did not work.  I restarted the computer and after I entered my password the screen would just go black and nothing would happen.  I called Amazon and they said they can only help with power problems.  With that we did a 3 way call to the manufacturer.  After having him look up the product he said that the warranty EXPIRED ON THIS IN 2014!  How is that even possible?  I literally just received the computer the day before, and on top of that I was shipped what I can only imagine is someone else return as the windows key was already taken.  Not sure if this is Amazons fault or the manufacturer.  I'm lead to believe it's Amazons as I would hope the manufacturer would not have computers that have expired warranties on their shelves.  I told them I would like to give them a second try and ship me one that has a NEW warranty and with the HDMI adapter, and the Amazon rep told me she could not guarantee that.  So basically my only option was to ship back for a refund.  BEWARE to all who buy this computer, even if it is working I would still call in and make sure your warranty is not EXPIRED! I have never left a negative review but I feel this was so bad I had to.

The packaging was secured and the PC was in great shape.  It does show wear and tear, but it's a refurbished PC and that's to be expected.  The price was right on for the specs and I didn't want to make a purchase for a new system because it's too much.  We had an older Dell PC that lasted us from 2009 and I gotta say, we got our money's worth.  As for this desktop, it started right up and it was a clean install, meaning I had to setup Windows 10 and it comes with a digital license, so as long as this hard drive doesn't tank, I can reinstall Windows 10 as many times as I want and it will be a legit copy.  Overall, I like this purchase.

I bought this particular PC in part because it had a large SSD, and WIFI capability. It was the WIFI that put it over the other PCs advertised as similar on Amazon.

Even though it came with virtually no instructions on what to do, I was able to eventually get the thing running and the important apps installed and working, such as email, etc.

But, now i have to find and acquire a WIFI access card or something. It's a disappointment. I'd be tempted to return it, but, dang it, I live 3,000 miles away from the US land mass in Belize. Returning items is no easy task.

Other than that, what can I say? It's a PC, it runs Windows 10 Pro. All the updates installed successfully, and it will work for me for a reasonable amount of money paid out for it. It just rankles me that a simple task, such as making sure the WIFI card (or whatever was supposed to have been included) actually got stuck in the box, couldn't be done right.

I purchased this to upgrade an I7 860 so I could have Win 10 PRO without having to build a new tower.
The 3rd gen 3770k and 16g of ram still scream even though it is and 8yr old processor.
Everything works fine except the 2TB storage drive was 10 YEARS OLD!! It was a WD Black drive.
I understand that they run tests on the hardware before they ship these out but a 10yr old hard drive??
These towers were brand new in 2014 so how does a 10yr old HDD get installed as a backup?
I buy WD Black drives for every PC I have because they come with 5yr warranties. I change them out after about 3-4yrs for safety.
Be prepared to replace the WiFi adapter with something better. They sent a little USB one that didn't work very well 2 rooms away from my WiFi 6 router. I just installed a Pci express wireless card also WiFi 6
Same for the keyboard and mouse.
Those 3 items are the cheapest stuff they could find.
I'm keeping the unit but I am tossing the old HDD because you're just asking for failure.
The SSD is also a brand I've never heard of but it appeared new. It was a "Super Talent"??
This was for the wife to surf the internet, so no biggy if it's an off brand cause I'll just clone it to another SSD for backup.

I received the PC after a couple days of ordering it. Very quickly. When I opened the box I was amazed how well it was packaged. Could have dropped it off a two-story building that would not have hurt it.  The outside of the PC is in very good shape.
Open the cover inside was clean.  Powered on the PC. Windows 10 Pro was per installed waiting for me to do final setup and login.
 With windows installed on a SSD drive the system is very fast when logging in and out.

When I got the PC it should have included a Wi-Fi adapter and an HDMI adapter which were not included. Within a couple of hours after contacting the seller I was notified that they would be sent out.  Received both the next day.  I feel if you have a problem with your order the seller will take care of you. That means a lot to me.

 All in all, very happy with the order and the PC.

I've read several negative reviews. These mostly had to do with not working out of the box or no HDMI etc. Everyone must be aware that these machines are sold by different computer refurbishers... you need to check them out. I bought from StallionTek back in Jan `19  and have had no problems. Worked well out of the box and had HDMI, SSD, i7 CPU etc.  I see a number are sold by other hardware refurbishes. Do your homework and read the fine print and check out the reviews of the companies themselves. StallionTek had 96% positive reviews. I have not seen any recent reviews so perhaps they are no longer selling on Amazon... not sure. I see some, like the current seller, has a rating of 65% positive. That should tell you a lot.

This computer came very well packaged in one of those dedicated computer air cell packs that looks like a heavy duty pool flotation device folded over and heat sealed. The computer case had some minimal signs of prior use but nothing that would constitute what I would call "wear". Similarly inside the case was pretty clean although I could still see some dust and dirt buildup if I looked closely and shined a flashlight into the dark corners. It came with everything described in the listing, had open slots in the bus for a half height graphics card. No open memory slots so if you want to go up there you need to buy bigger sticks to replace the ones in there already.  The i7 processor is an older model that is capable but not very fast, not really anywhere near gaming capable as it sits.  I had to put in a graphics card in order to get a DVI output for our 27" touch screen my son needs for his home schooling programs.  It is fast enough to stream the lectures he has to watch as well as handle the two-way meetings he uses for some of the classes, when I added a HD camera to the mix.  Plenty of USB plugs, some 2.0 and others 3.0 (I have not bothered to try to define which is which as we are not doing anything heavy enough to stress those systems.  It booted up fine and needed minimal oversight for setting stuff up.  We have had no problems in the first 3 months since we got it.
Although it was not purchased for my boy to do gaming, he did try and discovered a significantly faster frame rate but still not good enough transfer rate to run modern graphics intensive games at a speed that satisfies him, so he is back over on his other gaming consoles for that.
The operating system is set up on the solid state drive so it boots up in about half the time of one booting from a hard drive.  And having the big HDD for long term storage is a perfect match.
I am not sure if I would buy it again or not -- I would probably keep my eye out for a similar package but with a more recent and capable generation i7 processor and matching motherboard.  The small form-size is also a bit of a challenge if you plan on dropping a few cards into the bottom end of the bus as you have to make sure they are low profile and half height as there is some room but not a lot of room on the bus.

After reading the reviews and determining that I would either be fine, or not at all... I decided to take the 50/50 chance of receiving a decent tower.

Ordered from Stalliontek along with a 1030 low profile GPU from NewEgg with hopes of using this as my 4K capable living room media PC.
I first decided to plug it to a known, working monitor I pulled from my gaming PC set-up.  There was NO HDMI port as advertised, nor any HDMI adapter included.  Ok.. I read reviews of this happening but no worries as my monitor ALSO takes display port (which the tower had two of) and I was going to use the 1030 GPU's HDMI port when I eventually connected this to my living room TV anyway.

While hooking everything up, I smelled the familiar smell of fresh spray paint.  Upon further investigation, I saw fresh black spots on the case where someone spray painted it black.  Ok, no biggy.... as long as the tower works I'm ok with the touched up blemishes.

Whelp, after plugging everything in and using the display port from the MOBO to my known working monitor, there was no signal.  The PC turned on, but no boot, no bios splash screen nothing.  I started, restarted... plugged, unplugged... I tried it all.
Figured, well... maybe it's the display ports that are bad on the MOBO (I tried both of them).  Plugged in my brand spanking new 1030 GPU and used its HDMI port.
No luck with that as well. Still no boot, BIOS splash screen.. nadda

On top of the MAJOR problem of not booting, there was no HDMI adapter, the case was spray painted AND I was unable to find/locate the windows serial number that a few reviews said was attached to the tower.  Upon inspecting the entirety of the case, I also found a poorly removed/scraped previous OS and windows key label.

I build gaming PC's, but I took a chance on this one because I received $200 in Amazon gift cards recently which made this a decent buy for me for $199 out of pocket.
I will also add that I checked for any loose connections, memory etc that may have come loose in shipping, but came up empty handed.
This PC was just DOA.  Also worth noting to those interested, there is no additional room on the MOBO for another SATA connection.  There are 3 total... one for Disc reader, one for SSD boot drive and one for HDD storage drive.

Kudos to the seller for making the return easy at least. So thanks!

I received computer carefully packaged in bubble wrap. Unwrapped to find computer in great physical condition, few minor dents.
I opened case to add nvidia video card and found interior clean no dust bunnies, looked new.
I connected it up and checked BIOS version, it was 8 years old. No problem, went to HP website found the most current and downloaded and updated.
I found the OS was Win 10 educator pro, OK..? No problem, I blow away pre-installed OS's anyway. I reloaded Win 10 pro w/current ver 21H2.
I also noticed no COA attached to the computer but computer has digital license so no big deal.

The supplied USB key bluetooth/wi-fi adapter works great. Windows found and installed it immediately. I paired my headphones to it for a quick test, works fine.
I am using the keyboard & mouse supplied w/computer. I love the actuation force for the keys a little stiffer than other keyboards. I'm not impressed w/the mouse.

Computer used for replacement in den. Old Dell is acting up so I just replaced it, hardware problem maybe.

Computer arrived in doublelayer cardboard box, no shipping damage.
In the box:
- computer
- power cord
- keyboard/mouse set
- usb WiFi/bluetooth
- adapter, male display port to female HDMI

Overall impression good. Love the quicker processor! I would buy another.

This is easily the best technology purchase I have made in years.

I bought it to replace my ACER laptop which I bought six years ago. This laptop still works fine but I could see that it was struggling to handle multiple open browser windows.  I often have 12+ windows open across three browsers each.  My Acer is a core i5 4300m, 6GB RAM machine - which was admittedly fast in 2012.

Fast forward to this HP desktop. It's super-fast with its 240GB SSD which I think makes all the difference.  The set up with Win 10 Pro was so easy.  The machine is not pre-configured to your product key but instead to some generic key. When you unpack the box, the product key is clearly visible stuck on the back of the machine.  Just write it down and save it somewhere safe. When Win 10 comes up, try and customize it - like the screen or mouse.  It then prompts you for the product key.  And you're done.

When you set up your browsers, choose the option where they remember all your open windows.  The magic is when you restart the machine and click on your favorite browser.  All those browser windows display instantly, yes, instantly.  Opening a document or saving it is also instant.  The SSD is one of the best technology inventions ever.

This desktop practically makes no sound at all.  It's sitting on the floor of my home office.  Also, it freed up valuable space on my desk.  Previously, I had my laptop sitting next to my desk lamp.  Notice how much free space I now have.

The machine comes with sufficient numbers of USB ports that I put away the two dongle USB hubs for my laptop.  It also comes with a USB adapter for WiFi which is plug and play.  Also an adapter to convert your video port into HDMI.

All in all, I'm super impressed with the product.  Great value too, considering that new machines with this configuration cost hundreds more.

Just got it this today.  Popped the lid to look inside, everything is tight and in place.  No evidence of damage or whatever.  Fired it up and started my customizations.  So far everything is working fine.  The refurbisher did try to paint over some cosmetic scratches and that's fine but what I am interested in is the condition of the system and so far its fine. Its a couple of notches above my current system so looking for performance improvement with heavy lifting tasks.  Will come back later to update but so far this seems to be good value over a new system.

Update - 4/26/2019 - Have been using now for a few weeks and it seems to be running as expected.  My HP desktop that was failing was able to repair (CPU fan blade had splintered and it cleared) so I have two really good systems.  Since I am not a gamer, the limitation on the video adaptor doesn't concern me.  Since my old system is working again, I can phase in the installation of apps as time permits.  I have read the stories of some folks getting DOA units but mine was solid out of the box.  I am good.

reviews.review_body:
UPDATE October 2022: This Chromebook is no longer supported by Google.
Each device has an Auto Update Expiration (AUE) date. We encourage you to check the AUE dates of devices before your purchase.

Chromebooks, Chromebases, and Chromeboxes automatically manage updates so that your device has the latest software and security features. To check your Auto Update Expiration (AUE) date:

At the bottom right, select the time and then Settings .
At the bottom left, select About ChromeOS.
Select Additional details.
In the “Update schedule” section, you’ll find when your Chromebook will receive its last update.
_____________________________________________________________________________________

It seems this Chromebook has a problem with a disappearing cursor.  You have to logout completely for the cursor to reappear. Horribly aggravating and I feel the 2018 Chromebook should not be sold for that very reason.  Do a Google search on Chromebook Cursor and you will find lengthy discussions on the issue for 11 inch Dell Chromebooks built in 2018.

UPDATE: After a long while, the disappearing cursor is not happening anymore.
Got it for my granddaughter she said no problems ...
Love this notebook. Chromebook is a wonderful, simple operating system!
review_topics: Chromebook operating systeminput: I love this little laptop
there are a couple of problems. 1. The battery life is slightly less than advertised. I get about 7 full hours of use
before it gets to 20 percent and time to plug it in. 2. Acer just recently pushed out a driver update to support Cortana
after the windows 10 anniversary edition update. It has since hosed the ability for me to use my microphone in skype and other programs. I have contacted Acer support

and this appears to be a known issue. It is also mentioned in their support forum. They are waiting for an update from Microsoft to fix this. I will try to edit my review after I see if the next windows update resolves this issue. 3. The screen could be brighter. 4. The keyboard is kind of cheap. It feels kind of mushy
and the backspace key is very small. Overall I love the laptop
and the value for the price. I am hoping that the next windows update
or a bios update will fix the mic issue.output: Cortana

reviews.review_body: this is my third chromebook. should have bought another ACER. Ths DEll is the slowest of all the and the ACER is over three years old.

I really like chromebook, but these so-called "refurbished" units need to be pulled from the shelf & thrown in the trash. I sent back the first one I received and had a replacement sent to me. Both of them had the same problem.... powers on long enough to go through the setup, then it just shuts down. No power, no lights, nada, nothing. I spent an hour on the phone with Amazon and Dell support who finally said it was "bad hardware" so they sent me another one. And....you guessed it, the 2nd one did the exact same thing. Another person I know said he's tried 3 of them and they all had the exact same problem. So, why is Amazon letting this junk continue to be sold just to have frustrated customers and product returns???

Great laptop for all ages. I get annoyed when people say these are only for kids. I'm 30 and bought this for myself while I'm in school. All I do is browse the internet myself anyway. All my other media is on my Android phone. It's a great buy for us adults who are going back to school or just people who use the internet.

Not at all happy with this chrome book. Doesn’t let me get past the first page to start it up. Would not recommend

I ordered and paid for a brand new chromebook.
This was not a new chromebook.  It is used with fingerprints all over the case and screen.
This was a completely bad purchase.

Space saver and provide all functions

The quality of this machine was not what I expected. At this point, it is a $300 brick. The keyboard stopped working and I was told that it would cost $125 to replace the parts. Paperweight would be a better investment.
My grandson loves it!

small keyboardinput: I've never had an HP laptop before
but I've heard good things about them. The HP Pavilion g6-1c43nr is a mid-range laptop that offers a good value for the price. It features a 15.6-inch display
and a 500GB hard drive. The laptop is also equipped with a webcam
and speakers. The HP Pavilion g6-1c43nr is a good choice for students
and business travelers who need a portable computer that can handle basic tasks such as web browsing
and word processing. It's also a good choice for gamers who are on a budget. The laptop's 15.6-inch display is large enough for comfortable viewing
and the Intel Core i3 processor provides enough power for most tasks. The 4GB of RAM is also sufficient for most users
and the 500GB hard drive provides plenty of storage space for files
and videos. The HP Pavilion g6-1c43nr is a good value for the price. It's a well-built laptop that offers good performance and features for the price.output: HP laptop

reviews.review_body: Excellent product. Unpacked it, plugged it in and it worked perfectly. Battery charged quickly.
Battery doesn’t hold a charge .
review_topics: this laptop is a great value for the money. I am very happy with it after about six months. I expected less. I mainly use the laptop for: - writing - research - video calls - web browsing - paying bills I chose the Asus - K53E because I wanted a laptop with a large screen. I bought one with 4 gig of RAM and a 500 gig HD because that is the minimum I would recommend for a computer to be useful. I upgraded the operating system from Windows 7 Starter to Windows 7 Professional. The upgrade cost about $100. I also upgraded the video card from the built-in Intel HD Graphics to nVidia GeForce GT 540M ($50). Both upgrades were easy to do and improved the performance and usability of the computer. I bought the laptop on sale at a local computer store. It came with a 1 year warranty from Asus

and a 1 year warranty from the store. I also bought an extended 2 year warranty from the store that covers hardware and software issues. I recommend a decent extended warranty. Computer hardware is not as reliable as it used to be.output: Asus - K53E

reviews.review_body: My 14 year old son hasn’t broke it after dropping it 5 times, I highly recommend!

For the amount I paid, it wasn't worth it.  I am a college student: Word does not work right, most Apps don't work right.  I would not recommend buying it at all unless all you want to do is go on Facebook and read e-mails.

I thought this chrome book use for touch.

It’s very disappointing
Feels a bit cheap, but this is a great, affordable tool for my kids online homeworks. Love chromebooks!!!!
Bought two of these at Christmas for our teenage girls and they loved it!

This product was advertised as new. When I opened it, there were two user profiles already set up (see photo) and the language was set for a non-English language. When I called Amazon, they sent me to Dell. When I called Dell, they said the computer (which I purchased on 9/21/19) was originally purchased/set up in June.

I am returning this. I bought it for my kid. Kids can be rough on equipment, so I want to give him the benefit of starting with new equipment. Also, who knows what the prior owner did with it.

This seller is a scumbag. Computer was freezing over and over while I was trying to set it up. I knew something wasn’t right. I wasted over TWO HOURS trying to get this thing setup. I call dell support and sure enough this laptop is NOT NEW.  It was purchased from Best Buy originally over 245 days ago. Even after a google “powerwash” whatever the $@&! lame excuse that is for a reset the laptop was STILL crashing. Screw you Happy Ranger/Oceanus. Buy new tech in a store where you can clearly see it’s new.
Love this monitor, got it as a second display for my work laptop. Love the extra screen space!
This chromebook is a great purchase for my needs. The price was excellent and delivery was a breez.
purchase for grandson for school. exceeded all expectations. Chromebook is not designed for gaming, hence no rating entered for that category.
it is to be used for business and we find it to be very user friendly and easy to manipulate
Love this machine.  For the money can’t be beat. Not great hi def.  but really clear and a great product.
household
I had a mac desktop for 8 years and it crashed. I had to get something  inexpensive fast, so I bought this one. I absolutely love it.
Great product for school work!! I am a college student and wanted something small to take on the go! It is just what I was looking for.

Most people do not fully understand what a Chromebook is or is not. If you know what to expect then this is a nice compact option. Mostly people who have problems with Chromebooks don't realize they are different from a Windows or a Mac. This is much more like a smart phone that looks like a laptop. A shrewd person will be able to do most anything they need to do on this platform. It's not for gamers or artists, or anyone who needs to use Windows/Apple OS. This is a perfect computer for 99% of what most people get a computer for.

I bought this chromebook because of its price and my needs. I feel like chrome books get a bad rep, because people always want more for less. I am a graduate student who needed a lightweight computer (its super light) because I am placed many different places. I primarily use the google drive function and just surf/use for streaming. It won't run complex games, nor do you have the ability to really use as many program functions like on a pc (you don't carve a turkey with a butter knife, so don't use a chromebook to run complex programs). It has AMAZING battery life! I used to have a $1100 notebook that was lucky to survive 2 hours, this lasts all day on a single charge, easily around 8 hours of use. You should know by now that you also need internet for everything except you can edit docs offline. If you want nice leisure computer to do some light work and streaming, I highly recommend it.

reviews.review_body: This is advertised as having the Mediatek MT6592 chipset. This was release a decade ago (2013), and despite being an octa-core it was didn't perform well for it's time either. Essentially newly packaged e-waste.
Very slow. Don't has dual band WIFI . Shows an icon of 4G with inserted SIM card , but internet too slow, impossible to use. The battery lasts about 1-1.5 hour . I recommend not to go near it.

Was not expecting much from a tablet costing $68 including tax, and running the outdated Android 10. Just wanted a workhorse tablet to read ebooks on.

However, there is no sim card / TF card slot, although the website description says: "Card Slot: Dual Card Slot (Two sim cards and one TF card can be installed at the same time)."

On first boot, the tablet opened directly to the home screen with a desktop background of flying birds, not to the expected Android first-time set-up screen.

Settings > about tablet confirms 64 GB of on board storage, but could not find a way to confirm amount of RAM.

Battery runs down shockingly fast, even when the tablet is idle. Could not find a way to confirm battery size.

Extremely rapid battery drain and the lack of the promised external storage slot are dealbreakers for me.

When I tried to return this item, I discovered that I would be expected to pay for return shipping to China, so I am stuck with a ~$70 paperweight. Extremely disappointed.

Cannot recommend item or seller, unfortunately.

UPDATE:

Was on Alibaba and saw this tablet for around half the price I paid here. Scrolled through the photos and discovered that the top of this tablet, at the camera end, is removable and reveals...SIM CARD SLOTS! At a loss as to why this information was not included in the product manual that came with the tablet, nor in the product photos on Amazon, or, indeed, on the tablet itself. But, I am retracting part of the above review, and adding a star since the product is as described.

Battery life is still abysmal though, so can't recommend, unfortunately, unless you plan to keep it connected to its charger while using, which kind of defeats the purpose of a portable tablet.

But, SIM CARD SLOTS! *tiny high five*

reviews.review_body: Terrible laptop.  Gives me all sorts of problems.  I wish I spent my money on a better one.

Purchased two days ago, arrived yesterday, and so this review is NOT based on longevity (I'll come back in a month or two for that), but on features, build quality, and overall feel. Build quality out of the box is good. Body is aluminum and has a nice MacBook (I have an older Mac Air) feel to it. Not much flex when typing (I'm using it for this review), chiclet keys have a good feel to them, and not too cramped, which I like. Back-lit keys are a necessity for me (once you've had them, you never want one without) and this has silver keys with a white backlight. Very clean look. Screen looks great, full HD 1080p, which on a 15" screen is perfect (4k just seems like overkill on a small screen). Boots FAST, shuts down fast, of course with a solid state hard drive (the future of all computers) no hard drive bottleneck. Fingerprint scanner (on right side near the "-" button works most of the time, but honestly, putting in a 4 digit pin is just about as fast. BIG touchpad, with great response. And finally, HP did it right with the Intel i5 and i7 (not Ryzen) models, room to expand. Yes, just pop the bottom cover off, and "voila!", you have a spare hard drive bay, and guess what, they installed a single 8GB stick of ram and left the other ram slot empty, so no ditching your existing ram to upgrade. Just purchase another 8GB stick of DDR4 laptop ram and pop it in, 16GB. One downside is the empty hard drive bay does not have the cable you need to go from hard drive to motherboard, and I'm still not sure where to get it. If you find one post below and let me know. Okay, that's it...with 18 months same as cash, this is a great laptop. Sell your old one on eBay! Hope this helps. :)
I love
review_topics: it's perfect for work and play.

reviews.review_body: Great laptop

It’s missing some of the features of the newer HP Envy models sold in stores like Best Buy, but it’s a little cheaper. It doesn’t have a camera kill switch or a adjustable keyboard light, and it has an anti-skid pad across the top front which is a bit unappealing. However, it’s a serviceable mid range laptop. Works in terms of not being trapped in Windows 10 S. It also has decent battery life (5ish hours of streaming on battery before dropping under 10%). Reliable, but not lightning fast. If you’re interested in gaming, it can run some older games just fine; Diablo 3 ran well at typical settings, Starcraft 2 ran, but was ugly.

Bought this laptop for my son, who is a college student and was interested in a touchscreen laptop. After 3 weeks, the touchscreen stopped working along with the touchpad, gyroscopic driver, and keyboard. After countless hours of talking to customer service from HP and even letting them have remote-access, they simply do not want to help. In addition, they kept telling me about the raving reviews they had for the laptop. Well, looks like I'm writing the first review. After this debacle, I wouldn't recommend this product or company to any of my fellow Amazon customers. Please consider purchasing a different laptop from a different company who will actually provide decent service.

PS: HP will refuse to help you unless you've purchased the laptop from HP, so this is in no means Amazon's fault. Amazon's hands are tied in this situation and HP simply sold me a faulty product and will not admit it or replace it in a timely manner.

This was replacing a 5+ year old laptop for me so anything new was going to feel fast, but this laptop checks all the boxes for me. I don't do anything very taxing on it but it is very snappy for web browsing, word processing, and even some light photo editing. It is very thin and lightweight and has good battery life. Personally I don't find the 360 "tablet" mode very useful as it feels awkward to hold since the keyboard flips around the back of the screen but the mode works fine if you're into that. Only problem I've had with it was the fingerprint scanner stopped working after a forced update, but I was able to revert back to the previous fingerprint scanner driver and have no problems since.

Ordered in to Cape Town. Took 7 days total and was a super smooth process. This is a work machine upgrade from a Dell G3. Very happy with my purchase and my work collogues I'm sure will go the same route when upgrading laptops.

First off, does NOT have 4x USB slots like they say, just 3x USB 3.1.  Second, the software for the lighting effects stop working and you're stuck with a rainbow effect keyboard as soon as you update.  Thirdly, which has nothing to do with the laptop other than it uses it, Windows 11 doesn't allow you to close the laptop lid and keep laptop functional unless you have an external mouse attached, so no auto updates of any kind unless you're laptop screen is on...nice job Windows on being counterproductive trying to be a "power saver".
Video Player is loading.

The hardware in the laptop itself is as expected and great. The RTX 3060 In this is the Max-P higher wattage variety. Straight out of the box it benchmarks well, and will play games without much issue

*My main gripe with this was related to gaming. Admittedly I jumped into buying this a bit negligently. This model includes the 144hz 1080p LCD. It's not color accurate and it has a painstaking 25ms input delay!

Being sensitive to ghosting, I cannot keep this machine.

Just do your research before purchasing. The 165hz and 300hz models exhibit much better color accuracy AND 1ms input lag.

FINAL NOTE:
The backlight bleed is horrible on my particular machine. See my attached images.

Portátil optimizado para juegos, con la RTX 3070 sale la gran mayoría de juegos en alta calidad y rápido

This laptop sits on my desk and is gently used to be used for editing social media content. 4 months in and the keyboard started spamming the motherboard with "A" key intermittently. I'm a computer engineer and diagnosed the issue as a faulty keyboard chipset. Asus refused ANY sort of support for an issue that is clearly not the fault of the user. A laptop of this price tag that becomes unusable with its built in keyboard is surprising to say the least. Other aspects of this laptop are good so it's quite a shame that this is my first and will be my last Asus laptop.

Buy from another vendor that will actually back their products.

I've lost wifi functionality twice where it decided to uninstall drivers randomly.

Should have bought a ps5 and a MacBook instead

Review is for Asus ROG Strix G513QM Ryzen 5900HX and RTX 3060. This is a great gaming laptop, if you buy on sale or under MSRP (1499usd). Ryzen 5900HX is top AMD CPU for laptop, good performance but a bit hot. RTX 3060 6GB 130W, powerfull enough to play 1080p most AAA games at good FPS. 3DMark Time Spy about 8927 with fan Turbo Mode. SSD is SK Hynix m2 nvme PCIe 3.0 x4 3597/2946Mbps. Panel is low range IPS-Level 144hz, good enough.
You can disable discrete GPU and use only iGPU to save battery (about 7-8h videos and web browsing).

CONS:
- Asus use low performance RAM Samsung DDR4 8GB 3200 1Rx16, same problem than Asus ROG Advance and Legion 5 pro (Jarrod's laptops review).

I love this laptop, but I've had a couple problems. There is only windows modern standby (S3) available for sleep modes  while plugged in and this thing is constantly turning on my display and fans at night. If it's not in your bedroom - probably not a problem. But it's bad enough for me to knock a star off.

Second - a few times for a few months after it arrived, it would hard lockup while sleeping. No input would wake it and I would have to shut it down with the power button. Don't know if it was some kind of bios or driver issue, but it seems to have gone away and haven't had to do that for quite some time now.

As for the pros - It's a beast of a machine with an RTX3070 and a ryzen processor which are kind of hard to find together. The screen is beautiful. The keyboard is functional but not particularly good or bad. Wifi and Bluetooth are similarly passable. RAM is kind of low on this model and you'll want to upgrade. Note that it contains two 8GB sticks, not a single 16GB so if you want 32GB you need two 16's. M2 socket to add a harddrive is easy to use, but the case is a little challenging to open. Make sure to watch an instruction video.

I bought the Strix in February of 2022, it's now October. Ten months in, and this laptop has been great, keeping up with my friends' desktop builds and outperforming many of them. I run Tarkov, Rust, Ready or Not, and very long games of Civ 6, Hearts of Iron 4, and Cities Skylines with no issue. This laptop performs very well, though it has increased in price considerably.

It is a gaming PC, so I won't complain about the processing power and ability to take heavy load. But there are countless issues with hardware. There is no webcam for a laptop that costs this much, and yet any external camera won't work reliably. Disconnects me automatically after a few minutes. I failed multiple interviews because of this. Now it seems like there is a problem with wifi as well. Everytime it sleeps, the connection loses, and I can not find any network unless I restart. Also, the performance is getting slow with every update. So I am not sure what to do with this overpriced junk

review_topics: Excellent performance for a very good price.

reviews.review_body:
I am a creative professional, who needed a laptop to edit, pictures, videos, make some motion design stuff and experiment with 3D stuff. Now I was coming from an all in one desktop set up called Lenovo 520, which limited me from trying many things, such as 3d but it was good enough for 1080p video editing.

However since I was always on the move with clients, I needed something portable, reliable and strong enough to handle almost everything I throw at it, I was looking at zephyrus g14,g15, legion 5 pro and many laptops in the same class but this one stuck out to me cuz it was giving the best processor available at the time, 5900HX, and the graphic card I wanted, RTX 3070.

Now even though I bought this laptop for professional creative work, this laptop is a gaming BEAST, it handles everything with so much ease, and does it really well. Almost all games are able to achieve higher than 100fps, which is insane, especially for someone like me who has played on consoles all his life, 30fps was usually the limit but theres so many possibilities with a gaming computer.

As for my creative work, it handles everything like a champ! even on battery and igpu turned on it performs extremely well and I see almost no issues, when working on photoshop, or editing my videos.

However not everything is perfect, while this laptop is great in almost all regards, I am often really worried about its longevity. I expect to use this machine for at least 5 years, my issue comes down to how the heat is handled or how toasty it actually gets. I don't mind too much fan noise cuz I have my headphones plugged in and its non existent to me, but while I game on performance mode, which is the default profile setting for cpu,gpu and the fans, I see temperatures around 80 or sometimes even 85 while playing Witcher 3, on high settings, I bring it down to medium settings and it almost makes no big difference, and sometimes even in my creator tasks which aren't very demanding, it again reaches around 70 degrees celcius. I have however found a solution to this, and use manual profile, which does get a bit loud but the temps are great. however I do worry about the fans and their lifespan cuz of it. you can always get a cooling pad and help yourself as well. i heard people get great results from that as well.

in conclusion, the best laptop I have tried, amazing performance, amazing size and fun to play on. worth it in my use case, only downside being the temperatures but you can work around the problem in various ways!

It's able to run two high graphics demand games at once while streaming, which I tested just to see what limits it might have. The only thing I feel should be pointed out is that after downloading the newest Nvidia drivers it will no longer be able to run in turbo without crashing. Be aware and stick to the Nvidia drivers that are compatible to avoid this. Version 466.11 is the latest compatible version.

The computer runs hot, but that's to be expected from a laptop trying to run the way it does. My advice is buy a cooling pad and never run it without it. Ventilate it properly -this is not a laptop to sit in your lap or on fabric. It will damage itself with the heat buildup if you don't properly care for it.

Overall I'm extremely pleased with it.

I didn't bought a gaming laptop in years because they were obnoxiously heavy and loud. I'm really surprised that a light laptop can pack more power than my old tower.

The pro :
*The performance is amazing. It's really an out of this world experience to have something that light that pack more power than a ps5, playing AAA games at max setting.
*Great value (well it's expensive but nowadays, finding a 3070 is not cheap either)
*Really great screen, smooth 300hz experience is amazing
*The sound is very good for a laptop, usually it's crap
*I really find the keyboard spaced out and confortable for my big old hands
*The Wifi is great
*Rgb is fun if you're into that

The con:
-A kind of "gaming look". As a professional, i would have preferred a more muted look but the zephyrus is hard to find those days.
-No webcam (but you get a finer bezel, for me it's worth it)

This computer is a beast. What I was really impressed with is how long you can use it on battery if you aren’t doing heavy gaming. You can set it to igpu mode which will let it last 8-9 hours on battery as long as you put it on silent mode. For streaming, browsing and doing documents it should last at least 6 hours.

I really wanted a 1440p screen but with this screen at 300hz it’s beautiful! I’m not a big fan of LCD but it’s a very high quality screen. Pictures don’t do it justice. If I want 4K I’ll just hook it up to a TV.

I like that it’s a very small 15’ laptop. It’s not chunky at all and it’s not over designed. I thought I would have heat issues with a 3070 but the laptop handles the heat very well. It’s not burning my legs when gaming.

I’ve had no problem playing all my games maxed out. A lot of the benchmarks I see for this use poorly optimized games so it’s not fair to this laptop.

The keyboard is nice. I didn’t want a mechanical keyboard because they get noisy. With LEDs off on everything it looks low profile. It’s really easy to turn the LEDs and to customize.

I really haven’t seen any bottlenecks for what I use it for. This laptop is the sweet spot. In my opinion this is better designed than the Zephyrus because the rear heat exhaust isn’t hitting the screen.

Only thing I would have liked to see is a numpad with the keyboard and an aluminum frame.

reviews.review_body:
Being my first Mini Computer I was impressed with the size vs advertised specs.  To my surprise after hooking the machine up everything seemed to be in order and functioning.  UNTIL!!!

Literally days before the unit's 90days with me arrived, disaster.  Unit boots, black screen, BOIS.  Anytime and Every time.  Tried all the troubleshooting I could come across.  So as i gave up hope and contacted Amazon (still 2 days it it's 90th with me), who informed me they would not issue a replacement nor would they accept the unit as a return.  They instructed me to research the manufacture myself for contact info.  Way you go Amazon CS you really followed through here (Amazon CS did stay true to themselves - BECAUSE THEY TREAT ALL MY RECENT ISSUE LIKE THIS).  Long story make slightly shorter, after finally finding some link/email for manufacture but received no response  from them (1month to date).  The seller was very reluctant to offer their help it seems.  Partly due to there being no data recovery policy in place for this unit and or situations similar to mine. So far best offer to fix this is 1.)I pay for shipping to manufacture, and SUBMIT the bill to seller for reimbursement 2.)Some time after shipping unit to manufacture and submitting proof to seller, SELLER will send me a similar replacement unit as soon as they can. (NO TURN AROUND TIMES GIVEN FOR ANY OF THE 2 ABOVE ACTIONS OR FOLLOWING) 3. Instructed to remove the SSD from the defective unit and connect it to another machine somewhere to retrieve my info - Who ever thought of that procedure and implemented it in real life situations needs a vacation.  LONG TERM without peanut spending money.

The connector on the cable for the interface for the second SSD to the MB for the cable  is of poor design. It was not possible to insert the connector into the connector on the MB because it flexed. It  damaged the connector on the MB

reviews.review_body:
I’ve never had an ASUS laptop before so I wasn’t sure how it was going to feel, it felt great. Trackpad is responsive, but a bit loud. It’s been 2 Years with this laptop all through college and airports and It’s held up great! The battery is not very great and you really need to bring the charger everywhere you go unless you’re just moving rooms in your house for less than an 1 and a half. It can get annoying trying to watch Netflix or YouTube and it constantly needs to be plugged in. While gaming you definitely need to plug in or your games will run half as slowly as they should be, it’s a feature to save battery but it makes the gameplay horrible. I can say this laptop replaced my gaming desktop and I’ve used it basically everyday for 2 years, and it’s still running smooth.

I would definitely recommend getting another stick of RAM for the laptop, there’s a free slot already so you just need to get either an 8gb or 4gb stick of laptop ram depending on what you already have, just match it up and your games will be running amazingly.

It can easily play GTA V, Fortnite, Warzone, basically anything you throw at it if you play with the graphic settings. I also recommend buying a gaming mouse because using the trackpad can be impossible for certain games.

The most annoying thing about the laptop is that all the ports. 3 USBs, Ethernet, charging, is all on the left side of the computer so using wired mice and headsets can get annoying, and you have to loop it behind. Just the one complaint i have over the years.

this thing crashes constantly. battery sucks. trackpad sucks. comes with bloatware. fan is noisy.

fast, and looks nice-- when it works...

This alluring beauty didnt run without its hiccups, had a few issues updating the drivers where it would hang and lag. However it was necessary to get the best out of it. Heres what i did

1) update to the latest amd drivers. Got amd link to track the cpu n gpu usage on my phone

2) getting an extra ddr4 ram to  give this bad boy enough juice

3) exploring the settings where they have different charging modes for either UPS, balanced or full charge. Which limits the charging to 60%/80% or full charge

4) applying thermal paste

5) undervolting this monster of a machine. I find that even undervolting by 100mV via amd overdrive was good enough to reduce the thermals on it, minimising thermal throttling

got it in prime sale with 100$ sale. just best laptop at this price point.
and gtx 1650 model also has RGB keyboard.
bought this for my brother for his graduation gift. the ram is good. works efficiently. the battery life is so and so depending on how you use the laptop.
everything is cherry after new bios update...

Small and powerful, It's handled everything I've thrown at it pretty well
except Netflix or streaming video / swapping windows.
I've spent days making sure every driver is up to date, installing / resetting
drivers yet this device blue screens about once every other hour.

Gaming would be great if you didn't have to reset your PC fully every hours,
however the SSD makes resetting the computer rather fast. The BSCOD error
code is either Fatal Hardware Error, or Threat Stuck Errors, which have been
constant since purchase no matter the updates. I often update this laptop just
to see if they have resolved the issue, however no evidence points there.
